Reviews.Title: “A great holiday!”
Reviews.Author: Marcello P
Reviews.Content: There are three important factors that meet the clients who hire hotel services: service and friendliness of staff, location of the hotel and, finally, maintenance and cleanup. And these issues, the Hotel La Bourdonnais receives a score of 10. There are three important factors that meet the clients who hire hotel services: service and friendliness of staff, location of the hotel and, finally, maintenance and cleanup. And these issues, the Hotel La Bourdonnais receives a score of 10. Situated near the Eiffel Tower (10 min walk), the Metro station, souvenir shops, super markets, cafes and food in general. The reception staff were very attentive and helpful, spoke English without any problems, and some officials even tried the Portuguese! The breakfast is an honest price, in the case of my family with four people (10 euros per person) and is well connected and varied, and the place of meal is very beautiful and beautifully decorated. Cleaning and maintenance of the hotel are also very good: the room is warm and everything works perfectly and we were not bothered by the noise of the street because the soundproofing of the windows is very good. In my opinion the only item to improve the operation would extend the wi-fi to the rooms but the hotel reception the signal is excellent, as in this description of the hotel. When I return to Paris, surely choose the Hotel La Bourdonnais!

Reviews.Title: “great value for family in safe neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: EdwardColumbus
Reviews.Content: My wife and I and our two children were very pleased with the Hotel La Bourdonnais. We were able to get two double beds so we could stay together in a large room with a view of the Eiffel Tower out our window. The discount offered on the hotel website and the free breakfast with the Rick Steve's book made this a great deal. The breakfast was excellent. Hot meats, great selection of breads and pastries, fruit and several types of juices, coffees, and teas. The neighborhood was very safe too, and five minute walk to Eiffel tower and Rue Cler neighborhoods. Highly recommend this place for a great family time.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: obiwankenobi_12
Reviews.Content: We stayed in hotel La Bourdannais for two nights in March on our way to Disneyland Paris. We are a family of two adults and two children aged 6 and 5 years old. The hotel is in an excellent location and is only a ten minute walk to the Eiffel Tower and around the corner from the Ecole Militare Metro Station. There is also a supermarket right next door to the hotel which was very handy for snacks/water etc. The hotel is charming. The decor is superb. We loved the spiral staircase and the very small lift! The Staff were very friendly and helpfull. Our daughters became ill on our first night and reception very kindly gave us the loan of a push-chair so we could still manage some sight-seeing. This was very much appreciated and really made the difference to our holiday in Paris. We asked for a view of the Eiffel Tower and they honoured our request. We had a balcony on the fifth floor which gave us beautiful views of the Eiffel Tower, especially the lights display at night. Our room was spotless. I am very particular when it comes to cleaniness and I could not fault this hotel. We even had a small fridge which came in very handy when storing our daughters medicine. I have only one small problem with the room in that it was quite small and did not look anything like what we had thought we had booked on their website but the bathroom was very spacious and perfect for our needs. We had breakfast there both mornings and it was very tasty. There was plenty of choice and something for all of us to eat. The breakfast room was beautifully decorated and very french! I would definately recommend this hotel to anyone and hope to be back very soon! Many thanks again to all the Staff for your kindness and help!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Mbuvala
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here the last weekend of March 2012. Great location, 2 blocks from the Eiffel Tower and from the Metro. We chose this hotel for the location, the price range and the decor. This hotel is not fancy but it makes up for it with rustic charm and a warm staff. The elevator is tiny so if you have large items to lug up to your room, make sure you request the bottom floor! Loved this quirky little hotel. Robbie & Mare} Sarasota, FL USA

Reviews.Title: “Great location, perfect for our family vacation”
Reviews.Author: CricketNut91
Reviews.Content: I am a bit tardy in writing this review...we stayed there in June 2011! We found the hotel in the Rick Steves book. You simply cannot beat the location. The Eiffel Tower is within sight and walking distance, as is the Metro station, great cafes, Hotel Les Invalides and of course the famous Rue Cler with its shops, cafes and markets. After staying here we knew why the 7th Arrondissement is one of the top places to live in Paris. Our family, 2 parents and 2 children ages 13 and 15, stayed in the hotel's family room. The room actually had 2 bedrooms, a small one with a single bed, large closet and little sitting area and a larger bedroom with two double beds. Very large bathroom with lots of counter space and a real shower in the tub, not just the hand-held thing you often find in French bathrooms! The room had several windows that looked over the interior of the building, over the hotel's breakfast area, but never noisy and very Parisian. The room could have used a paint job to brighten it up a bit - it is, well, quite brown, but, hey you are in Paris and need to get out to the cafes and the sightseeing anyway. Breakfast in the hotel was plentiful and delicious, something for everyone. We liked the automatic cappucino machine which also does hot chocolate and regular coffee - and the cappucino was like you get in a cafe - not the disgusting syrupy ones from convenience stores in the US! Again, the location of the hotel was perfect - everything was at the doorstep, in a lovely area. We had absolutely no qualms about letting our children go off on their own to explore the area, make a baguette run, etc. Hope to return soon!

Reviews.Title: “Location, location--the best in 5 tries to Paris”
Reviews.Author: Senior653
Reviews.Content: Rooms were large for Paris--bathrooms were larger yet!!--located 15 minutes from Eiffel Tower--around the corner from Metro--bus access in area to all major sites--Rue Cler area two blocks away with many cheaper Cafes and shopping opportunities--Saturday Market 5 blocks away--staff was friendly and helpful with arrangements to visit Museums, places to eat and boat rides on the Seine--5th trip to Paris over some 20+ years--this hotel made it the most memorable. Will not have to look far for a hotel on my next trip to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “First time in Paris - Great location”
Reviews.Author: Firefighter619
Reviews.Content: First time in Paris, stayed at this hotel based on other reviews. Very happy with room, great location near metro, cartoon channels in english make the kids happy. European type hotel, not big and spacious. Enjoyed the location near Eiffel Tower and metro stops. Around the corner great street with restaurants and shops. Would recommend this hotel and stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent price and location”
Reviews.Author: MelWCalgary
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel at the last minute and was pleasantly surprised by the quality, location and price. We had originally booked at Citadines and they moved us to a location far away from the tourist attractions 2 days before arrival, so i was quite worried about finding another hotel on such short notice. Hotel was very clean, elevators for luggage and the bathrooms were huge. Staff were very friendly and spoke good English. On the way in, they let us check in early. On our way out they were very helpful to store our bags for the afternoon and get a taxi for us. Grocery store right next store, many cafes nearby, eiffel tower 10 minutes away and lovely park just a block away. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel if traveling with kids”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoSergio
Reviews.Content: Big bright bathrooms, quad accommodations and a small parlor in room made this hotel very comfortable for us. Very close to Eiffel tower, train stations and a couple of nearby supermarkets and restaurants. Staff friendliness was mixed: some great, some not so much. I will return if ever in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Location is key!”
Reviews.Author: RR75
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a great location. Just like other European hotels quite small and old, but definitely made up by the friendly and courteous staff . Bathrooms were new and renovated. Floors creaked quite a bit and the elevator is really small. We arrived early morning and the staff at the front desk had a room ready in 10 mts. Checkin is generally much later in the day but they did check us in immediately which was helpfull. Had a good spread for breakfast included in our price. That was a nice addition as well. Walking to the Eiffel tower and surrounding areas from this hotel is a breeze. Good connectivity with a metro station right next door. Supermarket right next to the building as well. Rue cler is another 5 mts walk from here with access to local markets and nice restaurants. All in all a great place to stay if you are looking to be close to the Eiffel tower. We also used their shuttle service to the airport. It was very cost effective and on time.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal position”
Reviews.Author: teresab
Reviews.Content: First trip to Paris and i found the Bourdonnais was in a perfect position for the Eiffle tower, bus routes and the river seine. The rooms were clean although not very large but ideal for one night. We were on the 6th floor and had a view of the top of the tower and at night when illuminated it was beautiful. We didn't have breakfast so i cant comment although the breakfast area looked really nice. My only complaint was the reception staff, there was no welcome and it seemed to be a great effort to check us in, a smile wouldn't of gone a miss. I would stay there again just because of the position.

Reviews.Title: “Location! Location! Location!”
Reviews.Author: rebeccalaus
Reviews.Content: Hotel la Bourdannais was just right in every respect! Bourdonnais is not for those of you looking for a five star with all the amenities. Bourdonnais is for the adventurous traveler who needs a clean and comfy place to rest at the end of your fun-filled day. I traveled with two friends. We stayed in a small, but very comfortable room with three twin beds. The room was very very clean with a separate water closet and bathroom. The hotel staff was lovely and helpful. Having said all of this, it is important to mention the LOCATION of Hotel la Bourdonnais. Several blocks from the Champs de Mars and a few steps away from the Ecole Militaire metro stop, there are fantastic restaurants and sights very easily accessible. Our favorite nearby location was Rue Cler. You must visit Rue Cler's restaurants and bistros. (Cafe Central has the best croque monsieur I've ever had... and I've had a lot of croque monsieurs!) DONT MISS Rue Cler on a Sunday morning. Take in the charcuterie, boulangerie, frommagerie, etc with all of the locals.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Reen_11
Reviews.Content: My first time in Europe, and this was the first hotel I stayed at with my family. My girlfriend is a travel agent so she gave me a few choices prior to the trip and because of the location and price, we booked this hotel and stayed for 3 nights. My co-worker also booked this hotel a few weeks before my family and I went. My coworker and her friends who booked 2 rooms didn't get a view from their balcony. My family and I got super lucky, we had the eiffel tower view when you walk out of the balcony! It was amazing. All 4 of us stayed in the same room, and knowing Paris hotels are small in general, we managed well for all of us staying in the same room. This hotel has prime location. It is a few blocks walk away from the Eiffel Tower. It does not get better. Also, the metro is only a block away, so it makes traveling around the city so much easier. There are restaurants, cafes, close by to the hotel, and a supermarket right beside the hotel. Also, free wifi in the hotel room. There's a computer you can use at the lobby, as well as a printer if you wanted to print tickets or boarding pass. We also booked a shuttle through the hotel to and from airport. However, we find that taking a taxi is about the same price since our shuttle was cancelled on us when we were leaving. I did find the breakfast at the hotel quite expensive. it is 10 euros each for family of 4, but if you have less than 4, it is 10 euros and selection of breakfast wasn't that great. The only complain I have is the hot water. If you want to take a shower, especially in the morning, you either have to wake up super early , or else there's not enough hot water in the hotel. Also, only one room key is provided, so sometimes, that is a inconvenient. If you are looking for good location, and not going to be staying in your hotel for long period of time, this would be a good hotel choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, extremely rude staff”
Reviews.Author: Meghan2214
Reviews.Content: A girlfriend and I arrived for a short weekend in Paris and I had booked Hotel de La Bourdonnais a month later by accident. They accommodated us and gave us the discounted rate for two nights. The manager was very rude about doing it even though the girl working the desk said it was no problem and they had plenty of availability. The manager then made us pay for the room immediately and treated us as though we were untrustworthy and would leave without paying. They refused to hold my credit card number after we explained we would want to put breakfast on the card every morning and just pay the total at the end. The manager was extremely rude and acted like we were just dumb girls who would skip out on the room without paying. At the end of our trip, we requested a late checkout which the one woman at the desk said was fine and took our key so we could get one last look at the Eiffel Tower and a quick lunch. When we came back the manager said that we had to pay for a night in the room because the maid had already left. When we explained that we requested a late checkout she said she never heard it and forced us to pay. The whole experience almost ruined our weekend in Paris and the staff was just ridiculously rude. The managers, both male and female, were the definition of arrogant and pompous. I will never stay here again which is a shame because it is a black from the eiffel tower and rue cler.

Reviews.Title: “Getaway in Paris with family”
Reviews.Author: Voyage0424
Reviews.Content: Overall, our stay was very pleasant. The hotel staff was very accommodating, especially since my sister-in-law and I were traveling with a young child. I had e-mailed the Hotel in advance regarding some special needs and requests, and they were granted. Location! Location! Location! We were able to see the Eiffel Tower from our bedroom window; and the Tower itself was only a 7-10 minute walk down the street. The hotel is situated in a convenient and safe neighbourhood; there's a grocery store next door and the metro (Ecole Militaire) is a short 2 minute walk from the hotel. The room was spacious and clean, and suited our needs (2 double beds). The bedding was warm and comfortable (perfect for a chilly winter's night), and the decor was charming. I just wanted to point out, though, that there was a bit of mold/mildew in our room heating unit. I'm allergic, so it caused me a bit of difficulty. Considering how clean our room was, though, it may have been an oversight. Regarding the continental buffet breakfast: I have a severe nut allergy, and it was nice to have a broad selection I could choose from at the breakfast buffet the next morning (everything is made in house, and was guaranteed to me to be safe to eat).

Reviews.Title: “Want hot water? Look elsewhere.”
Reviews.Author: travelingfool1234
Reviews.Content: Overall this hotel had a decent location but the rooms/hallways were dingy and there was no hot water in the morning. Cons: - No hot water either of the mornings I was there. After the first morning I reported it to the front desk. The next morning was not much better. It is mainly because of this that I give it two stars. - Carpet in hotel and room was dingy Pros: - Friendly staff - OK Location. I'm on the fence whether to include this as a pro. It is next to Ecole Militaire metro station in the 7ème arrondisement, but everything in Paris is next to a metro station, so this is nothing special. It is at the opposite end of the Champ de Mars from the Eiffel Tower. If you want to walk to the Eiffel Tower, it will take about 10-15 minutes. If you want to go by metro, it will take 10-15 minutes as well because you have to change lines. It is really too far to walk to any of the other sites in the city. Metro or taxi is your best bet, but again, you can take the metro from anywhere in the city. And like everywhere in Paris, there are cafes and bakeries all around. - TV had lots of channels, all HD, and the on-TV guide screen was cool in that it showed everything that was on. On the negative side, there was no way to change the tv's input source from the hotel's hdmi cable to guest-supplied RCA cables.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended”
Reviews.Author: AlanC1792
Reviews.Content: I scheduled a 24 hour layover in Paris as I was tired of only seeing the inside of CDG. The Hotel La Bourdonnais is very well located for the tourist. I used it as a home base to drop my luggage, shower and get a few hours sleep. For a first time visitor to Paris it was amazing to be staying so close to the Eiffel Tower. The hotel is located on a lovely, quiet street. The staff was cordial (and probably downright eager by French standards). The room was clean and satisfactory, not luxurious by any means. The WiFi was spotty and weak. I was able to book a shuttle through the front desk for a 5 AM ride back to CDG. For my needs, the Hotel La Bourdonnais was perfect. I had no issues at all, and hope to stay there again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy Hotel Near the Eiffel Tower”
Reviews.Author: lilmisstex713
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for a week long romantic get-away over New Years (12/2011 to 1/2012.) I have to say that I wasn’t impressed with the room when we first checked in. I thought the room looked dated and it was freezing. Once we figured out the heater it quickly warmed up and became very cozy though and the room quickly grew on me. The room was very small but we made do. I’ve come to expect small hotel rooms when in Paris. The bathroom was huge by European standards though. Like so many hotels in Europe it had a shower/tub combo with no shower curtain or door. It had one of those glass panels that only goes to the middle of the tub. This wasn’t much of an issue once the bathroom heated up from the shower steam but it was a little chilly when I first got in the shower each morning. The shower had excellent water pressure and we had ample hot water except for one day. The hotel did not have wash cloths in the bathroom but most European hotels don’t have them so I have gotten in the habit of bringing my own. We did request extra towels and an extra blanket for our bed and we were promptly accommodated. The room had a TV but we never turned it on. The bed was very comfortable and we slept very well there. The walls do seem to be thin at this hotel because we kept hearing our neighbor cough and we the toilet was loud every time they flushed it but I learned to travel with ear plugs many years ago so none of this ever affected my sleep. We requested a room with a view of the Eiffel Tower and the hotel did accommodate us. We ended up on the 5th or 6th floor (whichever is the top floor) and granted we couldn’t see the entire Eiffel Tower from our room but we could see the top of it. It was very romantic. The hotel is in an excellent location. The Eiffel Tower is literally on the next block. I was very thankful to be so close to the Eiffel Tower on New Years Eve. The area around the Eiffel Tower is packed with people on New Years Eve and I would not have wanted to have to the horrendous traffic or even squeeze onto a metro train that evening. Being able to simply walk back to our hotel within 5-10 minutes made the evening perfect. The hotel is not located near a major metro hub but a major metro hub is just one metro strop from the hotel. There is a metro stop very close to the hotel (a 5 minute walk max) but as I already stated its not a major hub. The hotel offers a hot breakfast each morning but the cost was 15 euros per person if I remember correctly. The only reason we ate breakfast each morning at the hotel was because we got it for free because of our Rick Steves 2012 Paris travel book. When I was reading through the book on the plane ride to France I realized that this hotel was mentioned in the book and the book stated if you mentioned Rick Steves 2012 book (I also showed the front desk staff at the hotel my copy of the book) free breakfast would be included with your room. The hotel did honor what the book promised. The breakfast was good and included buffet style eggs, bacon, a variety of pastries and bread, cold cereal and coffee but I wouldn’t have paid 15 euros per person for it. Since it was free it was very convenient though. The front desk staff was always very friendly and helpful and every person we encountered there spoke excellent English. The hotel does offer an airport shuttle that we used when we got to Paris and when we left Paris. I can’t remember exactly how much it cost but it was cheaper than hiring a taxi. The only issue is that you will not be only person in the van. The driver will pick up other people that have reserved the van along the way. We were the last couple to be picked up when we got to Paris and we were the first couple to be dropped off at our hotel and we were the last couple to be picked up at our hotel when we left Paris and we were the first to be dropped off at the airport so it worked out well for us. If you wish to know the pricing for this service and/or reserve the van you should email the hotel. The hotel was very quick to respond to all my emails and the responses were always in perfect English. I really enjoyed this hotel and would stay here again for sure. This was my first time traveling to Paris in the "off season" and I was looking forward to it being deserted. It was far from deserted though. As a matter of fact all the attractions were more packed this trip than they were when we went in July. Most of the attractions close earlier in the winter than they do in the summer and this just seemed to make the crowds worse. If you are wanting to go to Paris when its less crowded Christmas/New Years is NOT the time to go.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for our family of four on our 1st visit to Paris!”
Reviews.Author: GymboMom
Reviews.Content: This was our family's first trip to France and finding the right hotel for our family of four was challenging. We preferred to stay in the 7th near a Metro stop. We also found it challenging to find a room that would accommodate the four of us in Paris. Most hotels only slept a max of 3 people. I came across the Hotel la Bourdonnais' website by searching on tripadvisor and booked directly with them via their site. We were able to secure a jr. suite for our family of four for 193 euros per night. We did stay in November 2011, which is considered off season. We were VERY pleased with our room. It was HUGE and the four of us had no difficulty moving around or storing our luggage. We had a sitting area that led into the bedroom with two beds and a large bathroom. The room was nicely furnished, had a nice flatscreen tv and was very CLEAN. Being a picky mom this was important to me. The location of the hotel was a huge plus as well. The Metro was just around the corner (literally) - easy walking distance to be taken anywhere in the city and much cheaper than taxis. When you step out of the hotel, to the right and up a few blocks is the Eiffel tower - we walked there every night. Also to the right is a convenience type grocery store where we loaded up on bottled waters for just a few euros. About two blocks over is the popular Rue Cler area with charming restaurants and shops as well as a fruit market and flower stall. We ate there several times during our stay. The hotel offered a full breakfast at 9 euros per person. We did not try the breakfast as we aren't huge breakfast eaters and the temptation of Parisian pastries and coffees in the morning were far more appealing to us. My hubby would go out in the morning and get coffee and "donuts" and pastries for a few euros and bring them back to the room. Or we would go out and pick them up and eat while we were headed to the Metro. Across the street from the Metro is a bank with an ATM machine to withdraw euros if needed. We found this very convenient instead of having to search around town for one. We loved our 1st trip to Paris and plan on going back again. We will definitely stay at this hotel again as it was perfect for our family. We felt like we received a great value for what we paid - the room was large, clean and you could NOT beat the location!

Reviews.Title: “Super hotel, can't wait to go back.”
Reviews.Author: Kevin M
Reviews.Content: Had a great room on the 5th floor. For a Paris hotel, space was amazing. The seperate WC to bathroom gives it even a larger feel. Location is amazing we could see the Eiffel Tower from our room. We did not have food or drink at the hotel, but the public areas, breakfast room and lounge are very nice. Reception was always very friendly and courteous. Sleep quality was perfect, pity it wasn't a full double bed as opposed to 2 singles pushed together but this is minor. Two blocks away is a street called La Gruenelle, found some great cafes, bars and restaurants down here. And not psycho prices, 50 euro for dinner for 2 including wine. 4 blocks away to the left is the Eiffel Tower, (book tickets in advance to beat the queues, we didn't and queued for 2 hours). 1 block away is a metro station, l'Ecole Militaire. For the irish out there, found 2 Irish pubs within 20 minute walk, O'Briens being the better option. All in all, we will definately be staying here on our return trip to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, helpfull staff and pleasant accomodation”
Reviews.Author: Pedrorp
Reviews.Content: This hotel is well located, walking distance of Eiffel Tower and underground Escolle Millitaire station. Helpfull lift to rooms, common room (pleasant hall and breakfast area, excellent bathroom with split bath and shower, double glazed, separate toilet, comfortbale and clean room.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: njschultz
Reviews.Content: This hotel is modestly priced, has free (and good) wifi in the room, and is a short block to the Metro, three long blocks to the Eiffel Tower. Rue Cler is around the corner, many brasseries and cafes nearby, and a nice grocery next door. The room is decent sized, nothing fancy, but the bathroom is pretty modern and huge. My room opens to a central courtyard, so is very quiet. The staff is friendly, the hotel feels clean. Breakfast is not included in my rate...will cost 15E extra. A cafe au lait, orange juice and half a buttered baguette at the nearest cafe is 9E. 5.50 w/o the OJ.

Reviews.Title: “Overall - Great value for the money Clean, Classy and I will go back !!”
Reviews.Author: Roslyn S
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located only blocks from the Eiffel Tower the rooms have been updated and the staff were so helpful. Buying our tickets to the Louvre saved hours of NOT waiting in line once there ( hotel staff to thank for that) We walked right in. Breakfast was served daily and was worth the price. Overall - Great value for the money Clean, Classy and I will go back !!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: goodmanpt
Reviews.Content: Clean hotel, great service! Close to the metro (2 minute walk), maybe 15 min walk from the Eiffle Tower...we got a view from our balcony! Small European elevator or lots of stairs but this hotel is gorgeous. A topical Paris hotel, bathtub and shower in a large bathroom and a television. We had to give our keys to the front desk when we left (which was a little weird) but it was actually perfect because we couldn't loose our keys and they knew who was in and out of the hotel. Free 30 minute Internet connection and only 10 euros for a buffet breakfast that was totally worth it. Helpful staff and it was really clean. I would love to stay here again. Would reccommend!

Reviews.Title: “Location, Romantic, Convenient”
Reviews.Author: MIPAGRPE
Reviews.Content: We booked the hotel based on Trip Advisor ratings and was very satisfied with what we got. We booked a quadruple room with our 2 boys (14 and 12). Loved the separate bathroom and bedroom. While small for the 4 of us, it was comfortable and the beds were great to rest on! The LCD TV gave us daily information about local things and the boys their daily fix of Cartoon Network. Bathroom was clean and spacious. Wifi was great and we had no intermittent problems. It is free. The best part was looking at the Eiffel Tower sparkling from our window. Simply awesome. While our room was street-side, we had no problem with noise. Very quiet and occasional early morning sweeper trucks only. The hotel is rustic and romantic. Loved the spiral staircase and small elevator. Just adds to the character. The best part of this was the proximity to supermarkets (right next door or near the Metro is Carrefour), the Metro (Ecole Militare was 1 minute away), Eiffel Tower a quick 3 minute jog or 10 minute walk. We arrived on Christmas Eve and found the BEST restaurant Les Cocottes de Christian Constant within walking distance and had the BEST ever Christmas Eve dinner with our boys. On Christmas morning, we walked to the Eiffel Tower and it was whisper quiet. No busloads of tourists until about 9am! We were the first group up the Eiffel Tower to the Summit and that is another tale to tell...

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: cowboy78249
Reviews.Content: I agree with other travelers "location is the key". Close to Eifel Tower, Rue Cler, Metro etc. The room was decent. We stayed in the Twin room and the size of the room was Ok. The bathroom was mordern. We really liked our stay at this hotel and highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Family in one room and walking distance to Eiffel and Rue Cler!”
Reviews.Author: LoraMuse
Reviews.Content: We were only in Paris for about 48 hours of our 2 week trip in Europe. There are 2 adults and 2 kids aged 7 and 10. I wanted us to all be in the same room which I found quite hard to find in the 3 cities I was looking! But this place was good. There is a TINY elevator or the preferred-by-my-kids circular stairs. The room had 2 double beds and a desk with chair in the main room. Then you walk into the bathroom which had a separate room for the toilet and then a bath area with double sink, an extra counter behend (very useful to make sure makeup, etc didn't get wet), and then a shower tub. One weird thing was the glass plate that swung open and closed instead of a shower curtain, but it worked ok. The best part of the room were the talllllll windows that opened up and then you could look outside down the street and see the top of the Eiffel Tower! Just a couple blocks over and you were on the Champ de Mars walking up to the Eiffel Tower. Or a couple blocks the other way and you were on Rue Cler with lots of places to eat. Tip - don't get there past noon or all the good places are closed! One odd thing was that they wanted us to leave the key there at the desk everytime we left the hotel which we did once, but eventually just took it with us and hurried out and in past the front desk! Oh - another tip - just a couple doors down is a grocery which is always useful and then across from Rue Cler on the main street is a pharmacy - all within easy walking distance. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel serves your average needs...”
Reviews.Author: ShanazNazeeha
Reviews.Content: Small hotel but conducive surroundings. Many facilities around the area-shops, restaurants,pharmacy,etc. Supermarkets nearby, one of them just next door. Metro 'Etiene Marcel' station within 5 mins walking distance though you might have to change lines to get to the central area such as Champs Elysees. For those needing mini bars, take note that you will have to request for one as not all rooms have them. Breakfast is basic but good to fill you up in the morning if you do not like the hassle of having to look for breakfast elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: LydD27
Reviews.Content: I would definitely recommend this hotel. The staff were friendly and helpful when we asked for extra towels and pillows for our room, and spoke good English. The room itself was clean and more spacious than I expected, especially as we were four adults sharing a quadruple room intended for a family. Breakfast was reasonable with a good choice of pastries and a limited cooked breakfast, although we chose to eat elsewhere for most of our stay. The only criticism I have is the lift, which really is very small and so not ideal for people like me who dislike using lifts anyway. The other people I travelled with had no problem using the lift for the duration of our stay though, and I was happy to use the stairs. The location is absolutely brilliant, literally 2 minutes walk from a Metro station and within walking distance of many of the tourist sights. The area around the hotel is also very nice, and we easily found a number of great restaurants and cafes less than ten minutes away. If I'm ever in Paris again, I will definitely stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Location is the key”
Reviews.Author: 4Ds
Reviews.Content: This is a smaller, older hotel but with updated baths and in an absolutely great location. Walking distance to many sights, shops, restaurants, metro. Good internet access. Elevator is very small. The hotel is on a somewhat busy street but the windows kept the room pretty quiet. Staff were friendly. Highly recommended

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: Inna_Inna
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel La Bourdonnais in December 2011, it's a cozy little place with a very attentive and caring staff (they all speak English BTW) Close to metro station. Ideal for sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel at a good location.”
Reviews.Author: rishabh_bajaj
Reviews.Content: Very basic hotel with eiffel tower at a 10 minute walk. The lady at the reception was not very helpful and did not seem interested in giving any tourist information. Breakfast was just ok, not great.

Reviews.Title: “I'll come back next time, for sure!”
Reviews.Author: Pascal P
Reviews.Content: Staff very polite, willing to help, and available. Excellent breakfast, typical French. Wide selection of breads, pastries and, what made the difference for me, a real baguette (not a mere industrial molded bread). 50m far from the subway, very close to the Eiffel Tower on the top half of which we had a great view from our room on the 5th floor. I'll come back next time, for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Good value, clean and excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Happy_holidays99_11
Reviews.Content: Staff were very efficient, and even though I had only booked a single room with shower I was given a roomy twin with full bathroom and seperate toilet. Room was clean, and destination ideal for sight seeing.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Good Room & Services, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Anonymou5
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights towards the end of November 2011. As per my other trips, all hotel arrangements are usually done at the last moment. This time, it was done about 3 to 4 days before flying into Paris. We had set a budget of about USD100 per room per night for our stay and I was given the task to make the hotel booking. I used Trip Advisor Hotel Reviews to scour for hotels that fit our bill. Based on the reviews here and offers that I found, I made the “executive” decision (;-)) to increase our budget to about USD125 a night and decided on this hotel (although with some reservation about the size of the room and the free WiFi service). Knowing the location and the fact that the hotel is ranked in the top 150 (= top 10%) of all Paris hotels here on Trip Advisor at the time of booking gave me the confidence to make the decision to increase our budget a little bit. I checked a few websites for booking but I subsequently made a booking directly with the hotel through its website and took up their 3-night-stay offer, which meant we got a twin room for just around EUR90 (roughly within our budget). Getting to the hotel from CDG Airport was pretty easy. At the train station at the airport, get the train ticket into Paris (EUR9.10 in Nov 2011). I also got myself a pack of 10 metro/bus tickets (ask for “carnet”, e.g. “une carnet, s’il vous plait”) for EUR12.50 (individually, each ticket would cost EUR1.70) at the counter. Take the RER B train to Denfert Rochereau Station. Change to Metro Line 6 to La Motte Piquet Grenelle Station. Then change to Metro Line 8 and get off at Ecoile Militaire Station. Or alternatively you can just walk from La Motte Piquet Grenelle Station if you don’t have much luggage with you. It’s a nice stroll if the weather is nice as you’ll walk past Champs de Mars and see Eiffel Tower right on the way to the hotel. On the hotel itself, it's well located, just off Champs de Mar. Short walking distance to Eiffel Tower. Some rooms on the higher floors that face the street apparently have the view of the top of the tower. Our room was located on the 2nd floor so we didn’t get any view apart from the street and the building in front of the hotel. Not complaining though :-) There're basically no negatives about the hotel. If there has to be any complaint at all, it's about: - the thin wall between rooms, although admittedly I believe this is the same case for most similarly rated hotels in Europe. We didn’t have much problem with the noise except for one night when some girls in the room next door were talking rather loudly quite late at night (well past midnight). There was hardly any noise from the street although we stayed on the 2nd floor facing the main street. - The breakfast; we didn’t opt for the breakfast when booking the room because we thought it’s quite expensive – without knowing what’s being offered. At check in, I was told that breakfast is EUR15pp but based on the reviews that I have read here (even as recent as November 2011 as well) it could be anything from EUR13 to EUR15pp. Not sure of the reason(s) for the difference in price for breakfast. The positives include: + Arrived around 11am and was given a room right away – although I know this depends on the availability of the room, I was pleased about it nevertheless :-) + moderate-sized room for a twin bedroom. (Check out the photos) Not big but not small either, just nice. Definitely bigger than the usual twin room in other similar priced/ rating hotels that I have stayed at in Europe though. + We got Room 205, which has a small “hallway”, a quite spacious shower/bathroom, and a separate toilet (Check out the photos). Beds are comfortable, hot water and water pressure were good. Not much of toiletries available in the bathroom although this was not a problem to us as we brought our own. Some reviewers here have commented that their hotel room looks a bit dated but we don’t think ours are. + Free WiFi in the room. The connection was very fast when I tested by watching some videos on YouTube using my mobile phone. + Free WiFi, PC/ internet access and printer in the sitting/ reading room just off the hotel lobby + Location, location, location. You can view Eiffel Tower in all its glory from just around the corner. For food and other necessities, there’s one supermarket (Franprix) that is located just next door to the right. Carrefour is around the corner to the left and across the street. Metro station is located in front of the Carrefour. It’s on the same line with Opera station, which is quite convenient if you’re planning to do some shopping at Galeries La Fayette and Printemps :-D Overall we’re both very pleased with the hotel and our room. I would definitely stay here again the next time I’m in Paris and certainly would not hesitate to recommend the hotel to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Great staff and location”
Reviews.Author: Tracy K
Reviews.Content: Centrally located. We were able to walk to ever major attraction of Paris! We stayed in a triple which was very large and comfortable for 3 adults. The staff was great, very helpful!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: Trixie1
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a fabulous stay at Hotel La Bourdonnais. We travelled by Eurostar and it is easy to get to the hotel on Paris' metro system (Line 4, change at Strasbourg St-Denis, then Line 8 to Ecole Militaire). From the metro station the hotel is a 2 minute walk (walk in the direction you come up the escalator and at the corner, cross Av. Bosquet and Av. De La Bourdonnais is the next street). The hotel is a few meters down on the right hand side. The area is wonderful - there is a bank, cafes and grocery store a few meters away. I would also recommend Ru Cler, a lovely quaint street with cafes, boutiques and delis. We had coffee in one of the many cafe's and everyone was friendly (considering our limited French!). The hotel is a 10-15 stroll from the Eiffel Tower and you can see the top of it from the hotel. Our room was adequate, perhaps looking a little worn, but nevertheless was clean and tidy. Reception were very welcoming and gave us lots of detail about what to do and where to eat. If you have children, the family rooms have two double beds and are a good size. They offer free wifi in your room and the breakfasts were very good. They were €10 per person but definitely worth the money (coffees in nearby cafe's were €5, so the price for breakfast was reasonable). All in all, I'd definitely stay here again. We also ate across the river at Chez Flottes (by Concorde station) which I would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: mscorr4
Reviews.Content: This hotel is clean & walking distance to Eiffel Tower...about 10- 15 minutes walk. The internet is not easy to access...The reception staff are NOT helpful at all...seems like you are bothering them when you ask a simple question. The coffee from the restaurant will cost you 3 euro per cup...there is a grocery store next to the hotel for basic needs...such as wine & sandwiches .... This hotel has Business Office with one computer & a printer with comfy sitting area.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, rooms better than adequate, bathroom nice although...”
Reviews.Author: GPW22
Reviews.Content: Hotel is a short walk from Eifflel Tower and the neighborhood is very nice - seems safe walking around at any hour. Rooms are OK nothing special but decent. We had a triple and it was bigger (but just barely) than doubles we've had in NYC at either chain or boutique hotels. Beds were comfortable and room was quiet. The toilet was in it's own separate tiny little closet across room the room with a sink, tub and separate shower. Shower and tub were clean and worked well, counter space in bathroom was adequate. Lounge area in lobby was roomy and comfortable with plenty of seating to read or use the free wifi - also two computers and a printer for guest use in lounge. Free wifi in room worked for less than 10 minutes out of the 3 days we were there, so if you need wifi in room forget it - desk people were friendly and helpful with anything except the wifi in room issue. Lots of places to eat within a very short walk and a market right around the corner for anything you might need.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect city view of the Eiffel Tower”
Reviews.Author: DbTX
Reviews.Content: The best thing about this hotel is the view, so you need to ask for a room on the street with a view. The full length windows open to small balconies on which you can stand, with the Eiffel Tower appearing over the top of the buildings across the street. That view is divine. The room itself (we had 501, two double beds and a large, lovely bathroom) was reasonably sized for Europe and nicely decorated. The closet, which we did not use, was a bit old and the safe was ridiculous (80 euro deposit required for the key to this old metal contraption, which would not fit our laptops so we gave it up). We skipped the breakfasts, which at 10 Euros seemed steep for coffee, cereal, and not so great looking pastries. Instead, we walked the short distance to Rue de Cler and Rue St Dominique for our breakfasts and dinners. This hotel's location is superb, a short (6-7 block) from the Eiffel Tower, allowing us to wrap up each day with a nighttime stroll to see the lighted tower. We would definitely stay here again, although the amenities were not super (e.g., no lotions or bar soap, just body/hair wash in a dispenser that was difficult to manipulate), the staff was friendly and the location was, for us, ideal.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: mskisha
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 3 days, and everything was great. The room was very spacious, clean, and in a great location to the metro. Although The Wi-Fi in the hotel was spotty we barely stayed in the room so it wasn't a major issue. I would definitely recommend this hotel to a value consumer.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for your stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: jd82
Reviews.Content: Hotel Bourdonnais was a great stay. Excellent, safe, location just minutes away from the Eiffel Tower, cafe's and little shops. The room was small but its europe so just accept it. The staff were very friendly. We did a private bus tour of Paris which came with a 1 hour cruise on the Seine and lunch in the Eiffel Tower, it was worth it. If I ever return to Paris I will be staying at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Boxed into a Hotel close to the Eiffel Tower”
Reviews.Author: mel-man-india
Reviews.Content: If it wasn't for its proximity to the Eiffel Tower, I would not recommend this hotel. Quite frankly it has nothing really to speak of. Pricey rooms even in off season, defective beds and cramped rooms - felt like living in a box. A lousy breakfast (And additionally charged for - better still go to the cafe's nearby) and a hostel like acco is not what i wanted in Paris on my first visit. Anyway lessons learnt. Head a little far away from the tower - its not that you want to see it every day anyway.

Reviews.Title: “GOOD LOCATION BUT NEEDS COMPLETE REVAMP”
Reviews.Author: lavenderblueLondon
Reviews.Content: Great location (5 mn from the Eiffel Tower) but the room I stayed in was old-looking, the wallpaper and furniture needed replacing, and there was a strong smell of cheap bleach in the bathroom. The TV screen was small and too far from the beds, the WI-Fi was not working, , and there was no clock in the room. Also, the hand-soap provided smelled strong and cheap.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant location and great wee hotel”
Reviews.Author: sassymaxee
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 days and can't recommend enough. Brilliant location and lovely neighbourhood. Very clean and comfortable rooms with lots of space, separate toilet and shower room, comfy bed and nicely decorated. However, no tea or coffee making facility in room; not a major thing though as there are plenty of cafes/restaurants close by and even grocery store next door. There is also small refrigerator in room in case you purchase anything from store etc. There is also free Wi-fi and you have full use of 2 computers in downstairs lobby. Also a great view of Eiffel Tower - we requested room with a view and they kindly did this for us. We only had breakfast once but enjoyed the buffet selection of bread, croissants, pastries, bacon, eggs and great coffee. Location wise - we were very impressed. Couple of minutes from Ecole Militaire Metro and bus stops nearby also. Eiffel Tower/park is within walking distance and about 2 blocks from Rue Cler. The staff were very helpful and great source of information with regards to things to see/do etc. Great value for money if you are on a budget. We will definitely be back to this hotel on our next trip to Pairs! :)

Reviews.Title: “Great location, warm welcome”
Reviews.Author: Maggie_Megabyte
Reviews.Content: Really good location, mins from Tower, Champ de Mars and Napoleon's Tomb. Warm welcome, helpful staff, clean bedding and towels. 3 adults & 1 child in room with 2 doubles and 1 pull down double - ample room size. Good size bathroom with shower & bath. Reception staff were good at making some suggestions which we followed, very helpful at all times (and patient for us non-French speakers). Supermarket next door handy for night time nibbles. Breakfast was huge, well cooked and lots of choice to suit everyone. We will be back at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “This is Not a three star place”
Reviews.Author: aliasJupiter
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for a week in October. We would have left but for the fact that it was prepaid. Plenty of malfunctioning details that make your stay unconfortable ( the water did not flow out of the bathtub, the door handle falling out, the entrance door heavily stuck) plus, no amenities (shampoo, soap). We mentioned all this and were told they would take care of it...never did. The reception personnel is ok but for the one male, he's not forthcoming at all. Sure the hotel is well located, but there are at least four others on the same street, and in one of them we'll be staying next time!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful little hotel in heart of Paris”
Reviews.Author: 5t0travel
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights in October - family of 2 children and 2 adults. The room we had was small but didn't seem like it, perhaps because of the two large windows. Climb out the window onto the juliet balcony and gaze at the Eiffel Tower, esp. spectacular at night when it was lit up! The bathroom was large and with a separate wc, perfect for the family. The area is is terrific - near l'Ecole Militaire, the Metro, 10 minute walk to Eiffel Tower, 4 minute walk to the Champs de Mars area with the tiny bistros and cafes that say Paris. The staff was always courteous and friendly, recommending restaurants and places to visit. I look forward to staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Cute little hotel, very close to the Metro and the Eiffel Tower”
Reviews.Author: tigga23
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in March 2010, and would certainly consider it again when next visiting Paris. I got a good deal through the hotel's website (although, when booking, the deposit was the equivalent of one night's accommodation (we were staying for 2), but a few days after making the booking, I received an email to say that because it was such a good deal, I should have paid for both nights up front, and that they had debited my card accordingly!!!!). The hotel itself is in good condition, and the room was big enough, and decorated well enough for us. I requested a room with a balcony, and we got that - and it was amazing - perfect view of the Eiffel Tower. (Other reviewers had mentioned having a refrigerator in the room - our room didn't have one, however the reception staff were happy to keep our drinks in the fridge at reception for us).

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel and a great location”
Reviews.Author: Wrede M
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 4 nights in mid-September and could not have been more pleased. Since this was our first trip to Paris, I had requested and received a room on the top floor with a view of the Eiffel Tower. The room was small, but clean and more than adequate for our needs. The bathroom seems to have been remodeled/updated in the recent past and was also very clean and everything functioned well. The bed could have been more comfortable, but other than than that... The staff was friendly and helpful in spite of our very limited use of French. The location was within walking distance of the Rue Cler neighborhood with its cafes and markets. It was also very close to the #8 Metro stop which made it convenient to any part of the city. We absolutely loved our stay in Paris (don't believe what you hear about 'rude' Parisians...respect them and their culture, learn a few phrases and they are as charming and helpful as any resident would be in a city of this size.) and would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: funinparis
Reviews.Content: We again stayed at the Hotel La Bourdonnais in Paris in September and were very pleased with the hospitality of the staff and the accomodations. The location is perfect with close access to the Metro and is near many of the local sights. This was our seventh stay at this hotel and the staff has been wonderful and very helpful both before and during our stay. We will stay there agin on our next visit to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: retired698
Reviews.Content: We have stayed twice in La Bourdonnais, both times in a king sized bed room. The hotel has undergone renovations and the room was large and comfortable, and the bathroom was large and well appointed. There is good quality air conditioning. There are many options for reduced rates if you book ahead on the internet. We had a package that included breakfast, but if you decide not to take breakfast, there are several cafes within a few minutes walk. The hotel is good and represents fair value for Paris. We found the location to be excellent. There are many choices of restaurants within walking distance, ranging from simple bistros to elegant starred restaurants. Although this part of the 7th is frequented by tourists, it is still very French in character. Overall, a very positive experience and definitely recommendable.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience at the Bourdonnais”
Reviews.Author: WileEToyote
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 4 nights in June along with our two kids (17 and 20) and stayed in the 'Classic' Quad room. Hotel pics made it look a little dated but when we arrived, we were pleasantly surprised. Bathroom was very clean and modern and for a boutique hotel the room was pretty spacious (from a European perspective). It had plenty of closet space and the room was quiet. The breakfast room was very nice, the food was pretty food, and the staff was very pleasant. This hotel does have a small lift if that matters to you. The location was fantastic... Eiffel park was a 5 minute walk, two grocery stores within a block, and the metro was a 1-2 minute walk. Getting anywhere within the city took 10-20 minutes which was nice. In my research for a Parisian Hotel in this area, it came down to this one and another nearly 50% more expensive... I have no issues recommending this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: spaceck
Reviews.Content: I usually stay in this area (Ecloe Militaire/Champs de Mars), and my usual hotel was unavailable. I gave this a shot based on reviews here, and was not disappointed. Efficiently run, comfortable beds (never taken for granted in France), close to Metro and good food, supermarket next door, Starbucks nearby...what more could you want! I had a nice-sized room in the back (quiet) with a king bed and a big bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, clean rooms”
Reviews.Author: HKTervoert
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel during our one week visit to Paris. This hotel is centrally located within easy walking distance to some of the major attractions in Paris. It is also within a block from a Paris metro station and has numerous cafes nearby. The rooms in the hotel are spacious in a typical french layout and you have access to free wifi or the Internet while you stay there. The hotel staff always greeted us with a smile and were very helpful. The hotel offers a continental breakfast for 15 euro and that is quite affordable considering some of the prices at some cafes. There are two markets near the hotel (one right besides) and the carrefour one block away. We would definitely stay at this hotel on sour next visit to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful Find”
Reviews.Author: thode
Reviews.Content: Minutes from the Eiffel Tower and close to everything, this small hotel can claim marvelous front desk staff, an efficient and helpful waiter at breakfast, clean and comfy rooms, attentive maids plus fabulous bathrooms. We rented a family room, which provided four adults ample space and comfortable accommodations. The bathroom was huge! Staff is remarkable for their attention to your needs. As we were leaving, I was positioning a suitcase to roll down the spiral stairs. The helpful maid asked if I did not want to take the lift. Where else would you get that kind of attention?

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely outstanding! We didn't want to leave.”
Reviews.Author: ktgrate
Reviews.Content: Just returned yesterday from a wonderful week in Paris--our first. Had our two sons with us and booked a quad. The Hotel La Bourdonnais was wonderful in every sense of the word: from the room, to the view, to the breakfast in the charming breakfast room. We felt that staying there gave us a real sense of being in Paris. Nothing like opening your window and catching a glimpse of the Eiffel Tower to start your day. Free wifi; croissants, cammebert and cappucino to fortify a full day of sightseeing; currency exchange at the front desk; metros nearby. Delightfully different experience from staying at an American hotel. Comfortable, with a distinctly European style.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious room and convenient location to Metro stop”
Reviews.Author: iLLINOIS08
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Hotel La Bourdonnais for 4 nights the first week of June, 2011. We were drawn to this hotel because of its location near the Ecole Militaire Metro stop, and its close proximity to the Rue Cler neighborhood. The room was quite spacious with a small entryway where the double closet was located immediately upon entering the room. The bedroom offered a 'king' bed (2 twins pushed together), a small desk, and a small table with 2 chairs; as I said, quite spacious, and decorated in typical Parisian style. The bathroom was small, but adequate. The only difficulty was with the shower doors, which were similar to old-fashioned swinging bar-doors....they didn't close completely, causing water to escape into the bathroom, and trickle towards the bedroom. But this was a small inconvenience that was easily overlooked as every trip abroad holds some surprises! We also had a tiny glimpse of the Eiffel Tower from our small balcony, which was an added bonus.

Reviews.Title: “Great location close to Eiffel Tower”
Reviews.Author: sprof
Reviews.Content: Went to Paris 6 times in the last 10+ years. Stayed mostly in the Opera area before. Like this hotel the best so far. Stayed in spaceous and clean triple room (in Paris standards). Beatiful hotel. Close to metro and the Eiffel Tower. We went to an interesting antique show near the Tower one Saturday. Relatively quiet neighourhhod with good restaurants, even a few coin laundry places. Paid breakfast adequate and in-expensive, discount for a family of 3 people. My daughter broke her glasses and we found a nearby place to get a replacement in 2 days!

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: ohioBuckeyes_9
Reviews.Content: My husband and I took our first trip to Paris in July. This hotel is wonderful! Clean, cozy, very Parisian. The front desk is very helpful; always spoke English. All the people we met in this hotel were American. It is not a very large hotel. Our room was a bedroom with separate bath which we booked on hotel.com. It is very close to the Metro which we took all over Paris. Out of our balcony was the Eiffel Tower. The rooms are a bit old, so do not think this is luxury, but is was CLEAN and comfortable. The hotel lobby is like a charming old fashioned living room and has two computers with free wi-fi. You get the code from the front desk. We didn't eat breakfast there. There is a grocery store next door which stays open until 9:00 pm. We bought water and batteries there. We would stay there again!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: libraryjen116
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great spot. Near a Metro station (Ecole Militaire) and an RER station (Pont D'Alma which also serves Versailles). There are many good restaurants in the area and even a great one (Cafe Constant). A market is next door, and the rooms have small refrigerators making it easy to have an inexpensive breakfast in your room. The staff was friendly for the most part and spoke English. The only con was the fact that the WC was across the room from where the sink and shower were, which got a little annoying traipsing back and forth to wash your hands.

Reviews.Title: “Nice little hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Francofille35801
Reviews.Content: This hotel is about a block from École Militaire in Paris. Great location not far from the Eiffel Tower and a number of good restaurants. It's about 2 blocks from Rue Cler. We stayed there our first night in Paris this trip because of the location. We arrived from the US at about 7 a.m. and got to the hotel about 9:30. Our room wasn't ready, so we left our luggage in the hotel walked around for an hour or so. When we came back about 10:45, the room was ready. It was clean and comfortable and had what we had asked for--2 beds and a shower. It is a good, quiet hotel with comfortable beds and in a great location, close to the Metro, shopping, attractions, and restaurants. Not luxurious, but just fine. It was a good choice for us. It also had free wireless access. Breakfast was great. Breads, sweet things, cereals, yogurt, fruit, cheese, fresh orange juice, and great coffee--you could choose espresso, cappucino, double, cafe au lait, etc. and push a button. The machine made it to order.

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel, highly recommended!"”
Reviews.Author: juliec303
Reviews.Content: We stayed here due to a long layover, the hotel was perfect for me and my three children. It is sometimes difficult to find a room large enough to accomodate a family. The view of the Eiffel Tower was amazing, the size of the room was surprisingly large, very clean, and the staff was so helpful. The next time we are in Paris, we will definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, great location, great value...”
Reviews.Author: Sunil R
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 3 nights with the kids in a family suite. A very quaint Parisian ambience in a beautiful neighborhood. Wonderful proximity to the Eiffel Tower (short walk of about 5 mins) - allowed us to take the kids multiple times including to see the hourly twinkling lights of the Tower starting after dark. A large number of restaurants nearby and several convenient grocery stores to pick up food to go for day excursions. The room was large, clean and comfortable (looks to be recently renovated) but someone looking for ultra modern, may be slightly disappointed. Breakfast room was lovely and breakfast itself was quite good. Staff were extremely friendly and helpful with all of our travel needs. English is widely spoken. Overall, a very enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Around the corner from the Eiffel Tower”
Reviews.Author: Sal_Sal1967
Reviews.Content: The Hotel was an older style hotel but comfortable and clean. It was only a short walk maybe 500 m to spectacular views of the Eiffel Tower. Located next door is a convenient store where you can purchase buy food items and alcohol. We decided to walk down the street to a pastry shop each morning to buy fresh croissants. We were happy with the location.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, location and staff.”
Reviews.Author: four4traveling
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with this hotel. First of all, the location is excellent--less than 10 minutes to the Eiffel Tower and Metro station a short walk away. The staff was very friendly and helpful--ready with suggestions and even umbrellas on a rainy day :) Our room was roomy--plenty of room for the four of us--and had a beautiful view. It was also very clean--fresh linens daily, immaculate bathroom. We especially appreciated the value of the summer special which included breakfast--great coffee, fresh pastries and bread, fresh fruit and juice, eggs, ham, yogurt . . . YUM! We would definitely stay here again and have already recommended it to friends.

Reviews.Title: “A great deal in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Lindabird16
Reviews.Content: We stayed at La Bourdonnais for 5 nights in July and were very pleased with the experience. All of my requests were meet by their capable staff and they went out of their way to please. Our party consisted of myself and my husband plus our daughter and her boyfriend. I asked for and received rooms right next to each other and on the top floor with view of the Eiffel Tower with the exact type of beds we requested. We were able to watch the Bastille Day fireworks from our private balcony without having to deal with the crowds. They also gave us a good deal on the breakfast which was definitely worth the extra money. The rooms were very clean and a good size for this price range in Paris. We have stayed in the seventh arrondisement (sp?) before -- it has a great selection of restaurants, is close to the metro, and is quiet and not as touristy as some parts of Paris. All things considered, I would fully recommend the hotel -- it has a true Parisian feel.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great stay in Paris!”
Reviews.Author: Stepp89
Reviews.Content: My husband and I traveled to Paris with our two teenagers in mid-July and were so happy with our choice to stay at this hotel. The location was superb with views of the Eiffel tower from our room, and walking distance to restaurants, markets, shopping, and the Metro. The lobby and breakfast area were small but welcoming, as was the friendly staff. Our room on the 4th floor, assessible by spiral staircase or elevator, was simple, yet very clean, quiet and comfortable for our three day stay. While there, we booked a hop-on/hop-off bus tour which conveniently picked us up a few blocks from the hotel and took us around the city to the most well-known sites. This was a great way to see Paris in a short amount of time. We had a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Superb Family and Couples Hotel”
Reviews.Author: StoneLikeThem
Reviews.Content: What a jewel! Only 3 blocks from the Tower and the neighbourhood is not overrun by other tourists. Small and welcoming, clean and modern but with an intimacy evoking la belle epoque. Without the sterile sameness of a large chain hotel, more like a bed & breakfast. The friendly staff were very helpful on several occasions. Our four person room was larger than we had been led to expect in a European hotel. Definitely stay here and taste the Paris cafe lifestyle. I just got home and I already want to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleased!”
Reviews.Author: Lisa_momof2
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location, right near the metro stop (Ecole Militaire), grocery store next door, plus another nicer one right infront of the metro stop, great area to walk around at night, pick up fresh fruit, dinner, etc... We were on the top floor, 6th floor and had a phenomenal view of the Eiffel Tower. Nice to open up your window during the day to see the Eiffel Tower and even nicer at night when the lights are on and flashing. Room was clean, towels changed if needed. They provided a dispenser for hand soap and the same type of soap for the shower. I prefered my own. Toilet was in a separate room from the shower and sink, but I didn't have a problem with that. Room was a nice comfortable size, maybe a bit smaller than what people are used to in North America, but not as small as typical European hotel rooms. The beds are quite hard. Took a couple of days to get used to them, but the pillows were comfortable. Nighttime staff were very friendly and helpful. Some of the daytime staff were a bit aloof, but were nice and helpful, with the exception of one who didn't smile. This hotel is in a great area and we felt very safe there walking around at night, or back to hotel from metro.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: Sam181743
Reviews.Content: Internet Special gave excellent rates. Room was exactly as described. Breakfast was delicious and plentiful. Only downside was smell in the room from older building plumbing.

Reviews.Title: “My second visit to this hotel in 2 years”
Reviews.Author: OrangeGem
Reviews.Content: For the price and location - you can't beat this place. Sure it may need a face lift and the room was smallish, but I could see the Eiffel Tower from my balcony, could walk to Rue Cler and Metro, conveniently located but still quiet and safe. When I go to Paris again, I will definitely stay here a third time.

Reviews.Title: “A good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: HerrWilli
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed here with my wife, and was also joined by family in a separate room during a part of our stay. Hotel has a good location - near the Metro and several bus lines, and within easy walking distance of Seine/Eiffel/Invalides/Ecole Militaire, as well as a number of high quality, reasonably priced restaurants. Bank on the corner with 24/7 ATM machine. Self serve laundromat around the corner. Dry cleaning down the block. English speaking staff. Decent breakfast, although it was the same every day. WiFi. Cable television with HD screens. Clean rooms. Good sized bathrooms. Only hotel we could find in this area that also offered rooms with three beds. Lift was small but it worked. I would recommend this as a good option for an affordable quality hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for family stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: DubDub249
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night in mid July 2011. Booked due to availability of family room for 2 adults and 3 kids, which is not easy to locate in Paris in July. Excellent hotel from start to finish. Staff were pleasant and extremely helpful. Location was second to none, being only two streets from the Eiffel Tower and 100m from the nearest Metro station. Room was massive, as it was a small suite. Ideally suited to a family of five. Continental breakfast is the best I've experienced in many trips to Paris, with no shortage of hot or cold food choices. Room was ever so slightly dated (or maybe colour scheme didn't agree with me). A quick look at other rooms to front of hotel, really impressed me. Value for money in mid July was excellent. Would definitely return and recommend to the closest of friends, even the very very fussy ones. Well worth a visit!!

Reviews.Title: “A hotel I would gladly stay at again”
Reviews.Author: Junco
Reviews.Content: I think I stayed at the hotel immediately after "Hye-dude" as her review is essentially what I would write myself. Stayed here with a cousin with whom I shared a double while our 3 teenage granddaughters shared a triple just across the hall. The girls especially loved the view of the Eiffel Tower from our room. We used the AC every night as the street is too noisy to keep the window open. No noise at all with the window closed. The girls' room faced an interior courtyard and they could sleep with the window open. There was an ATM just around the corner; excellent metro and bus access. Nice neighborhood, rue Cler, beloved of Rick Steves just a couple of blocks away. Plenty of restaurants nearby. I liked having the free internet access; small (empty) fridge in room great for our snacks; copies of the Herald Tribune available in the lobby every day; cool but efficient reception staff; pleasant chambermaids who worked hard keeping the rooms very clean. We enjoyed a very pleasant 7 night stay.

Reviews.Title: “Not Great, Not Terrible”
Reviews.Author: HermosaMack
Reviews.Content: We visited Paris during "Fashion Week" which apparently is a tough time to get a room. Hotel La Bourdonnais had an available room which we took after seeing the positive Trip Advisor reviews. The hotel is old and worn but clean. The safe required a key from the front desk and a deposit. The shower had very low water pressure. Our room was next to the big sign out front and the curtains did not block the light from the sign. Since they don't advertise as a 5 star hotel then maybe this is fine. If you are in the market for a place to crash and you can get a good room rate, then it may work fine. If you are looking for something on the nicer end, look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Hye-dude
Reviews.Content: We stayed 6 nights at Hotel La Bourdonnais in a comfortably air-conditioned, quiet, triple room. The hotel lobby, eating area, and rooms were spacious, very clean, and inviting. The bathroom had modern updates and was roomy. The separate water closet (toilet) however, had no vent and was a bit cramped and took some maneuvering to get by the door without rubbing up against the toilet. This was a minor inconvenience. The room was well maintained by their pleasant and efficient maid service. The hotel has an excellent location, very close to the metro, restaurants, grocery stores, and pharmacies. It has a very nice and comfortable common lounge area with computer, printer, and internet access for the guests. There was strong signal free broadband internet access in the room for those with laptops and mobile devices. There was also a flat screen TV that we had no time to view. My daughter actually chose this hotel because of its outdoor (glass covered) garden breakfast eating area--very Parisian and appealing, well maintained, good service, and larger than I had actually expected. Continental breakfast included eggs, bacon, assortment of fresh breads, cereals, fruits and juices, and of course various coffees via automated bean-grinding dispenser. Above all, the night and day hotel staff were very knowledgeable, courteous, and helpful, making our stay in Paris very pleasant. On one occasion they helped us find a 24-hr pharmacy during a late night medical emergency. I would not hesitate to stay at Hotel La Bourdonnais on a return trip to Paris and would recommend this hotel without reservation.

Reviews.Title: “Simply superb!”
Reviews.Author: Tripmama18
Reviews.Content: My two daughters and I stayed in room 411 (a triple) for a week in May. I was very pleased with the room and the hotel. There were three twin beds, a large bathroom with the toilet on the other side of the room (handy for 3 girls traveling together), and plenty of room for clothing storage. Room 411 opens to the courtyard, which we found to be lovely, and far less noisy than I suppose the street rooms would be. We kept our two very large windows and the bathroom windows open all night. The view of surrounding rooftops was nice and gave our room a real "french" feel. We could also hear french children playing in the courtyard at times, which was sweet. The location of the hotel is fabulous! We had several picnics in the park near the Eiffel tower, which is a short 10 minutes away. Rue Cler, one block over is a great place for a bite to eat, or to pick up some wine and cheese for snacking on in the room. Also, the Rodin museum, a 5 minute walk is a delight to see and stroll through. Take a book and linger among the sculptures if you have free time to spare. Our room rate included breakfast, which was always delicious, with eggs if you prefer, toast, cereal, juice and a self-serve coffee machine. The staff was also extremely helpful. The metro is close by and will take you anywhere you desire in the city. Changing metros is easy to do, we never got lost. We saw all the sights in Paris that we wanted to see (a week is a good amount of time here) and did so at a fairly leisurely rate. We loved the food, the sights, the people, the water bus on the river, the night river cruise, and when the lights sparkled on the Eiffel tower. All in all, we had a very enjoyable experience in Paris and at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: shoegirl011
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a week at this hotel with our 2 tween children. We picked it based on Rick Steves recommendation and the good reviews on TripAdvisor. We were in a room with 2 beds, a couch, and small table & minibar. The room was a good size for us. The bathroom was huge although the shower was awkward as others have mentioned, but still really good. The room was immaculately clean. We ate bkfst at the hotel, which cost 10 Euros - there were scrambled eggs, bacon, yogurt, fruits, cheese and a variety of breads/pasteries. When looking around other places the 10 Euros seemed reasonable. It is close to the Ecole Militaire metro stop so it was easy to go places although we ended up walking to most tourist sites as this hotel is centrally located. The Eiffel tower is a short walk away. We were looking for a traditional French hotel and this met our expectations. The only down side was the wifi was a bit flaky. It didn't work well in our room but it worked fine in their comfy lounge area. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location. Would definitely be back!”
Reviews.Author: Tahiri1321
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel when walking around Paris one month before, and used TripAdvisor´s reviews to learn it was a good one. We were definitely not let down. Great location - 5 minutes away from the Eiffel Tower, 1 min away from École Militaire underground station. Next to a small supermarket and in a very nice high class area. Spacious rooms (for a Paris hotel). Great value for money! Definitely the place to stay if your budget is not so tight.

Reviews.Title: “Great customer service and great location”
Reviews.Author: xavier16
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights in this hotel and booked their Quadruple room. Let me first say that I believe their Customer Service is fantastic! I had to correspond through email with them several times and they were very prompt in replying, and also accomodating in our requests. They also had several promotions in their website and when we asked to avail by doing a price adjustment, they happily obliged. That to me is good customer service! The front desk were alright, helpful enough but not particularly friendly. Though Christian (I think that was his name), the evening Front desk personnel, was very helpful and was great company while we were waiting for our taxi for the airport. Location of the hotel is fantastic for us who were staying in Paris for only two days. It is a 10 minute walk from the Eiffel tower. It was such a delight to walk late at night to see the tower lights, which doesn't sparkle until later in the night (about 10 pm) during summer. There are not very many diverse food options though if you compare this to other arrondisements, maybe due to it being more residential than commerical area.
