But this meant it's quieter in the evenings. Metro stop Ecole Militaire is very near which came in handy. Though be warned that you usally have to make transfers as there's only one line that runs in this stop I believe. But this wasn't a big issue for us. The rooms are old but were actually well maintained. Furnitures were also old but the rooms were always spotless. This was very important to me. I love their bathroom though! It's very spacious and clean. The bed was a little too low for me but were comfortable enough. Airconditiong worked great. As mentioned by most reviews, the elevator was TINY! But I'll take a tiny elvator any day than no elevators at all! You can definitely see it is an old building. There was also free Wifi in the room. The safe is those old units were you need to get a key from the front desk. It was not a big deal, but I have not seen these dinosaurs in a long time. Their lobby was newly renovated and looked very modern. There was also a computer in the lobby which you can use. The breakfast, which was included in our rate (they had a fantastic promo for Summer that included breakfast), was great!! The breads and croissants were fresh and tasty, there were bacon and eggs I believe, and several cereal and pastry selections. They also has a Nespresso machine. It was great because it was included in our price, but not worth 15 Euros per person if you had to pay for it separately IMO. I would stay here again especially if we get a fantastic rate and would, without hesitation, recommend it to friends and family. Watch out for the promos though! It becomes very very good value if you get them at a good price!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and wonderful outlook and atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: Juliancc
Reviews.Content: We would recommend Hotel La Bourdonnais. The location and atmosphere were perfect. The staff, particularly in the dining courtyard, were very helpful and efficient. We ate breakfast here each morning and the options were delicious. Being able to access tea and coffee making facilities in the courtyard at any time, was a definite advantage as these were not available in the room. Easy access to the Internet in the very comfortable lounge area, especially for overseas visitors, was very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Just perfect”
Reviews.Author: Eddie-Sweden
Reviews.Content: Very good value for money, Friendly staff. Had a clean room vith a newly renovated bathroom. Quiet area very close to the Metro, cashmachine and a supermarket next door. Also close to the Eiffel Tower and many restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Parisian Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DaveNSteph
Reviews.Content: We could not have chosen a better hotel in Paris. The location was fantastic and the view was great. I truly loved the atmosphere of the hotel as it really embodied the romantic feeling of Paris! Also the staff was incredible. They helped us choose some great restaurants in the area, book last minute tickets to a show and helped arrange travel back to the airport. Thank you so much for helping make our 15th wedding anniversary a treasured memory!

Reviews.Title: “Second time there .... third time soon!”
Reviews.Author: mtjon007
Reviews.Content: Ok, the rooms aren't large. But at this price and location, get over it! The metro (Ecole-Militaire) is virtually next door. The Eifel Tower is a ten minute walk as is the Seine. You can walk to the Louvre, Orangerie, Musee d'Orsay, Champs Elysees / Arc de T, Rodin Museum, Hotel des Invalides (pls excuse spelling!). There are two supermarkets within a five minute walk (one of which is virtually next door). Need I say more? There are some great eateries within easy walking distance - head for Rue Cler. The hotel staff were helpful, the cleaning efficient. Not too sure about the beds but that could be a personal thing. The lift is very small - be warned! Overall, it's super value for money. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Paris Location.”
Reviews.Author: happpycamper
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights and the location can't be beat. Two blocks to Ecole Militaire Metro, 5 blks to The Eiffel Tower, lots of excellent restaurants nearby. Do not miss Cafe Constant. The rooms and bathroom are quite roomy by European standards, the bed was a bit firm, but the pillows were lovely. The walls are thin, so slamming doors, crying babies can be heard, but never was a problem for us. The lift is nice for luggage. There is a large staff, some were more friendly than others all speak fluent English. Our biggest gripe was with the lack of wifi in our room. For most of our stay we were not able to access the internet in our room and it was quite unstable when we did. This was clearly a hotel wide problem as we heard from other guests and the lack of concern by the staff or interest in fixing it, was the only complaint we had. The internet in the lobby worked very well and the dedicated computer and printer were nice to have as well. We did not eat the breakfast for 15 euros. Bring VIA instant coffee from Starbucks and get hot water from the lobby, fresh croissants are available everywhere for 1 euro and you are set. There is also a very nice grocery nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Location, Clean Small Rooms, Rude Staff”
Reviews.Author: DesmondBlue
Reviews.Content: Recently spent 3 nights in this hotel. Positives: Nicely situated in downtown Paris within walking distance of the Eiffel Tower. Tour buses and metro are also near. Very comfortable twin beds that are pushed together to appear as a king. The rooms were clean. Nice European breakfast each morning for 15 euro. Negatives: Small rooms. Bathrooms have a tub with a shower handle that you awkwardly have to maneuver to shower. Front desk staff was very rude. An Indian or Pakistani male employee was especially rude. Reserved parking was given away the first day and we had to find a lot on our own.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in a convenient location”
Reviews.Author: tdot009
Reviews.Content: Pros: Close to subway. Very comfortable beds. Better than average washroom. Free and usable wifi. Walkable distance to several good restaurants. Cons: Small room.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in the 7eme in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Teri59
Reviews.Content: Lovely and original part of Paris with less tourists avalanache. Great location for transport. Good restaurants in the neighborhood. The people working at the hotel were nice and helpful

Reviews.Title: “Solid two-star hotel”
Reviews.Author: SeriousTravelerGirl
Reviews.Content: This is a solid two-star hotel that could be three stars if it can be renovated. The pros: located near Metro (Ecole Militaire) supermarket nearby close to Eiffel Tower large bathroom with separate tub and shower free wi-fi in the room The cons: The bathroom could definitely use a renovation. The shower stall had dark moldy stains. Many hotels in Paris have the toilet and bath separate but the bathroom was large enough for a toilet so it seemed unnecessary to have them separate. The sink had very low water pressure. The entire hotel room should be repainted. The bathroom door was dirty as well as the walls in the room. The curtains had stains on them also. The staff was ok. They asked us to leave our key every time we left and the first time I tried to do it, they were helping another guest and didn't even acknowledge me. All they had to do was take the key. AND don't buy the Museum Pass here! They charge 40 euro when the price is 35 euro. Our room was small and noisy. I get that this is Paris but we had a room with 3 twin beds and it was cramped. We could hear doors shut and people using the bathroom from our room. All in all, it was an ok stay. You don't go to Paris to stay in your hotel room anyway.

Reviews.Title: “Nice staff but noisy -- take earplugs -- other tips”
Reviews.Author: Sallypalooza
Reviews.Content: Although the room was very clean, very spacious for a big city, and the beds were incredibly comfortable, the walls and floors are very thin. The day we arrived after an all-night flight, I tried to take that two-hour afternoon nap. The maid was making such a racket above us that I called the front desk to ask if there had been construction going on. You hear the people on the stairs, the doors and drawers slamming. If this kind of thing doesn't bother you, great! If it does, take earplugs. They saved me. Also, take shampoo, soap, conditioner and hand lotion. None of these were provided. (At $400/night, I found this a bit shocking -- they had a dispenser that was very hard to get decent amounts of an all-purpose liquid soap from. Not adequate.) You cannot buy travel sizes of these things in France (or at least not in the stores I looked at (grocery stores and pharmacies). Also bring sunblock. It was on average $30 a tube over there. Skip the icky Franprix next door and go to the Ave. Bosquet nearby to the much nicer Carrefour which is next to the most amazing chocolate place, Le Notre. Also, make sure you ask where Rue Cler is. I didn't know about this till the day I left and it was a terrific marketplace nearby with traditional Fromagerie, great bakeries, prepared food stores, great restaurants, etc. In France, they don't offer up any unsoliticited advice. You have to really probe -- and I am fluent in French and I didn't always get helpful or accurate information. Do your research before you go -- I heard Rick Steves book is really good. Unfortunately, I didn't get that one. The Unofficial Guide was good but I accidentally left it home. The staff were exceedingly nice and the hotel is near a nice park bench in the Champs de Mars where you can eat your croissant in full view of the Eiffel Tower. At $45 each day for our family, we were not tempted by the Hampden Inn quality breakfast they served and opted instead to grab stuff from the CarreFour market discussed above. Be warned, everything in France is out of control expensive -- and we live in a very expensive suburb of Washington, DC so I am used to high prices. But nothing like France. Also, make sure you have a "chip" in your ATM card. We didn't and I was scrambling for more money.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent family run hotel in a central location in Paris”
Reviews.Author: ArmaghGirl2011
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in this hotel twice and I must highly recommend it.The hotel is set in a central location with all the major sites easily accessible.The Eiffel Tower is a leisurely stroll away .The nearby metro is easy to navigate for locations which are not in walking distance.The area has reasonably priced restaurants and fresh produce in local markets.I found the hotel clean and comfortable with friendly staff.This is an ideal hotel for a city break.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice”
Reviews.Author: travelbuff25
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located only one block over from the Champs de Mars park in front of the Eiffel Tower. If you are on the 4th floor or above, you can see the top of the Eiffel Tower outside your window! It is a very safe and beautiful neighborhood. Excellent location: ATM, cafe and restaurants around the corner, food market next door. One block from the Metro (Ecole Militaire). You cannot beat the convenience. The Invalides and Dome Church (with Napolean's tomb) is right down the street. One block more and you are at the Rodin museum. The room is clean and a good size for a European hotel. We had a quad on the 4th floor. As long as the breakfast is included in your room rate, it is worth it. Plenty to eat and good variety. Otherwise, it's a tad expensive. I highly recommend this hotel for the location and price. I would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: dnvpaul
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here many times over the past 19 years and have never been disappointed. The rooms are clean, quiet, reasonably priced, the staff is friendly and the location is excellent!

Reviews.Title: “Quaint hotel with a great location and really friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: vegasguy27
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on a somewhat last-minute trip to Paris. My French is terrible, but the staff speaks good English, and was very helpful. They allowed an early check in, which was nice, as I was not looking forward to lugging my bags around. The Metro station is just across the street, so the whole city of Paris is minutes away... There are two small supermarkets practically next door on either side of the hotel, which was extremely convenient. I would highly reccomend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location; friendly staff; great value”
Reviews.Author: junyi_li007
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 5 nights. The hotel is very close to subway station. Lots of shops nearby. Staff is very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Bourdonnais - decent hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: proshares
Reviews.Content: Good, basic hotel with a helpful staff. Very quick check-in/ check-out process with english speaking desk. Room was basic but fine, not many complaints there. Best part of the hotel was the location. Located just a few blocks from the Eiffel Tower and Ecole Millitaire. Very close to many good restaurants/cafes, supermarkets, and metro. Excellent macarones from Lenotre located right next to the Ecole Millitaire metro. Negatives - mini fridge was broken, no shampoo/conditioner provided. Shower/bathtub is half exposed (no sliding glass door) so water easily splashes onto the floor.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel,clean,friendly helpful staff in great location”
Reviews.Author: Daisydoodles63
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel for a long weekend. Requested a room with a view of Eiffel tower which we were given. The room was made available early which was a bonus and enabled us to dump our bags and get on with all our sightseeing. Its minutes away from the metro which was fabulous and very easy to use. Would recommend the terrace restaurant which is great value and serves good food from breakfast to late night snack, we didn't use food option in hotel. Rooms good size very clean and comfortable had a great nights sleep, would definitely stay here again and recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “OMG Location!”
Reviews.Author: MazzaRazza_83
Reviews.Content: So close to the tower it was stunning! We had a view from our room over the buildings of it. No problems with the room. Breakfast is average but there's brasseries close by.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to be based with our family. Clean, friendly and well located.”
Reviews.Author: MillardCrew
Reviews.Content: We are a family of 5 (children aged 12,10 and 8). There are so many hotels in Paris we really didn't know which to choose. Trip Advisor helped lead us to Hotel La Bourdonnais. We had a great time in Paris and this provided an excellent base. We found it really clean, the rooms a good size, bathrooms fresh and practical, staff friendly and helpful. Breakfast was 15 euros (expensive) but we were able to negotiate a lower more satisfactory rate. We really enjoyed the breakfast - lots of choice, kids loved it. Eiffel Tower and Seine Boat trips were a short walk away, as was a metro. Lots of cafes and restaurants located close by (Cafe Rousillon was a great find). We would recommend this hotel and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: msjoso
Reviews.Content: Just returned from my first trip to Paris and stayed at LaBourdonnais. I would highly recommend this hotel. It is reasonably priced, close to the Metro, and a short 3 block walk to the Effiel Tower,. The hotel is clean and best of all, it is in a neighborhood with lots of choices. The best find near the hotel was a local market with several good restaurants 3 blocks away. On our first day when we stumbled on the market, we were greeted by the sounds of La Vie en Rose from a street musican; it doesn't get more Paris than that.

Reviews.Title: “I will stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: txbakers
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I had twin beds, a decent sized room and a large bathroom. It was comfortable and cozy, with plenty of closet/storage space. We liked the fact the room had an entry, which allowed us to close a second, inner door. The entry held a marble topped dresser and a mirror. The breakfast offered by the hotel was wonderful. We ate the hotel breakfast 4 of the 5 mornings we were there. It had the same quality every day and really got our day off to a good start. The location of this hotel is another reason I will stay there again. It's located in the Rue Cler neighborhood. It's very close to the École Militaire Metro station and a quick walk to the Eiffel Tower. The entire Rue Cler area is charming and you will enjoy walking around here. The École Militaire Metro station is on Line 8, and we found this provided a very quick connection to stations that took us anywhere we wanted to go. This hotel is not luxury, but it is charming and a great value. Also, the hotel wifi was very fast. We never had a problem connecting in our room. If you don't have a computer or smartphone, the lobby had a large, very comfortable living room area for guests with 2 computers and a printer. I booked our Eiffel Tower tickets on my netbook in our room then went downstairs and used the hotel computer to print our electronic ticket. We really did love our stay here and the location cannot be overstated.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, Clean and Comfortable!”
Reviews.Author: KiwiBrits
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel after reading reviews online, and were not disappointed. The staff spoke fluent English, (saving them from my rusty French!) and were helpful. The room was very clean and furnishings in great condition. The bathroom was spotless and spacious. The TV appeared brand new, and would not tune in, so a member of staff came to try and sort it out but it needed a technician the next day, she was very apologetic and offered us the use of computers downstairs if we wanted. There were no tea of coffee making facilities in the room. Breakfast was available as optional extra which we didn't take. Excellent location, just around the corner from the Eiffel Tower and the Seine, next door to a small supermarket and close to restaurants cafes and shops. If we return to Paris we will certainly choose this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “100%SATISFIED”
Reviews.Author: docranarene
Reviews.Content: We are form Guatemala, Central America. After traveling in a tour with EUROPAMUNDO for 2 weeks, staying in hotels like Novotel, Holiday Inn, good by the way, we finished our vacation by ourselves in Paris. I choose la Bourdonnais after reading a lot of hotel reviews in Tripadvisor, this hotel has a lot of good reviews, and this came true after staying there. The location is excellent, one block from Ecole Militaire metro station, 5 minutes waking to Eiffel Tower. Breakfast included in the room fare is great, free wi-fi. Everything you read at the reviews it's true, If we come back to Paris definetely will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel! great location!”
Reviews.Author: worldcitizen02
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for my parents, and their feedback was excellent! when they arrived at the hotel their room was neatly set and the hotel breakfast was good too. Thanks for making their first trip to Paris memorable :)

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel for location and service!”
Reviews.Author: WAREIAM
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I after extensive research chose this hotel for our anniversary and we are both so pleased that we did! My room request was honored as we had a view of the Eiffel Tower which we walked to in minutes! At night from our room it was so stunning. The people at the reception, no matter what time of night or day were always so wonderful, polite, helpful. When we asked for champagne glasses we got glasses, ice, and a bucket for our room! Breakfast each day was wonderful with eggs and yummy bacon along with fruit, croissants, and lots more including cappacino. The room was small, which is the way it goes in Paris, was clean and very nice, bathroom was great. We highly recomend you stay here while in Pairs, for couples, business,and familys, all are welcomed. Thanks so much to the wonderful staff, you really made our stay a great one and I have been to Paris many times, my fiance's first and it made her feel safe and comfortable, thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Great location with all the conveniences within a few blocks”
Reviews.Author: KiddiYo
Reviews.Content: the hotel is a short walk from the Eiffel Tower and the Ecole Militaire Metro stop. There is a full-service grocery store next door which is very convenient for wine, fruit, and snacks. Nearby Rue Cler offers plenty of little shops and cafes in a pedestrian-friendly area. the hotel now has free wi-fi and internet access in the lobby. We also found reasonably-priced laundry and breakfast in the neighborhood. The staff was very friendly and greeted us warmly each day. This was our 2nd stay at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “It's a nice small family owned hotel”
Reviews.Author: kentwong
Reviews.Content: It's a nice hotel but I don't think it's as high rating as other gave it. Why I only giving it 3 stars? we have quad room for family of 4 with two young kids. The room is very base, two double beds plus a twin soft bed which we didn't use. small flat screen TV, no room decor, no coffee maker, when we walk into the room and feel a little depressed. Squeaky floor makes you feel you may fall down to lower floor, and the noise will walk up your partner if you go to bathroom in the middle of night. and the bathroom door also making squeaky noise. so don't go to bathroom when everyone is asleep. We book direct from hotel and breakfast is included. Breakfast is very base as well, if you get use to big breakfast it may not good for you, so I won't pay extra for it if it's not included. Location is plus and minus, it's in a quite neighbored area, but not much shop or cafe. It took us about 10-15 minutes walk to Eiffel Tower, but few minutes to Metro station. On the plus side, the room is very spacious by US standard as 3 stars hotel. room is clean, bathtub is very clean but we can't use it due to it can not hold the water in the tub. It has free WIFI everywhere in the hotel, but you need to give up your email address to sign up. Get ready for more junk mail. I will say it's in the lower end of 3 stars hotel. I guess US and France have different rating system. In summary, for the money, you can pick different location with similar rating and price range with more night life and city life. but if you just want to close to Eiffel Tower, this is may be the one for you with family.

Reviews.Title: “Very enjoyable stay.”
Reviews.Author: RBurns9751
Reviews.Content: Staff were friendly, courteous, knowledgeable and helpful. All spoke English very well. Breakfast included eggs and bacon in addition to traditional French and European items. Room was clean and comfortable. Location was excellent - walking distance to Eiffel Tower, parking a 2 minute walk, Metro also very near. Several brasseries close by, and a grocery store next to hotel. If we are lucky enought ot return to Paris, I will definitely stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel in an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Engineer_Bob
Reviews.Content: We (mid-50s couple with two adult children) stayed here for 5 nights in a quad room, choosing the hotel largely on the recommendation in Rick Steves' 2010 book, and we were very happy with our stay. Our room was relatively spacious by European standards, clean, comfortable and well-serviced, with a modern bathroom and in-room safe. The staff was very friendly, efficient and helpful, and everyone we met was fluent in English. Breakfast was included in our room rate and was very good. The hotel is in a safe, tourist-friendly area just a few blocks from a metro station, several banks/ATMs, a grocery store, and a self-service laundromat. It's also within easy walking distance of the Eiffel Tower, the Army Museum and Napoleon's Tomb, and there is a large selection of decent restaurants in the immediate area.

Reviews.Title: “The Perfect Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: swirthy
Reviews.Content: Hotel La Bourdonnais was the perfect hotel for 6 girlfriends experiencing Paris together. Our rooms were cozy with a sparkling clean bathrooms and comfortable beds. After arriving we walked the short distance to the Eiffel Tower and pinched ourselves to believe we were actually there! That night we opened our windows to the view of the Eiffel Tower twinkling with thousands of lights! The breakfasts were amazing with a full array of French delights, and we enjoyed a cocktail in the lounge each evening while remembering what we had seen that day. Each evening we ate at different restaurants on the delightful Rue Cler, right around the corner. The staff was very helpful and courteous. All in all, it was the "Perfect Hotel" for our group.

Reviews.Title: “Well located, good value hotel”
Reviews.Author: CDLE
Reviews.Content: The hotel is clean & comfortable with a good-sized bedroom (6th floor) and excellent large bathroom. There is only one lift so at peak times expect to wait a while. Breakfast is more than adequate with a good selection but possibly a little expensive at 15E. At peak times (such as when a tour group all arrive together) it is occasionally necessary to wait for a table to become free. The staff on the desk are friendly & helpful and there is free use of the 2 computers and printer in the sitting room. It is located a few minutes away by foot from the Eiffel Tower but, more significantly, it is 2 minutes away from the Ecole Militaire metro station. There are excellent restaurants located within easy walking distance of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel for families!”
Reviews.Author: guulv
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for four nights, and were pleasantly surprised by the size of the room and bathroom. We had a quadruple room with two double beds, and still there was enough space for a dresser, a little table and two chairs plus room to play on the floor. The room was clean, and it was nicely tidied and vacuumed every day during the stay. We chose not to go for the hotel breakfast, as this would add up to quite much for the four of us. With two children (aged 4 and 6) that do not eat much, we had a better deal going to the supermarket next door (which actually is next door!). The situation is perfect. The Eiffel Tower is 10 minutes walk away, metro station is 2 minutes walk away. There are restaurants all over in the area, as well as supermarkets and boulangeries.

Reviews.Title: “It was so hard to leave!”
Reviews.Author: ldhaven
Reviews.Content: My husband and I returned a few days ago from a week spent at Hotel La Bourdonnais, a charming boutique hotel on a tree-lined street. We were very fortunate in that we were able to have a room with a balcony view of the Eiffel Tower, which was about 10 minutes walking distance. Also close to the hotel are several useful bus lines and the Ecole Militaire metro station. Grocery and laundrettes were also handy, which made it easy to really "live" in that neighborhood. It was not easy to get on the plane to come back home, even though we live in Florida, which is a vacation destination for so many people. I would go back tomorrow if I could!

Reviews.Title: “wonderful parisian hotel”
Reviews.Author: traveler46914
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a vacation in Paris and Nice. The hotel de la bourdonnais was a great find. in Paris. It was very clean, staff helpful. The location was ideal. We were about 10 mins. from the eiffel tower. We were in room 601 and had a small balcony. Once you step on the balcony we had a clear view of the eiffel tower. Street was quiet. I would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a great place to stay. Breakfast buffet was just ok.

Reviews.Title: “Great home base to truly enjoy Parisian daily life”
Reviews.Author: ROCKSOLIDMN
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very comfortable with extremely large rooms especially for Paris! Staff was very friendly and available; facilities were clean, comfortable, quiet and welcoming. The location right near the Eiffel tower and in an affluent neighborhood was excellent. There are many truly terrific options for dining very close by, transportation is right down the block and you could spend days just in the neighborhood of the hotel exploring Parisian life! Great spot, great value too, we will use this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Charming!!!”
Reviews.Author: Desotti
Reviews.Content: Very charming and well located hotel, with very good services (free Wi-Fi) and accommodations. Breakfast is also very good but expensive for two persons, but there's lots of good cafes and even a supermarket (Carrefour) nearby. Metro Station is just a block away and there's a nice grocery store next door.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location & Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: fulltimeholidayer
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location literally minutes walk to Eiffel Tower in a relatively quiet tree lined street. I would usually book 4 star + and was really impressed as this is only a 3 star. Hotel staff very helpful and friendly, check in was quick and they dealt with any enquiries etc immediately. Hotel room was spacious (especially for central Paris), especially the bathroom which was needed with 3 females sharing a triple room! Air conditioning worked really well but nice that the room had 2 big windows which you could open to get some real air in. The room had a fridge which we were able to stock up with cheap bottled water from the shop next door to take out with us in the day, instead of paying more from the street vendors. Breakfast buffet was great, huge choice of food and drink with someone on hand all the time if you needed anything. The room where breakfast was served was lovely too. Drinks served at the hotel lounge weren't expensive, 3 Euros for a glass of wine. Nice extra was that the hotel had a lounge area with free computers so you could use the internet whenever you wanted to research local restaurants/attractions etc. English newspapers were free too. Wouldn't hesitate to recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Parisian Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: westyfree
Reviews.Content: The exquisite Hotel La Bourdonnais was everything we expected in a Paris hotel. My family & I stayed 3 nights and loved every minute. Our spacious room (spacious even at North American standards) was clean and well maintained. Beds were comfortable. The hotel is situated in a quiet area so sleeping with the window open at night is not a concern. The bathroom with separate toilet area was clean and modern with a great shower. Room had plenty of closet space. Complimentary internet access with hotel WiFi or just use the computer in the hotel common area. The hotel offers breakfast with a variety of hot and cold items including delicious French pastries. We had our petit déjeuner here every morning! Great location (7 arrondissement). Eiffel Tower just a 10 minute walk from the hotel. Other attractions nearby. Many places in the area to dine or pick up food to go. The front desk staff are fully bilingual (English & French and maybe other languages too), friendly and informative. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel close to Eiffel Tower”
Reviews.Author: s_cally19
Reviews.Content: Very helpful staff and room cleaned spotlessly every day.Excellent breakfasts in very pleasant surrounding.5 minute walk to the Eiffel Tower ( as a bonus this was our view from our room,room 504 )and metro also close to hand.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly small hotel in a perfect location for the Eiffel Tower”
Reviews.Author: Stradlingp
Reviews.Content: Great little hotel not far from the Eiffel Tower and the Ecole Militaire. Very friendly staff who were always happy to help. The breakfast buffet was well above average and is situated in an attractive covered atrium. We were in a family room which had a small lounge. The room and bathroom were far larger than other Parisian hotels I have stayed in previously. The location of the hotel is within walking distance of the Eiffel tower and the Seine. The Metro and bus allowed easy access to the other famous sights. There are several street cafes within a minutes walk which were great for a coffee or a full meal. My only criticisms would be that the room safe was very small and the beds were too soft for my liking but were still comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect find - small and quaint”
Reviews.Author: NIM-CAILIN-BEAG
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 4 night stay at Hotel La Bourdonnais. I got a good rate with the hotel directly including breakfast. It is in an excellent location beside bus and metro routes in a nice district. My daughter thought it nice compared to large chain hotels - this was "quaint" coming from a 16yr old. The room was small but sufficient size for sleeping in. Double sinks in bathroom with shower on wall also bath. Shampoo/soap dispensers on wall too, and hairdryer. However we always bring our own small hairdryer with nozzle. Limited plug sockets - 2 but done the job for recharging phones. Flat tv, with 6 english speaking news channels incl bbcworld, cnn etc. Safe in wardrobe - you pay an €80 deposit on your creditcard which is refunded on return of the key. Plenty of hangers in wardrobe and 3 large shelves. Iron available at reception. Breakfast is served to 11 am and staff are all very friendly. Night porter on each evening we returned to give us our key. There are two computers in lounge with free internet access. A great plus for teenagers. Only problem I had with hotel was our room was located beside lift and the noise is bad all the way to the 6th floor however we put up with it, and I am sure if I had asked to be moved they would have accommodated me. Next time I return I will ask for a room away from lift as I am a light sleeper. Overall an enjoyable stay at this hotel. Being close to metro line no. 8 I soon got use to metro system (similar to new york ) where you can change at various stations to other lines on the one ticket. I done my homework and we bought two books of carnets €12 - for 10 tickets per carnet. Worked out better than Paris Viste card. Also as my daughter is under 18 she is free to many museums and sights so again did not buy musuem pass. A great little restaurant close by is Cafe Constant - We ate there on Tuesday night arrived at 7.20 and by 7.30 it was full - check out TA Reviews for yourself . Cafe Central close by on Rue Cher was not worth the money we paid €80.00 one night and did not like food. Cafe due Marche has good value on Rue Cher Ate at Hard Rock cafe another night at Montmarte. Stay away from Chartiers. I ended up walking out. We booked the Eiffel tower ahead of our arrival choosing a date and time, and was I glad I did as there were huge queues to buy tickets. We strolled up to the resevation blueflag at our allotted time and went straight in. I had booked up to the 2nd level and this was enough for us. You would have had to queue to reach the next level at the top. Lasted about 30mins up the Eiffel and then strolled over the bridge to Trocadero, then we strolled back across bridge to the foot of the Eiffel Towe is Bateaux Parisiens , Port de la Bourdonnais. This boat line is the same price as Bateaux -mouches but seemed to have more seats and to Port de l'alma was a good 15 min walk. We took it just before sunset so on the way back we got the night views. Took a day trip to Versaille also - From ecole Militaire station to Invalides and changed to RER C line to Versaille Rive Gauche €12.35 on metro total cost return for my daughter and I. I had prebooked Versaille however on arrival there at 11am we still had to queue for one hour to get in. This was in a ticket holding queue. If you only wish to see the Palace and some of the gardens then I suggest coming at 3pm (15.00) in summer times as it is open until 20.30 pm - all queues were gone when we came out at 15.30.!! There was not a whole lot more to see at the Marie Antoinette estate. We got a small train around saved the walking 30mins each way for €6.50 for adults and €5.00 children 11 - 18 yrs. Was worth paying it especially in the afternoon heat. We were disappointed with shops ( my daughter was !! would find better shops in Dublin - either very very expensive or very tacky...... I have nicknamed Tati as tacky Tati ( don't go near it) In dodgy area too. Area around Les halles gets dodgy at night - alot of metro lines meet here - was advised this from a work colleague from Paris and I saw it for myself and it was only 6pm. Best visit for my daughter was the Catacombes - Queue 2hrs to get in to see this. Get there early - opens at 10am and you cant prebook........ Loved Paris and would return. Many things I never got to see Bon Voyage:))

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location!”
Reviews.Author: k8peartree
Reviews.Content: My husband and I travelled with my parents. We had a standard room and they had a "superior" and the added price was evident, although the standard wasn't bad. Superior room had a much nicer bathroom. The decor of the standard room was pretty dated, but both rooms were quiet and clean. Can't beat the location for the price, just steps from the Eiffel Tower, a major metro stop (École Militaire) and with a little grocery store just next door. Good value for the money and the air conditionning works great... especially appreciated during the July heat wave! The breakfast included was pretty good, lots of choices. Hotel staff could have been a little friendlier, but they were fine. 2 computers available for internet use and the standard room doesn't have a fridge but the Superior room does.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location with very gracious staff”
Reviews.Author: Girjune
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed for one night in a Quad room and had a wonderful stay. The room was very very clean and the the bathroom was HUGE! It was also very quiet. The metro stop is right around the corner (Ecole Militaire). We did not have breakfast at the hotel as there are many places to eat nearby (Rue Cler is a mere 5-8 min walk away - must have a gelato at Amorino's there sooo good!). We had 10 am tickets to the Eiffel Tower and it was only a 10 min walk away. They allowed us to check in early and leave our luggage till 5 pm the next day - what more can you ask for? Based on my stay last week, I will recommend this hotel to others for sure. Also the lounge has computers with wifi that my children were quite happy to play with while we rested up a bit.

Reviews.Title: “Great find”
Reviews.Author: granitepeaker
Reviews.Content: Besides the rooms being a little small,... I can't find any fault with this hotel at all. Front desk help was Cheerful and friendly. They held our bags for us before check-in and after check-out. Nice lobby so sitting rooms...

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, clean with great location”
Reviews.Author: Rozitis_10
Reviews.Content: Hotel was excellent for a family with teenagers. The room was large for Paris standards, very clean, comfortable beds and pillows. Spacious bathroom. Breakfast was delicious with a good variety of foods. Staff extremely helpful and they spoke good English. Location was fantastic could see the Eiffel Tower.

Reviews.Title: “great location and stay”
Reviews.Author: ryamagishi
Reviews.Content: My family of 4 stayed at Hotel La Bourdonnais for 5 nights in the month of July, 2010 and really enjoyed our stay. We booked this hotel in the month of January and got the winter rate which turned out to be an exceptional price with breakfast included. We picked this hotel because of its location being only a 10 minute walk to the Eiffel Tower and less than a 4 minute walk to the metro station. The hotel is only a few doors down from a grocery store and is located near many restaurants. The hotel is in a very safe part of Paris and we walked the city streets late at night feeling very safe. The hotel staff are very friendly and accommodating. The hotel itself has character and the rooms are very clean especially the bathroom. The morning breakfast is very good with various types of meat, croissants, bread, real orange juice, yogurt, coffee and real bacon and eggs. Many hotel guests found the price of breakfast expensive but it's a good deal if it comes part of your hotel package. For a family of 4 our sleeping area was quite adequate by European standards, but I found our bathroom to be a nice surprise being quite large with a double sink. Overall, I would certainly stay at this hotel if I ever visited Paris again. We enjoyed our stay and the van shuttle to the airport came on time as requested. I certainly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Paris. It's a great hotel at a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “LOVE this hotel so much!”
Reviews.Author: aggee99
Reviews.Content: We stayed her for 5 days...This is my third trip to Paris and this hotel has been my favorite thus far. The breakfast is amazing complete with state of the art coffee machine! The rooms were spacious (for Europe) and the staff was so very friendly. We were very close to a metro station too. When I return to Paris...this is where we will stay.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly. Great Location. Good value.”
Reviews.Author: SuzyCruiser
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 days and have no complaints. Clean room. Comfy bed. Hot water. Clean towels. Great breakfast. Good air conditioning in a heat wave. Can't beat the location. Very helpful and kind staff. Tiny elevator but so what. It was PARIS! and a great hotel with great atmosphere. Restaurants close and store for snacks or forgotten items is right next door. I would definitely return. Met many Rick Steves readers who also were pleased with their accomodations at Hotel La Bourdonnais.

Reviews.Title: “Mr”
Reviews.Author: RiverCruiser9
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel, clean, close to Eiffel Tower. Market Street, Rue Cler just around the corner. The staff was friendly and helpful. The breakfasts were good. Close to Subway station and bus routes.

Reviews.Title: “Feels like You're Staying and Grandma's House!”
Reviews.Author: cyberbabe76
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for our 15th anniversary when we were in Paris. We loved this hotel. It was the only place in France where we found a friendly face. It felt like coming home at night because the people were so friendly and didn't mind helping a nice clueless American couple find their way around Paris (the subway entrance was very close to the hotel and that was nice too.) The rooms were very clean and were furnished in antique looking French furniture (like Grandma's house!). The bathroom was HUGE by Paris standards and was very clean and nice. We told the staff we were on our "second honeymoon" and requested a room with a view of the tower. They happily obliged and we had an excellent view. The hotel has a beautiful room up front for use of the internet (no wi-fi in the rooms that I heard of) but the wi-fi use was free and the computer was nice. I spent hours online looking at hotels before we selected this one. I was not disapponted at all with our experience. We loved it and would stay again in a heartbeat! The only negative thing was the shuttle service the hotel uses (Paris Shuttle -an entirely different company from the hotel) The shuttle company are a group of RUDE incompetent fools. They told us the wrong place to meet when picking us up, drove over 100 mph (yes, I did the conversion!) and droped us off at the wrong terminal on our way home nearly causing us to miss our flight!

Reviews.Title: “An excellent hotel in all aspects”
Reviews.Author: IloveParis40
Reviews.Content: I can only second what all the recent reviewers have said: nice quiet room, even though it's on a busy street; right near the Rue Cler in one direction and the Champs de Mars and the Eiffel Tower in the other. One warm evening we went to the Champs de Mars at 10:00 to check out the Eiffel Tower "bling bling" and felt right at home with all the people who were picnicking on the grass, engaged in conversation with their friends or family members, playing musical instruments, or taking photographs. Hotel La Bourdonnais is conveniently located near Les Invalides as well and, of course, many great cafes, patisseries, boulangeries, shops - the list goes on. The staff was excellent - very helpful at all times. The room was very large for a Paris hotel room, always clean, and very comfortable. And did I mention air conditioned, although we didn't need it? The breakfast was excellent, fresh, varied. I have already recommended this hotel to others and hope to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel in a Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: esp2068
Reviews.Content: I definitely recommend this hotel. Not much to add to the other recent reviews. I agree with them. Great location. Nice, clean room. Slightly more spacious than most quad rooms in France. Very spacious bathroom. Convenient walk to Eiffel Tower and restaurants on Rue Cler. Close to the metro so easy access to all the main sights in Paris. We would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Look No Further... This is your Paris home away from home.”
Reviews.Author: DorathyK
Reviews.Content: My last trip to Paris was my third, and I have to say that this hotel, by far, did not compare to any other hotel I had stayed in while visiting Paris perviously. I had decided after traveling to Paris with my husband, for my fifth anniversary, and with friends, for fun and shopping, that it was time to treat my parents to a once-in-a-lifetime trip to Paris, with their daughter. I was in search for the perfect place. I wanted a good area, and I needed it to be safe. I wanted the hotel that could accomindate three travels, which in Europe is not as simple of a request as you think, if you're from North America (Canada). I wanted the hotel to be surrounded with iconic scene's of Paris (the Effiel Tower, small shops and cafes), so that when we stepped out into the streets there would be no doubt to where we were. Hotel La Bourdonnais had it all, and then some. When we arrived from our cross atlantic flight we went stright to the hotel. From the outside it looked like something out of a movie. Picture perfect from the outside. The staff greated us so warmly and were quick to offer us something to drink and a comfortable chair to rest in. Even though we were not scheduled to check in untill 3:00, our room was ready, and they were more then happy to gives us our keys so we could rest. The room was perfect. It was very clean, nicely decorated and spacious. We had three single beds, a toilet closet, a bathing room, two wonderful floor to ceiling iron-rod window doors that opend up to a courtyard below, desk, fridge, Flatscreen tv, and a small halloway seperating the door leading to the hallway and into the actual suit (my dad claimed that as his private dressing area, away from us ladies). It felt like home away from home, and a far cry, like I said, from pervious hotels I had stayed in while in Paris... small and stuffy. The hotel offered free WiFi down in the hotel parlor. Large flatscreens and excellent wireless connection. I never had a problem getting a computer or delays in transmission. The hotel resturant, which offered us buffet breakfast each morning, 12E for outside guests, was to die for. Fresh bread, pastry's, cheeses, juice, and fruit. There was a beverage machine that dispenced coffee, hot water for tea, espresso, and hot chocolate. There were dry ceral, yogurt and jams and butter, eggs, bacon and toast. Topped off with bistro tables under a galss inclosure... it was the only way to start of a parisian morning. Once we were full and ready to hit the streets, the hotel staff was able and willing to help out with passes to exhibits, like the Effiel Tower and Louver (with line bypass) and maps with directions to almost anywhere we wanted to go. They offered to make dinner reservations, at great resturants, and arrange to have a car waiting to bring us there. Honestly, no detail was spared. I paided about $1200 (Canadian) for the week, for three people, including daily breakfast. For all that we got, I felt as if they were paying us to stay there the value was so good. Being so close to the river, metro, Effiel Tower and D'orsy, we saved allot of time getting to where we wanted to visit that we maximinzed our time not having to travel from further area's to get to many attractions. Taxi's can be expensive, and even though the metro is GREAT, if you're far you have to spend the time getting around if you opt to stay further away to reduce hotel costs. I have done the math and time calculations, its worth the money to stay central, especially if you need to return to your hotel after a long day out sightseeing to freshen up for an evening out. I cannot say enough good things about this place, and I do have something to compare it to. So if you're wondering where to stay on your next visit to Paris, look no further.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money near the Eiffel Tower”
Reviews.Author: loganmaxted
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at three different hotels in the Rue Cler area--this is definitely the nicest, though more expensive than the other two. But it is great value for the money--our "twin" bedroom had two double beds, a huge bathroom with two sinks and plenty of counter space, a good shower, clothesline. The bedroom itself was spacious, very quiet, with a view of the Eiffel tower from the window, flat screen tv, table and chairs, good mattresses, and a safe. The elevator is big enough for four people, not a tiny phone booth that can't hold one person plus a carry-on bag. Breakfast (included in our room rate) was actually good, and coffee very good in a pleasant garden-like room. Free WiFi plus two computers in the salon. Metro a few steps away, also several busses.. The street (Bourdonnais) is uninteresting, but Rue Cler market street, Eiffel Tower, Les Invalides, a great bakery (Pain Epi) are all close at hand.Staff was always helpful and friendly. If we stay in this area of Paris again it will definitely be at this hotel. .

Reviews.Title: “A Great Find and Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: Marnie81
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a perfect location near the Eiffel Tower, the boat bus to many attractions, and the train stop--we rode the train from the airport to the hotel with no problem. It is a gem, small, charming, with wi-fi access. Our room on sixth floor had a view of the Eiffel Tower (3/4ths) from our window. The breakfast was generous with many options. The staff were friendly, bilingual, and very helpful. And comparatively, we felt it was a great value.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Service”
Reviews.Author: bellemarierose
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in a wonderful neighborhood that is accessible to the Metro and to buses that took us to every sight we wanted to see. The staff was very helpful and professional. Our room was clean and well-appointed. The bathroom was large and comfortable. The breakfast was great. We had the trip of a life time!

Reviews.Title: “I would highly recommend this hotel”
Reviews.Author: brid2007
Reviews.Content: we had booked into a hotel in the next block & had to leave because it was so terrible & found this hotel. Spacious Room, CLEAN, old style french furniture, ensuite with bath & shower, free internet, helped us book events nearby, friendly staff, Just a super hotel & only 5 mins walk to the Eiffle Tower & 3 mins walk to a metro stop

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: beans679
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had a short break staying in the hotel in April. Check in and check put was very quick and easy and the staff were very friendly throughout and always willing to give advice and recommendations. We has a room on the sixth floor with a view of the Eiffel Tower. There was a small lift which was always readily available. Our room was clean and well decorated with a small balcony. The hotel is in a good location, being only a short 5-10 minute walk to the Eiffel Tower, and close to a metro station at the end of the road. There is a supermarket next door to the hotel and plenty of bars/cafes nearby. All in all I would have no hesitation in recommending this hotel and we would definitely stay here agian when we return to Paris

Reviews.Title: “great location and great value”
Reviews.Author: misstee83
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here for 2 nights in July and were very impressed with this hotel. The room was very spacious and clean with everything we required, as was the large bathroom. We were about 2 minutes walk from the Eiffel Tower and l'Ecole Militaire metro station so we were perfectly located for sightseeing. The staff were helpful and spoke English so checking in and out was very simple and hassle free. We would definitely stay here again and would highly recommend for anyone looking for a base near the Eiffel Tower.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint Hotel, Desirable Location, Attentive Staff, and Clean Room”
Reviews.Author: parktontravelwriter
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for eight days at the end of March 2010. We traveled as a family of four with 14 and 11 year old boys. The reviews were accurate, so we were fully satisfied with the hotel. The hotel was still being renovated. A couple of days the paint odors in the halls were a bit offensive, but the odor did not invade our room. That and the warm room temperature would be are only complaint for our stay. With the heat turned off in our room and temps just above freezing outside, we were warmer than we prefer in our room. Most buildings in Paris set the temperature higher than the States, which we found a bit confusing considering the lighting is kept very low to reduce energy consumption. We opened the windows for 15 minutes to cool the room off. Some of the many positives were that our 5th floor quad room was updated, clean and larger than I expected compared to other big cities (NY, DC, London). I was expecting no room to walk around, but we had enough of space to lay out our belongings. The furniture was antique, so appropriate for the setting. The room was cleaned and linens were changed daily. The flat screen TV was sufficient for the room size. The bathroom was tight, but we managed. Bring a bar of soap and shampoo if you don't want to use the body wash dispenser. The view was great on the balcony (really a ledge with no room for furniture). The windows kept the street noise to a minimum. Rarely heard guests in adjacent rooms. Occasionally heard guests using the main elevator that was located outside our room. None of that noise was offensive. It was nice having the living room by the lobby to lounge around in at the end of the day and the use of the two computers. Outlets were plentiful in the living room for plugging in and recharging electronics (bring an extra converter if traveling with teenagers). Also good place for behaved kids to hang out with their electronics when adults needed time to themselves (and visa versa). Ate the breakfast twice and was satisfied. The reduced rate for a family of four was comparable to other breakfasts nearby when you consider the unlimited food and coffee. The Staff was very accommodating and gave us prompt attention whenever we had a need. We relied on internet for local info and recommendations, although we did book our return to the airport with the hotel staff with great success. Also wanted to commend the staff for promptly communicating via email in the months before our trip and providing the room location we requested.. We loved that the hotel is located in a comfortable Paris neighborhood rather than a tourist or business district. Felt very safe at all times. This was probably the cleanest part of Paris. We kept noting how spotless the area was kept. There are tourists sites nearby (Eiffel tower, Napoleon's Tomb and Army Museum), but also elementary schools and local hang outs. We walked home from the Arc-de-Triomphe at the end of a day of sightseeing without being too tired out. Being a relatively new part of Paris, the sidewalks are wider, affording a pleasant cafe experience compared to the denser parts of the city. We preferred to rely on Bistros and market streets (such as nearby pedestrian Rue Cler) for frequent small meals throughout the day. Boulangeries have excellent baguette sandwiches for lunch. Was fun to pretend to be a Parisian and gather your meal at shops and bring back to room. Hotel staff gave us plates, cork screw and wine glasses. Our room had a small table for eating light meals. There are three mini-supermarkets within a block for snacks, drinks, wine, etc. ATM's are everywhere. We used the buses a little more than the METRO. The Metro stop was half a block away. Metro is quick, however, a few destinations by Metro required a long walk when we transferred. A bus hub with direct connections to many attractions is at the nearest intersection and other bus routes are no more than a block away. The bus is more intimidating than the Metro, but worth the effort to learn. Can't say enough about the buses. Unlike US buses, the buses have huge windows and theater seating, so much more to see than the Metro. Most bus stops and all buses have electronic messaging for tracking bus stops and max. minutes to next destination. The buses were cleaner than the Metro. Bus riders tended to be folks used to a slower pace like older workers or students, consequently felt more relaxed and safer than Metro. We had bus route guides printed from the RATP website before we left the states, so we knew where the bus stops were located. Be aware that the bus driver only takes exact change so you need to buy your carnet of tickets at the subway or a tabac shop. I would highly recommend staying here and will definitely stay here again should we return to Paris. TIP: We found the ultimate Paris market to be the Sunday/Thursday Bastille market for food shopping pleasure. The market is about a 20 minute Metro ride away (no transfers.) Wow, what a selection of good quality food at low prices. French merchants make an art of wrapping your purchase compared to the states, even the vendors at the market. The vendors recommended the cheese and sausage for our picnic. My wife also bought some better priced gifts of jewelry and scarves.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: CAGOttawa_Canada
Reviews.Content: I recently travelled to France with a friend for a vacation in Paris and Provence. Hotel La Bourdonnais is in a wonderful location, close to the Tower and Les Invalides, easy access to the Metro and buses. We especially liked its proximity to Rue Cler and the little shops and restaurants found there. My preference is to return to a neighbourhood close to my hotel after a day of sightseeing, to enjoy good food and wine at a reasonable price followed by a short stroll "home". That is easy to do at Hotel La Bourdonnais. The only upgrade I would have appreciated would have been a better quality mattress, hard to find in a three-star hotel. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful, the washroom was remodelled and spacious, and the breakfast was excellent. The elevator is tiny, but that just adds to the charm. We had a view of the Eiffel Tower from our sixth-floor room.

Reviews.Title: “Great Honeymoon Location”
Reviews.Author: RyanNashville
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for our honeymoon in july 2009. We were a little intimidated about visiting Paris, seeing as how we'd never traveled out of the country before, and the language barrier. I spoke some French, but nothing to brag about. This hotel was absolutely fantastic! The people at the front office are very nice. I tried to speak a little french, but they easily realized we were american (given my southern american accent). However, they were very polite and helpful. If you need advise on the area, just ask. The room was ok, but we were hardly in the room since it is paris and all. The bed was actually quite big. It had that little bit of old paris in it. The location couldn't have been better. It was about a ten minute walk to the Eiffel Tower, which was great. Close to the metro station, nice restaurants, and a small supermarket which was great. It was a nice, quiet, and safe part of town. I was afraid with it being so close to the tower that it would be noisy and crowded. But it was far enough from the tower where it was quiet, yet close enough to walk to. Close to ATM machine. It was a bit pricey, but then again, it is Paris. My wife and I loved it, and recommend it to everyone we talk to. Would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel in superb location... minutes from Eiffel Tower”
Reviews.Author: yogaflowjo
Reviews.Content: Stayed here last September with my son... liked it so much, we are returning this coming September (2010). Location is superb, rooms are charming and comfortable, breakfast is included in the tarrif and although we only had baguette and jam was most enjoyable. Cannot comment on cooked breakfast. Staff were friendly... we could see the Eiffel Tower from our balcony.. minutes walk from a metro station... nothing to complain about at all really... would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great find!”
Reviews.Author: abumbolina
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel based on what other tripadvisor comments said. It was well worth it. This hotel is a 10 minute walk from the Eiffel Tower and a 3 minute walk to the nearest metro stop. Rooms are spacious and clean, staff are friendly and willing to help and the breakfast was good.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location at a Great Price”
Reviews.Author: NuttyGirl323
Reviews.Content: My best friend and I traveled to France last year for our 40th birthdays. Paris, and the Hotel La Bourdonnais, was our base. What a great little hotel! Unfortunately, I can't locate the pictures of the hotel I took, but it was what I would call a boutique hotel. The location near La Tour Eiffel was perfect. We walked there every evening. It was close to the metro and we shopped for bread, cheese, etc on the Rue Cler. The hotel itself was lovely. It's an older hotel so it's not perfect, but it had lots of charm. Our room with 2 double beds was great for 2 women with too much stuff. And it had a little dorm frig (which we failed to discover until the last day!). The staff was very friendly, and the good breakfast every morning before our 10-12 hour days of touring got us off to a great start. I would highly recommend this hotel, and would stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “good value hotel”
Reviews.Author: WelshwomanTraveller
Reviews.Content: Extremely friendly and helpful staff. The rooms are very clean and comfortable, with new & spacious bathrooms. If you have a late flight and want to spend your last day out and about sight seeing, the hotel will store your luggage in a back room until you are ready to collect it. They accomodated our request for a room with a view of the tower, we stayed in room 501, which had a small balcony overlooking the Avenue de la Bourdonnais - perfect. Exellent location just 5-10 minutes walk to the Eiffel Tower & just 2 minutes around the corner to the metro. This hotel is exellent value for money, and would definitely look to stay here again if we return to Paris

Reviews.Title: “Quite nice.”
Reviews.Author: Zicher
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights this week - first week in Feb 2010 - and stayed in room 405. We arrived on Eurostar and used the Metro to get to the station round the corner from the hotel which took about 30 minutes. If you're doing the same, use the ticket machines rather than queuing at Gar de Norde and buy a single for $1.60. All single journeys are the same price so the longer your journey the better value for money it is. You could also buy a zone 1+2 day pass for $5.60 which is only useful if your making more than 4 trips. On arrival at the hotel there was none of the usual form filling, passport photocopying, credit card swiping that occurs at every single other hotel in the world. We just gave our name and were given the key to our room. Floor 4 had been recently decorated and looked fantastic. Our room on the other hand had not been decorated and was typically European e.g. old decor and a bit small but was absolutely fit for purpose. All we needed was a bed to fall into after long days of exploring the city. We didn't eat the hotel breakfast and so I can't comment on it. For $60 for two people over two days we could have bought a weeks worth of croissants, jam, fruit and coffee around the corner from the Carre Four. Location wise, the hotel is great. A 2 minute walk from the Military School metro station and around 10 minutes walk to the Eiffel Tower. The metro is a brilliant and relatively cheap way of negotiating your way around the city and a much better way of getting to know the city than riding around in a cab (which will soon drain your spending money). All in all a nice hotel, not amazing, but nice.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: Lovelystopover
Reviews.Content: Always wanted to go to Paris. We were told everything was expensive. I agree that things were dearer than most places, but we were pleasantly surprised & pleased with everything at La Bourdonnais. We had a view of the Eiffel Tower from our room & trains & buses were almost at our door. Paris is best seen on foot & even though it was very hot we enjoyed the scenery. Our room was lovely, the breakfasts were plentiful & we found the staff helpful. My husband, daughter & myself would happily tell people about this hotel. Melbourne Australia

Reviews.Title: “A lovely little hotel close to the Eiffel Tower”
Reviews.Author: Vix63
Reviews.Content: Having stayed in some flea pits in Paris, I persuaded my partner to spend a little more money and we found this hotel, close to the Eiffel Tower. We arrived late and the staff were very pleasant. The room was clean and spacious with a lovely bathroom - although the bath was a little small. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location for Eiffle Tower”
Reviews.Author: SandiWoodbury
Reviews.Content: Wonderful location for the Eiffle tower. We walked there and caught the tour buses. The room was very pretty and large for European standards. We had 2 double beds and a bathroom. There is an elevator so you don't have to carry luggage up stairs. My husband and I traveled with our teenage daughters and found we had lots of space. The desk staff all spoke english and were very helpful with planning. There were lots of shops and restaurants to visit. We bought a 2 day ticket for the tour bus and used that as our transportation to get to other places and see the city sights as well. It was a GREAT hotel and we would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great residential area within close proximity of all attractions”
Reviews.Author: StanAmana
Reviews.Content: I wasn’t sure what to expect with this hotel, even though the reviews were good. Paris hotels are very unpredictable. The hotel was great and staff friendly, there was even an Aussie guy working there, his uncle owned the hotel. Having said that all the staff spoke English anyway. The room we had was large, and the bathroom was enormous….for Paris!!. The area that the hotel is in is primarily residential (nice and quiet) so there are many supermarkets within a 100-200mtr radius, which is great. All items water, breads, pastries, cheeses, wines are really cheap. There is also a small walking mall just around the corner that has many cheap eateries, both restaurant and café style which is great. It also has some lovely bakeries. Just beware there are also some very expensive restaurant /cafes just up the road on the main corner that will cost you $34Euro for 2 coffees, 2 hot chocolates and 2 small cakes…yikes! We had breakfast included in our room cost and it was very good. It was all self serve but the coffee, breads, cheeses and pastries were delicious. The breakfast hot food is limited to bacon, scrambled eggs, mushrooms and potatoes but none the less delicious. The Metro station is just round the corner making it easy to get around the city. I also highly recommend the on off bus. Make sure you get the 2 day pass as this will allow you time to actually get on, get off and then see things. There is so much to see in Paris and 1 day won’t cut it. The hotel is also just a 5 minute walk through the Champs de Mars park to the Eiffel tower and then another 2 mins to the Trocadero. Make sure you go to the tower at night it is amazing. It is quite unnerving with all the soldiers around though, but at least you kinda feel safe. This is also a good place to get the on off bus as it is a transfer post for these buses, by that I mean you can transfer from one route to another. Also here you can get the RER train that takes you to the Palace of Versailles, much much much much cheaper and quicker than doing a pre-booked one. E.g. Our friends, who were in Paris at the same time, paid $77 Euro each to do a half day tour, we paid $35Euro each (which included the train fare ) and that included the guided tour through the Kings Private Apartments, which you don’t get on your self tour. Don’t be afraid to go it alone it is very easy to get to. A tip to avoid the long queues is to pay and print your ticket online…this will save you a heap of time especially if you don’t get to the palace early to get a spot at the front of the queue. You will need a whole day to do the Palace and the gardens…actually I reckon you will need 2 days to do the lot. As I mentioned the Eiffel tower is a must at night, however both day and night it is amazing, and to think they were going to pull it down. Get ready to be hassled by the many African gents trying to sell you souvenirs and also most importantly, be extra ready and aware of the many many gypsies (they are everywhere in Paris) that will be constantly asking you for money. The best thing to do is just ignore them and keep walking, if you’re standing just ignore them but just be aware that they may distract you for one of their party top pick pocket you or your family. Another trick is that they walk past you and pick up what looks like a gold wedding band and ask you if it’s yours…whatever you do don’t take it cause the harassment will start in earnest. Just ignore them and they will go away, or you can just tell them to p@#s off in a very terse voice and they will leave. Tip for avoiding the enormous elevator queue at the Eiffel tower is to buy a ticket that allows you to walk up to the first level(this queue is tiny) of the tower(it is not a difficult walk for any able bodied person with average fitness, not to mention the kids will love it), once up on the first level you can then buy your elevator ticket top go up to the next level and then buy the final elevator ticket to go all the way to the top and the best thing….there are no queues at any of these levels to get your ticket. Yes it costs the same as getting your ticket at the bottom. Most people don’t realise that the Eiffel tower has 3 levels of viewing. The “walk up to the first level” ticket box can be accessed at the left foot of the tower if you are looking at the Eiffel tower from the park. Each level will give you a different perspective on Paris. As I mentioned before, the Metro stop is just round the corner and we used this to go to Notre Dame and then walked from Notre Dame to Le Louvre, pleasant 15min walk. Most of the other places we did via the on off bus. Use both to suit your itinerary. Once at the Louvre your are within walking distance to Jardin des Tuileries, Place de la Concorde & Avenue des Champs Elysees amongst many other locations. One place you must see is the Opera National De Paris, you will be totally amazed and the view into the Paris streets from the first floor balcony is to die for, the view before you looks like a postcard. I could go on and on other places you must see is the Arc de Triomphe (go to the top for amazing views), the shops along the Champs Elysee, the Trocadero area, a cruise on the river Seine day and night, Montmarte, Sacre Coeur, Moulin Rouge (not much chop, over rated). There is so much more……. But rest assured we never felt threatened even walking around late at night and the Metro is safe even in these late hours.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Hotel...Great Location”
Reviews.Author: mrd1352
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 nights here in November 2009. It was a very comfortable hotel and the staff was pleasant and helpful. As a previous reviewer stated, the towels did not stink like in some other areas of Europe. The bathroom was modern. The location was great - just a 7-8 minute walk from the Eiffel Tower.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, friendly helpful staff even when I lost key & nicely renovated Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sporean
Reviews.Content: I just returned from my trip and La Bourdonnais is the last hotel I stayed in during my europe Trip. Comparing it to the hotel at Florence and Roma, this is way much better. 1- The towels doesnt stink or smell sour. 2- The bathroom & Shower area are nicely renovated. Very modern. Only problem is no tissue papers provided and the shower water temperature change throughout the bath. lol. Not really an issue too for me but I wish it is more stable. Maybe some problem with central heater tank Shower room door cannot be locked but not an issue for us. I dont lock hotel room's toilet door. Due to the new coat of paint, the door will go 'eee yakkkk kwakkk' when its abt 3/4 closed. Toilet door is fine Previous reviews talk abt leaking. I checked carefully for this and no leaking at all. Prior to this booking, I am informed by the hotel that the leaking problem has ceased. 3- Bed is reasonable comfortable. We have a room with 2 double bed. Pillow is fluffy? I like that. They have plasma TV and its something 'rare' throughout the Europe trip. The mini bar doesnt seem to work. Not cold. Aircon is okay. Can see it and can control it haha. No leaking. The elffiel tower view is blocked as the next building is under going construction. 4-Breakfast is provided in the booking. Although the spread isnt much, its above average for the foods provided compared to other hotels I have stayed in. Pastry is nice Bonus: Coffee machine that lets us choose hot chocolate, Espresso, Cupucinno etc. This is the best one I have found among all my stay in Europe (so far think i stayed at 5-6hotels for the trip, 4stars most of the time). Their orange juice is fresh too. I really wish I can enjoy my breakfast but I need to rush out for shopping :P 5-Staff I am one that likes to chat up with people haha and I must say that the staff here is very friendly. The uncle in charge of breakfast is a Chinese so its easier and normal that we can 'click'. But u wont find him chatting up with other guests The lady at front desk is also friendly too. We took the disneyland package from the hotel. Pay 8 pounds or so at hotel and balance at disneyland. Still cheaper than the board rate offered at Disney The guy in charge at night is friendly too. We lost the hotel room key and he helped us open the door and also replaced the plate on the hotel room promptly when we told him we lost the key. He assured me that even if someone picked up the room key, they wont be able to access the room anymore. He is extremely nice and never did he show any unhappiness or displease when he helped us with the door lock n card. I cannot imagine what will happen if I choose any hotel, including those at Pullman Bercy where some staff are more 'cold' and show unhappiness even when u asked one more qn on international calls. The door system is more of 'manual' like a key lock system where u have holes punched in the card and they have to match to open it up or so. THe only problem i find is I have to insert the card all the time when I want to open the door. In this case, there's been many times I have forgot to take out the card after I entered the room. At night, the main door is locked and i dont think a lot of people knows. Its safer to lock at night and the guy in charge (same person at night) has to manually press the button to let us go in and out of the hotel door. They have an airport pickup at 40 Euro for 2pax but we are told its unreliable because the driver has to wait for passengers. If the previous ones are late, then it will affect all the rest of the passengers. Train is said to be of low frequency on Sun. So we asked the guy to help us book for a cab We didnt know if its by meter or by per charge. Guess too busy to check. We are charged 60 Euro for the trip to Paris Airport and the car is big. Able to fit in 4 passengers and at least 4 big luggage. More like MPV? but bigger. Driver is already waiting for us at the hotel. We are late for 5mins after the check out. The housekeeping lady didnt enter our room when we put 'Do not disturb' sign. I know some other hotels does that. We asked for new towels and we make an 'exchange' with our old towels. 6- Location Very near to Elffiel Tower. We walked to the park at ard 11.55pm and at 12midnight, we saw the elffiel tower flashing blink blink!!! So surprised. They flashed for just a while and stopped. Although we are so near to Elffiel Tower, we only see it once as we are busy shopping. Easy to navigate because the metro station is really nearby. The 2 restaurants located nearby close at 1am and 11pm respectively. Foods are nice although the one that closed at 11pm (more pricey) is more salty. Summary I am not sure if the price i paid for is expensive or cheap but I must say that this is a cosy and nice hotel. Might look old because it is old (hundred + years old) but its still a decent hotel. Lobby is pretty and they give access for internet 30mins. Have 2 pc available and 1 printer. We managed to print out airline checkin with the printer. Its weird there's another door to be opened when the lift reached the hotel room level. After sometime u will get used to it. Its small and can only fit 1 person + 1 big luggage for one to 'enjoy' the lift with spacious space. Check in time 2pm but we arrived at 11am and as room is available, we are allowed to check in early. Otherwise, we have to leave our luggage with them and head for disneyland. Hot water is easily available. I do it the 'self service' way at the breakfast area although the guy offered to help me. We asked for car booking and we are informed that the phone isnt place properly. So at least we know the morning call is going to work in the morning Metro station is just 3mins walk away. Before u know it, u are already at the metro. I have bought Louis Vuitton bags and Chanel bags for my paris trip. They are placed in the room and I didnt have the space to pack all in my lugguage. So they are placed in big shopping bags with their own labels in the room. No issue and my things are still intact. So its pretty safe to put items in the room without being disturbed. I will defintely choose this hotel again if I am going back to Paris and want to stay near Elffiel Tower. The staff is nice. Its just a 2min walk to the park to get a decent view of the tower from far. (The tower dont look small) from the park. Just a note: Remember to remove the hotel card from the door after u open the door. Ensure that the door is really close. U have to push it to close it. Most hotels room doors have the system for it to close by its own but this hotel dont.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable hotel near Eiffel Tower”
Reviews.Author: BobGski
