Reviews.Content: Hotel was comfortable and clean but not a great value. A bit pricey for the amenities. Staff were not especially friendly; and every service that they provided had a price. Buffet breakfast is good but pricey. Not one English speaking channel on TV. Room had king sized bed and nice sized bathroom. Our room was away from the main street and was very quiet. Having a small refrigerator was a nice touch. Location was good in that it was close to a subway stop and also walking distance from Eiffel Tower and Invalides. There were some restaurants within walking distance but these were not good values either. Grocery store nearby that combined with the in-room refrigerator provides a respite from high food prices.

Reviews.Title: “good location”
Reviews.Author: RocknRollStar
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with 6 others in 3 rooms for a single night. My room was dark and dull whilst the others were better. Bathrooms were all new as were the carpets but the decor and the carpets in the corridor had seen better days. Stayed here as they had a special internet rate, however, this place is definitely not worth the full price. The breakfast was also provided at a special price of 9 euros, for which there was a small buffet to choose from. The best thing about the hotel is its good location. It is in a nice part of Paris, and a few minutes walk will take you to the Eiffel Tower.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Nice Hotel, recommended.”
Reviews.Author: bellaire1
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 nights here Sept. 18-21. The location is awesome, close to the Eiffel tower of course, close to the boats, close to the Metro which gets you just about anywhere else you need to be. The staff was very friendly, professional, and helpful. Always available and attentive to our requests. We purchased tickets to Eiffel tower at the front desk as recommended by others. This was a BLESSING, as the lines were at least an hour long when we got there but since we already had tickets we walked right up to the line you go to if you already have tickets, they escorted us in and we immediately got on an elevator. Thanks to the staff at La Bourdonnais for this great suggestion. BTW if you live in the US you can buy tickets to The Louvre on line in advance and avoid that long line as well. Back to the hotel, the room was typically small as are most Paris hotel rooms, oddly the bathroom was very large, that was very nice. Plenty of hot water anytime of the morning or evening. The room was clean and bed comfortable. Housekeeping was great. No room complaints at all, the AC worked great. The morning breakfast is very good as well, so if your booking a room, try to book it with the continental breakfast, which is actually a continental breakfast plus bacon/eggs. It was very nice to be able to get a good breakfast at the hotel before heading out for the day. No issues with noise from the streets. Okay yes the lift is small, so what, geez I cant believe people complain about this. Obviously they have never tried to add an elevator to a two hundred year old building. It was small, but very efficient. Thanks to a great front desk staff for making our stay in Paris very enjoyable. Highly recommend this hotel. ps..we booked thru Otel.com and beat all other rates including the hotels own website.

Reviews.Title: “Gem of a Hotel, Fabulous Staff, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: DumontVictoria_BC
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel La Bourdonnais for 2 weeks this past September. I was delighted with the charming room which was quiet & soundproof, large by Paris standards - especially the renovated bathroom - and always clean. The lobby area was also generous with two computers for our use and wifi. The staff were fabulous - friendly & helpful, especially Xavier and Julie! I had breakfast a few times - lots of variety with eggs, bacon, ham, breads, juices, cereal, coffee, etc. The location is great - a supermarket next door, the Rue Cler district within a 5 minute walk with its markets, wine stores, bakeries, cheese & chocolates shops, and cafes, and about a 15 minute walk to the Eiffel Tower. The Metro is within 5 minutes. As a single woman, I felt totally safe in the area. I had researched several hotels & this was my first choice - I was so happy here & would definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “New favorite hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Travelers058
Reviews.Content: This was the third hotel we've stayed at in Paris and we'll book here from now on. A great value, friendly and capable staff, perfect location, a nice sized room with a very modern bathroom. And a wonderful breakfast! Lots of very good restaurants in walking distance and A/C that works well if you need it. Free internet and a comfy lobby/lounge -- we were very pleased.

Reviews.Title: “Great family hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: RachelOSW4
Reviews.Content: Perfect location, just steps from the Eiffel Tower and a metro stop. It took a lot of looking to find a hotel that could fit a family of 4 into one room. This hotel had decent sized rooms and friendly service. Check the hotel's website for specials. We booked through the website in advance and got a rate that included breakfast - a great savings when you are feeding 4 people. Not the cheapest hotel in town but a has great charm and a super location.

Reviews.Title: “I would stay there again”
Reviews.Author: sandre3
Reviews.Content: My husband and I enjoyed our recent stay. We had asked for a room with twin beds and were given a room with two double beds. The room was large compared to other rooms we've had in Europe. The bathroom was so spacious we stored our suitcases there. The staff was friendly and quick to respond to the one problem we had: the wall mounted hair dryer would not shut off. This hotel is located with very good access to public transportation: buses, Metro. The neighborhood is delightful.

Reviews.Title: “Location and Great Staff!!!!”
Reviews.Author: KatheOlka
Reviews.Content: This hotel is by far the best ever, the staff are wonderful, very helpful, very courteous. As soon as we arrived in the hotel our keys were ready, the wonderful lady directed us in our room. The hotel has free wifi. Our room was magnificent, we had, telephone, airconditioned room, flat screen tv and the bathroom was very spacious. We are 2 blocks away from Eiffle Tower!!!! There are restaurants everywhere. We love this hotel very much that we are planning to visit France again we will stay in this hotel!! To the management of Hotel La Bourdonnais, I give you 5 stars, it was our best stay ever!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Paris hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jenbabe411
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel from Sept. 9-14 and loved it! The room was small but not cramped at all. Had a desk and chair and flat screen tv and a great updated bathroom which was big and clean. We also had a room on the 6th floor with a view of the Eiffel Tower which was amazing! The staff was extremely helpful and made resereservations for restaurants and called a show to make sure they had our tickets. We purchased tickets to the Eiffel Tower and a boat cruise from them which saved us a lot of time. The location is perfect next door is a grocery and around the corner is the metro. perfect! The only thing that is a little odd is the elevator is very small. You can fit two people in there without luggage but with luggage each person will go up on there own. Not a big deal at all though. And the free internet int he lobby was very nice! All in all we really enjoyed our stay and have already recommended it to friends and will definitley stay there when we return back! Just perfect! Jennifer D.

Reviews.Title: “Nice little Paris hotel.”
Reviews.Author: noonalexia
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel La Bourdonnais for two nights in Feburary 07. The hotel is very typical for European cities; small hallways, slightly dated decor etc., so it was as expected. The room was decent, and the bathroom recently refurbished, which was nice. The location was great, both for getting to the underground and for walking around by the Eiffel Tower, which is visible from the street outside the hotel. One night when I got back to the hotel, the lights on the Eiffel Tower were sparkling, making it look like the tower was covered in glitter, so I swiftly walked to the park in front of the tower. Spectacular! I would definitely stay at this hotel again, because of the great location and the refurbished bathrooms.

Reviews.Title: “Best Experience Ever”
Reviews.Author: bev2869
Reviews.Content: This was a great Experience, the hotel was close to Eiffel Tower and Buses, Staff spoke English and were always willing to help. Rooms are sparkling and Bathroom new. Lots of rooms Great hotel for the money would always go back there again and again Breakfast was very good as well.

Reviews.Title: “Proberely the Worst Hotel in Paris.....Filthy & Crumbling”
Reviews.Author: italianbrit
Reviews.Content: This hotel is absolutely terrible! We have just got back from a 3 night stay and we paid £100 a night through Expedia. When we read the reviews on here and saw the photos we thought for the first time in our lives lets stay in a 3 star. How wrong! The hotel reception area is filthy with wallpaper comning off the wall and stains on the carpet. Then going upto the room it gets worse with water stains on the walls, crumbling plaster and horrible smells. We stayed in room 111 and it was horrendus. The air conditiioning leaked water everyt ime it was turned on so we had a really stuffy room, the sheets were not clean and we found a pubic hair, the walls were paper thin and all round it was awful. No tea or coffee making facilities, the TV did not work properely with mainly French TV and the bed has given me back pains due to the age of it and how small and crammped we were on it for 2 people. We asked to change, but looked at another room and it was worse! I would not let me dog stay here, it is a rip off. Dont look at the location.....it is still a 10 minute walk to the tower and in a really rough part of Paris, we went out early morning and saw the police cleaning up after a murder....lovely romantic weekend break! If i was to return to Paris, i would stay in the Champ's Elysesse area as the area the hotel was in was not ideal at all.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, good hotel, superb staff”
Reviews.Author: BondiBland
Reviews.Content: Hotel staff were accommodating and can speak English, helped us a lot with our queries. We occupied a quadruple room and its bathroom was newly renovated (perfect!!!) The location is superb, near Metro (Ecole Militaire station), 5 minute walk to Eiffel Tower, plenty of restaurants, bakeries and supermakets nearby. Very pleasant stay and good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Moved us to a less desirable hotel due to renovation”
Reviews.Author: CGronvall
Reviews.Content: We had a paid reservation for 4 since Sept, 2008. When we arrived in Paris on August 3, 2009, we were told that the room reserved was under renovation. Only one floor of this rather large hotel was under renovation. We were never informed of this problem beforehand. The outcome was being put up at a less desirable hotel several blocks away. We were asked to walk to the other hotel carting much of our luggage. All this occured after we had to get up at 3:30 am to catch our flight to Paris. I chose the Bourdonnais Hotel because I had stayed there several years ago and was impressed. It's location is very close to the Eiffel Tower and that is why it was desirable. I have recommended this hotel in past but will not in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent littel boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tattoo4you
Reviews.Content: We booked our trip to Paris and went online to look for a hotel. This hotel was in a great location, everything you need as a tourist was so close and handy. Restaurants, the subway, many of the main attractions were close ( the Eiffel Tower and Napoleon's Tomb ),..., and it was easy to hop on the subway or walk to get to many others, etc. The hotel itself is small which is great. The rooms ( we had 2 double beds ) were clean, and plenty of space, even for 4 people. The bathroom was large also, it looked brand new. The only minor suggestions I would make to improve the room without much effort would be to inlcude a small refridgerator and shelving/furniture to pack away our clothes. For 2 it was fine, but not for four. But this was not a significant inconvenience.

Reviews.Title: “Parisian Chic in Perfect Location!”
Reviews.Author: TajanderStAlbert
Reviews.Content: As this was our first visit to Paris we perused many sources of advice looking for a hotel which would ensure our visit would be an enjoyable one. Thanks to all previous contributors to Trip Advisor for once again assisting the quest to find good value as Hotel de la Bourdonnais came through in flying colours! The only change which we'll make for our next visit will be to visit in May or June as during our week in March it was still to cool to fully enjoy the parks <and the gardens of Versailles were not in bloom yet>. The charm of this hotel is in its venerability. The narrow stairs and hallways creak as you walk through eliciting thoughts of times past. The comfortable sitting area off the main lobby <complete with gratis internet access> exudes old world ambience and comfort. The room itself was of surprising size as no shins were bruised in negotiating around the bed even. We were VERY pleased with the bathroom as it had been completely renovated and was gleaming. The shelf was of sufficient length to store everything in our arsenal. The room/bathroom overlooked the inner courtyard which was quite charming in itself! We did not eat breakfast at the hotel (15 Euros) with one reason being the close proximity of numerous vendors <for fruit> and patisseries<pastries>. Super breakfast for 1/5 of the cost. That being said we DID arrange at the end of the day for drinks to be sent up to the room which were very reasonably priced. There are a proliferation of outstanding restaurants/cafes very close by --- would recommend the Cafe Constant in particular <ended up going back there for final meal even>. Got the tip from Rick Steve's book which was invaluable for many things -- including walking tours. Staff at the hotel were excellent. Smiled at attempts to converse in French as were fully conversant in English <as in all other parts of Paris visited>. Hotel's location is absolutely superb -- quiet city location with so many shops/cafes, etc close by. Eiffel Tower only a short walk away<albeit more than the two blocks advertised>l and just around the corner from a Metro station. The transportation system was EXCELLENT - we had pre-purchased a five-day Paris Visite pass which was used extensively. Had to buy an additional ticket to take the train out to Versailles but that was minimal. Synopsis - if you want new, spacious, and modern this hotel would not be for you. However, should you prefer friendly, warm people in a clean,comfortable environment then would highly recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “We enjoyed this hotel and would definitely stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: TravelingWoman1
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with this hotel. The location is great, close to the Eiffel Tower, Rue Cler, and the metro, on a very nice side street. The room, though not large, was clean, pleasant, and very comfortable. The bathroom was newly renovated and clean. The tub was narrow, with only a swinging panel for use with the shower, but that was not a problem for us. The hotel was quiet, and the staff were all very cordial and helpful. Tthe free internet access in the lobby was a plus. We really enjoyed our stay at the Boudonnais and would definitely stay here again. This hotel is a very good value for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Close to Eiffel and transit....”
Reviews.Author: manabout2wn
Reviews.Content: but so is most of Paris. The room was nice size. We stayed because we wanted 3 beds. (very difficult to find in Paris) The toilet in our room was in a redone tiny closet with the shower and sink across the other side of the room. The evevator is small. Barely big enough for 1 person with his/her luggage. The stairways were narrow. The good parts...the staff was quite friendly and helpful. You are a few blocks from the park taking you to the Eiffel Tower and you are surrounded with excellent places to eat! Would I stay there again....right now I would have to say a rip roaring maybe.

Reviews.Title: “Plenty going for this Hotel but rooms could be spruced up a bit....”
Reviews.Author: Jeeeeeeh
Reviews.Content: Just back from a 3 night stay at Le Bourdonnais to celebrate my wife's birthday and after initially being slightly disappointed with the hotel, by the end of our stay, it had grown on us and we were reasonably happy we'd chosen that hotel out of the thousands we could have chosen in Paris. I had requested a room with a view of the Eiffel Tower and was given a room on the third floor with a distant view of the Eiffel Tower (if I stretched my body out the window and looked to my right I could see the top of it). The only disappointing thing about the hotel was the room, it was small, dated, and in serious need of a fresh coat of paint. However on the plus side, it was spotless clean as were the bathroom and shower. More positives on the hotel as stated by previous reviewers were the location which was excellent - Eiffel, Metro, Supermarkets only a stones throw away, the staff - friendly, helpful and spoke great English, and the breakfast - scrambled egg, bacon, croissants, cereals, yogurts etc and served till 11am!!! All in all, for a first visit to Paris, if you;re looking for a reasonably priced hotel in a great safe location, we would definitely recommend it as a good place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location & Great Family Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mom2Boys
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed here - family of four with two teen-aged boys. Outstanding location - a very easy walk to the Eiffel Tower, around the corner from the Ecole Militaire Metro station, next to a small grocery store, near several banks and many cafes and on a beautiful, relatively quiet street. The entire hotel was perfect for our family. The breakfast was included in our price (we booked online and received 10% off the room rate and breakfast) which of course saves time and money - especially in Paris with 2 teenagers! The breakfast was the same everyday, but was sufficient - scrambled eggs, a breakfast meat, choice of pastries, choice of 2 cereals and yogurts, baguette, and fruit. Always well-stocked and clean, and the room is beautiful and quaint. Our room was spacious by European standards and the beds were comfortable and large enough - my husband is over 6' and both our boys are 5'10". We had a lot of luggage, but were able to find room for all of it. The bathroom was lovely - bigger than the bathroom we had at the Marriott in London. It was beautiful - clean, modern and spacious. The toilet was in a separate in a very tiny space, but functional - how much room do you need for a toilet? A heavy person may find it a bit tight, but average/tall people should be fine. There are two computers in the living room. One is a French keyboard and you will need a password to logon to that computer, but there is another computer with a QWERTY keyboard...no charges or time restraints. No printer, however. The people at the front desk are helpful. One gentleman was nice and helpful when asked, whereas one woman (Danielle, I believe) was wonderful - very friendly and more eager to help. The gentleman at night was extremely friendly and helpful. I would recommend this hotel to anyone - very quaint, spacious, clean and outstanding location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location! Great Staff! Great Rooms!”
Reviews.Author: sunsandpalms
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 3 nights. This hotel was a great base for attractions in the area.( Eiffel Tower, Napoleans Tomb, Rodin Museum etc.) The hotel is very close to the Metro which allows you to travel throughout paris. The staff at this hotel was excellant. They attended to all our needs with a smile. The rooms were great band spacious with some with views of the eiffel tower. We had a great stay and will return.

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat location, hotel is under a bit of reno”
Reviews.Author: D_E1328
Reviews.Content: Ok, first and foremost, you cannot beat this location at all. You are mearly steps away from the Eiffel Tower and gardens. Probably at most a 3-5 minute walk. The hotel is in the residential part 7th Arr, which provides for great scenery and people watching. At night there was a little road noise, but nothing offensive. Great options abound from food, shopping and such. The metro was just around the corner which made it easy to come and go. The room was big. We had two queens and for Paris that is nearly unheard of. The Bathroom was even bigger. Watchout for that step up and out of the tub. But the bathroom was huge. The room was clean, and had a very Parisian style of decorating...say dark reds/maroons and a little victorian style. But overall I thought it was pretty clean. I certainly didn't feel concerned. We had two large windows overlooking the Ave de la Bourdannais. Now the only issue we had was that we were on the 1st floor...actually 2nd for us Americans. The problem with that was the hotel was under a little renovation on the outside...thus scaffolding and such. We had one window blocked because of it. Now, big city, open windows and scaffolding just are the best equation, so that was a concern of ours when we had to leave the windows open at night. The first night was warm and with no a/c this was our main concern. All in all, though this was a very nice hotel, but I'd try for a room on a higher floor.

Reviews.Title: “Make sure you have the ability to checkout without penalty”
Reviews.Author: TAMemberCt
Reviews.Content: This was my third stay at this hotel. I would have recommended it before this last stay. I booked thorugh Expedia. We were put in a tiny room on a floor that was undergoing active construction. The weather turned quite hot. There was no air conditioning. We were given an apology for the stifling sleepless nights, but, frankly a fan would have been preferable. I will never go back to this hotel. If you are considering staying here, I would recommend that you do so only if you can check out without penalty if you encounter problems like we did.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable family lodging by Paris standards with good English speaking staff”
Reviews.Author: cherylfabry
Reviews.Content: Since there aren't many hotels rooms that can accomodate 4 persons, we felt very lucky to find this hotel with the quad room near the sites and with great service. The hotel staff was very friendly and helpful and the hotel was clean and fairly easy to find. The hotel advertised air conditioning in our room but it wasn't working when we checked in; however, they gave us a fan which helped somewhat and fixed the A/C on the third day of our four day stay. The internet was free in the lobby via access to two computers (no wireless) but be sure to use the computer with the English keyboard (not the French keyboard). Be sure to get the hotel's breakfast included special offered online - it costs 15 euro per person or 38 for a family of four. Breakfast consisted of scrambled eggs, bacon, croissants and pastries, cereal, yogurt and cheeses, toast and jam, sliced oranges, and three types of fruit juice as well as hot drinks. The hotel elevator is REALLY small but reliable. There are two staircases but we were on the 5th floor (6 floors from ground level) so we only took them when going downstairs. The hotel is located near the metro, though I highly discourage taking it as it seems to be filled with beggars and mentally unstable people. A great option is the hop on hop off bus services (we used Paris L'Open). If you get a pass for 2 or 3 days, the per day cost becomes much more reasonable. There are four routes that take you almost anywhere you want to go in town and you can also add the water taxi service for an additional cost. Don't expect a great commentary on the bus, though, of the sites - they give you earphones and the English speaker is dull and doesn't say much about the sites - we spent most of our time listening to their piped in music. For those of you with kids, great news - your teenagers will probably be considered children at most sites charging admission (i.e. they get in for free, usually under 18 years of age). Only exception was the Catacombs which started charging at age 14.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and staff”
Reviews.Author: misslizOntario
Reviews.Content: Spent four nights here and really enjoyed it. A charming hotel, loved the location, we even walked to the Arc de Triomphe, and the Louvre, and because we were so close to the Eiffel Tower, we spent a lot of time there and the Champs de Mars, fed the pigeons and people watched. Our grandson was able to practise his French with the staff, they speak excellent English, no problems communicating. It was very handy to have a grocery store next door, as it was a bit of a shock at how expensive meals were, although I didn't have to worry about a budget. I am however, a practical person, and couldn't see spending CDN $200-300 a day for meals in a cafe. Our room was large enough for 2 adults and 1 child, and very cozy, with a large bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “happy to have chosen this hotel for our week stay”
Reviews.Author: clara82
Reviews.Content: We were a family of 4 ( 2 adult children) traveling together on our first trip to Paris. This very nice, comfortable hotel with character was great for us. The room with 2 double beds on the first room level was small, we did not spend much time there, so it was OK. The breakfast was great, in a nice atmosphere, and especially nice host. The lobby room with computers and printer was a pleasant place, and the staff helpful. The location was good for all of our exploring of the city. We have no complaints and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel in 'local's neighborhood'”
Reviews.Author: Daytonagatorgirl
Reviews.Content: This is a great little hotel for a stay in Paris. Located in the 7th arrondisement, just blocks from the Eiffel Tower and Rue Cler. Close to the Etoile Militaire metro stop. There's a little supermarket a couple doors down and the Seine is a nice 4 block walk. Great breakfast.. eggs, bacon, pastries, cereal, bread, yogurt, coffee and juices. Great service.. ALL staff were just wonderful. The double room, with two double beds was nice and roomy (by european standards). We stayed for 8 days and had a great time!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: waterloo63
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a six day stay in Paris. Hotel la Bourdonnais was very nice. The room was small but adequate for the two of us and the location was great. Eiffel Tower-2 blocks(get the tickets at the hotel), Metro- 1 block, Rue Clare - 3 blocks and many restaurants within easy walking distance. Breakfast was very good and free if you booked on-line. Rick Steves book is a must to see and do everything in a limited number of days. The staff all speak english and were very helpful. All in all we had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Location! Location! Location!”
Reviews.Author: tosaro
Reviews.Content: As we always do, we booked our hotel stay based on TripAdvisor reviews. Thank you all for taking the time to do them. Getting there: You could taxi, take the Metro...but I suggest a shuttle hired by the hotel. It's 20E per person. Just book it 2 weeks in advance of our arrival. We used it for our return trip. The location: Step outside the door and take a left - 3 cafes, the Metro, a boulangerie or two and Le Champs de Mars. Take a right - grocery store right next door to the hotel, walk a couple of blocks and take a right - Rue Cler (!!!!), restaurants and shops. And whether you go left or right, the Eiffel Tower is RIGHT THERE! I mean, 5 minutes - BAM - Eiffel Tower. Entry/Front Desk: Warm greetings from the staff, sitting area, very nice library with computers for use and breakfast area (we did not have, but lovely setting). You can leave your luggage here until your room is ready. They exchange currency, sell tickets for the Louvre, Eiffel Tower, Versailles, Moulin Rouge and Open Bus Tour. USE THIS SERVICE. You'll know why when you see the lines as these tourist destinations. Getting to the room: Take the elevator or get your workout on the winding staircase (dizzying!) Fits 2-3 people and perhaps a small bag or two. The room itself : Quaint and Parisian. Room was small, but I was surprised that my request (plea is more like it) for a balconied room was fulfilled. Full on view of the Eiffel Tower (ask for a 5th/6th floor room on Ave de la Bourdonnais). Beds were a bit firm for our liking, but we made do. It got a bit stuffy in the room and all of the A/Cs were out of service (check before booking in the summer); but we opened the large windows and it cooled right down. WC was small, but served its purpose. Bathroom was spacious based on European standards ; it was modern and recently renovated. Overall, I would stay here again. You couldn't beat the location!

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful Hotel in a wonderful location....”
Reviews.Author: Taurus46
Reviews.Content: From booking our stay to checking out we could not fault the helpfulness or service we received from the staff. We were celebrating our Birthdays which are one day apart and the hotel had upgraded our room and left the most wonderful bouquet of flowers in our room along with a hand written note wishing us both a happy birthday, this was a lovely personal touch. The location was perfect with just a few minutes walk to the Eiffel Tower etc. There are also plenty of places to eat/drink within just a couple of minutes walk. Breakfast at the hotel was lovely well presented, and plenty to choose from. We were able to purchase tickets for the open top tour bus (which we would highly recommend) and shows direct with the hotel which was a very good service. The hotel also arranged a shuttle service for us to and from CDG airport, this was very reasonably priced and a very reliable service. The only downside was that we could not stay longer.........

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly locationed to see Paris”
Reviews.Author: OrangeGem
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very helpful and accomodating. The language wasn't an issue - everyone spoke English. The location was perfect - we could even see the Eiffel Tower from our room! The bus was conveniently nearby as was the subway, Rue Cler, and many restaurants. When I return to Paris, I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing and Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: uhhuhcait
Reviews.Content: We only stayed here for one night - the last night of our European trip - but I love loved this hotel. The staff was okay - I wouldn't go as far as to say 'friendly', but not rude either. They let us keep our luggage in a room after checking out, as we took a walk to the park. Our hotel room was different from any of the pictures I saw online. It seemed like an upgraded suite, with a living room area, with beautiful large windows that opened up over a courtyard. The bedroom was pretty well sized for Paris. The bathroom was beautiful and very large, with a fabulous whirlpool, and again, great, large windows opening up to the courtyard. I believe there's only one elevator, and some of the rooms are a little far from the elevator. The location was great for us. We took a few walks around the area, and theres great shopping and dining in the area. It's only a few blocks from the park at the Eiffel tower, and felt like a very safe area. The hotel was very cute and had lots of great character.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel, no complaints”
Reviews.Author: etejoie
Reviews.Content: This hotel was close to a metro stop, and we had a room with three beds which can be hard to find generally in Europe. Overall happy with hotel, they said there was wireless available in the lobby for no charge but we were able to get a signal in our room. There was construction going on so no sleeping in.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, Pleasant Hotel”
Reviews.Author: EveryAprilinParis
Reviews.Content: This is the best hotel of the many we have stayed in in Paris. Friendly, helpful staff. Spotless, spacious room. Quiet except for pre-announced reconstruction noise, which did not bother us. Good breakfasts. Free Internet and newspapers. Good location near Eiffel Tower, Les Invalides, Rodin Museum. Ecole Militaire stop on Metro (Line 8) steps away from the hotel. Many cafes and restaurants in area--La Terrasse at Place Ecole Militaire was very pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but the view meh”
Reviews.Author: Xandermom
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very close to the Eiffel Tower and metro stop (Ecole Militaire). We were treated well by the staff who were able to answer all our questions (in English). The room was different because the toilet was across the room from the rest of the bathroom, including sink. That didn't bother us. We are pretty cheap when it comes to hotel rooms and this room was spacious compared to many we have stayed in. The elevator is incredibly small. The three of us were cozy in it, but I'm not sure we could have fit our luggage in there with us. Our room was on the second floor, so we took the stairs after our first trip up. There are two grocery stores within half a block in each direction so we had a good cheap supply of food. There was a refrigerator in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Great triple room”
Reviews.Author: CATracey
Reviews.Content: I had a hell of a time finding a Parisian hotel with 3 single beds. Most only have a double with a single, which wouldn't work for us since we each wanted our own beds. After searching for about 2 months, I ran across La Bourdonnais and decided to book it. We weren't disappointed. In fact, it worked out perfect. Having the toilet separate from the bathroom proved very useful. The bathroom was pretty big by hotel standards, with large windows and lots of counter space. There was a bathtub and separate shower with good water pressure. Beds were comfortable, linens and towels were decent. The room was surprisingly spacious with plenty of room for our 3 large suitcases. There was also a small refrigerator and an electronic safe. Wifi in the room was 10 euros for a day pass, but free downstairs in the lobby. Breakfast was included in our rate and was above average in my opinion. Overall, I can't think of a single thing to complain about. We were very happy with our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Love this charming hotel...just ignore the squeaky floors!”
Reviews.Author: luvvie996
Reviews.Content: We got the triple room (3 twin beds) and the room was very roomy with great bathroom. (Our friends got a room w/one double bed, and that room was pretty small.) The only thing that was weird was that the toilet was clear across the room from the sink/shower/tub. So after using the toilet, you would have to walk across the room to wash your hands. Otherwise, great location -- blocks from Eiffel tower and very close to a Metro stop! Try to book the room w/free breakfast buffet..it is very good! Also, free internet access! Cute lobby! Love this hotel! Only real con is that the hotel is pretty old w/squeaky floors and stair case. If you can ignore the the age and find it charming then this is definitely the hotel for you!

Reviews.Title: “A great 3 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: funinparis
Reviews.Content: We again visited Paris and stayed at this hotel located in a very safe and very nice part of Paris. The staff was quite friendly as usual and made our stay a delight. The room was as we requested and very clean and well kept. The bathroom had a tub and shower and was very modern. The Internet access is also free in the parlor. The location is near Ecole Militare and close to the Metro. A grocery is next door where we stocked up on wines and snacks which we took to our room. The staff had no problem with our using the parlor to relax with our wine and provided glasses for us as well. If you are looking for a pleasant 3 star stay, we recommend this hotel. This was our fourth visit and we would stay there again upon a return visit to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic time!”
Reviews.Author: Milford-Emerald
Reviews.Content: Our first time to Paris with friends, so a little apprehensive as to whether we had chosen the right location and hotel etc. Pleased to say that we did!!! A clean, tidy, very friendly and perfectly positioned hotel, only two blocks away from the Eiffel Tower. Breakfast wasnt included in the price so some mornings we ate out . The hotels winter garden breakfast room setting was lovely, so well worth trying. If i have to be critical then i would say that the rooms were a little tired and the view reminded me of the film Rear View Window - Hitchcock fans will know what i mean!! A lovely big bathroom though. We were very lucky with the weather for the 5 days that we were there so walked to most of the attractions from our hotel (ok if you like walking that is!) The only time we took the metro was to visit Versailles. Nice little supermarket next door to the hotel - handy!! Dining out in the evening - plenty of restaurants to choose from within the vicinity of the hotel. Food delicious, drinks very expensive - so, yeah, much cheaper from the supermarket!!! We recommend the 7e Vin Restaurant on Avenue Bosquet, not far from the hotel, charming atmosphere with very friendly staff. Would highly recommend this hotel. We plan to visit Rome next so anybody with any advice on hotels and locations i would be grateful to hear from you.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place”
Reviews.Author: Crabbers
Reviews.Content: Stayed for threee nights in February. Found the staff very friendly and they happily spoke English when my French faltered. The room was clean and was tidied every day and I was amazed at how quiet it was once the French windows closed out the busy street outside. The breakfasts were great - all you could eat, from cereal to yogurt, cheese, pastries, bacon and eggs, toast, fresh fruit and all sorts of differnt types of tea and coffee. No bar but drinks could be ordered in the lounge or to your room. Would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: jules24Surrey
Reviews.Content: Wonderful traditionally french hotel in a fabulous location. We stayed for 3 nights with our daughter & her friend ( both early teens) The staff are extremely friendly & helpful and speak very good english, so our basic knowledge of french was not necessary here! Our room although not large was plenty large enough & was on the 5th floor with a balcony & view of the eiffel tower, it was comfortable, warm & very clean, with a fridge. the ensuite bathroom was spacious & modern. The girls room was inward facing but a little larger than ours with a huge bathroom ( teen girls need space!) We took travel kettles as no facilities in room & at £3 euros tea/coffee would eat into our budget. there was some noise from other rooms but this was never a problem to us. breakfast at hotel seemed expensive, we had wonderful petit dejeuner with coffee at local bakery. There is a useful supermarket next door also. The hotel is short stroll from eiffel tower/hotel de invalides/rodin musee/champs de mars etc & also 1 min walk from the metro at ecole militaire. Its so easy to get around on the metro & the Bateau bus down by eiffel tower is excellent way to visit sights along the river (hop on & off) for full day costs about 11 euro per adult and 6 for under 12. A very enjoyable trip!!!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Fussy_Irish_mom
Reviews.Content: I booked this based on Tripadvisor reviews and was delighted with the results. I travelled with a friend and my 4 year old son. The location was great - with the Eiffel Tower in view and only 5 mins walk away. It was also close to a metro station. There were plenty of places to eat within a short walk. Our room was fab with a little lounge area, two double beds and a large bathroom. We were pleasantly surprised at how big it was. We hadn't planned on having breakfast there but did one of the days and although its expensive enough we got loads to eat. Would definitely go back here. Also reception recommended (& reserved for us) a little restaurant around the corner called the Le Septieme Vin. We had a lovely meal there and they did a half portion for my son. Lovely.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: Keithyboy25
Reviews.Content: Considering that this is a reletively inexpensive hotel, it is well worth every penny. The location allows easy access to all the major sights, and being just two bloacks from the Eiffel Tower makes for a memorable stay. Out room was a decent size, with comfy beds, and good facilities. The limited amount of contact we had with the front desk showed them to be polite and helpful There are plenty of good local restaraunts, and both in and around the hotel we didn;t once have any issues with language. We're looking to go to Paris again and will definitely be looking to stay here

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: ilovedogsmore3
Reviews.Content: This hotel was wonderful! The rooms were very clean and they actually had 2 double beds, which are hard to find in hotels in France. They had excellent service and fresh breakfast. Most employees spoke English. The lobby was extremely cozy. It was great after a long flight. The only thing was that our room was not immediately ready, but it was just a misunderstanding. But, overall Hotel Du La Bourdannais was fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: THDukes
Reviews.Content: Hotel la Bourdonnais is awesome. We stayed for a week at this 3 star hotel and loved everything about it. It's charming, lovely, quaint, professional--everything an outstanding hotel should be. The hotel is in a neighborhood with a grocery store next to it, delicious restaurants around both corners. The metro is right down the street. The Eiffel Tower really is a 5 minute walk from the hotel--along with the Branly Museum. The bathroom was so nice--so much bigger than we expected--double sinks at the comfort height level--brilliant. We always had hot water to take showers with. We loved having a balcony and being able to go outside--in the freezing weather--and just watch what was happening in the neighborhood. We really liked that breakfast was from 7 - 11--which allowed us plenty of time to get up, get ready and take our time eating. There was always plenty to eat. The hot chocolate--delish. I sound gushing but when we go back to Paris again we'll be staying at the Bourdonnais.

Reviews.Title: “The wonderful bourdonnais”
Reviews.Author: thatsfabulous
Reviews.Content: Just got from from a 3 night stay at the Hotel La Bourdonnais. We got a good deal on this hotel after coparing prices on money supermarket. There are so much choice in Paris however this hotel stood out to us for reviews and the price and were were not let down. Its located just 10mins walk from the Eiffel tower and just 1 minute from a metro station which is perfect and the metro is very cheap and easy to use. Theres also a supermarket right next door which is great for getting a few bits and also it has lovely sandwiches for under 2euro!! We had breakfast included which was nice they had cheeses, breads, jams etc they also do room serice breakfast for free also. If not included its about 14euro each which for what you get isnt very cheap so Id recommend just going a local cafe. The room was a twin , very clean and a nice size, we were at the front of the hotel and could see just the top of the eiffel tower. Being at the front near the road it was VERY quiet no noise from the street what so ever and also the beds were very very comfy it taken a while to get out in the mornings it was that good of a bed. The hotel staff were poilte, there are two gentlemen who serve breakfast and help with bags etc t were always very friendly and helpfull. I would stay and the hotel bourdonnais again and would recommend to friends. I would also recommend "Parishuttle" a shared shuttle to and from the hotel for 40euro each return we found then to be a wonderful reliable company and would also use them again.

Reviews.Title: “Best Weekend Ever...”
Reviews.Author: TonyandCharlotte
Reviews.Content: I took my partner to Paris for a surprise 50th Birthday treat. He was completely overwhelmed by the whole experience, and totally impressed with the Hotel. He had never been to Paris before, and the best bit was opening the window of our spacious, comfortable room and seeing the top half of the Eiffel Tower. The room was brilliant, the bathroom huge and spotless, and the breakfast was very tasty and filing with lots of choice and a lovely conservatory atmosphere. Overall our experience was superb, i booked the Hotel online through Eurostar but had done extensive research through TripAdvisor previously. I relied on reviews of the Hotel which were extremely accurate, and matched this with a very central location, just a short walk from the Eiffel Tower and some lovely restaurants. I definitely hope to return one day.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: worldtravelor3
Reviews.Content: I have been visiting Paris for over 30 years, even lived there for 18 months. This hotel is one of the better ones with good value for the money: good location, clean, quiet. Would recommend to anyone going to visit Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location...with nice touch of class”
Reviews.Author: Seat11A
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 3 days on business, and location was superb along with service, meals, and value for money. Would highly recommend, as it came to me highly recommended by a colleague who only stays here when in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great economy hotel”
Reviews.Author: Peg4157
Reviews.Content: We needed a hotel for one night in Paris and didn't want to spend a lot of money. The Hotel La Bourdonnais was clean, comfortable and in a great location. Very near the metro and walking distance to the Eiffel Tower. The toilet was separate from the shower/tub/sink and it would have been nice to have a sink in it. It was a typical European hotel, on the small side and the beds were not plush but we all slept very well. Staff was friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Stay In Paris!”
Reviews.Author: six4europe
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. Best location in Paris. Went with small children. Staff was very helpful. Hotel was great, the rooms were clean and comfortable. And did I mention the location is perfect! You are only 5 minutes walk from the Tower. And only a couple of blocks from a great shopping district. Cafes, bakeries', meet market, wines, cheese. I would highly recommend this hotel and will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved everything about this hotel, would definitely go back!”
Reviews.Author: leanoreEngland
Reviews.Content: First time in Paris with my daughter was enhanced by our stay at this hotel - a perfect location with a wonderful view of the Eiffel Tower from our balcony. The accomodation was very exactly what we expected from the information viewed on the website. The staff could not have been more helpful with general advice and booking tickets, shuttles etc. I would definitely stay here again and would recommend this hotel to anyone who wants a good value hotel in an excellent location, two woman in a strange city felt safe and comfortable. A great base from which to explore Paris with lots of shops and cafes not to mention places of interest all within easy walking distance. Eleanor from England x

Reviews.Title: “All true, all good.”
Reviews.Author: SingleDad08
Reviews.Content: 4.5 out of 5, just because it has to be extra special to rate a 5. All the positive reviews that precede me are spot on. Excellent staff, perfect location, quiet at night (really good double-pane windows) and close to the metro and/or late-night reverie if you need it. Breakfast was 12 euro per head, so like others, we went to the grocery/bakery and ate on the Champ de Mars. Rooms were smallish but there were 4 of us and the new spacious bathroom made my teenagers happy. We stayed 6 nights and were sad to leave, but I did get a smile out of the red-haired front-desk person that will always remind me of Paris.

Reviews.Title: “quiet location”
Reviews.Author: bpater
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a 5 minute walk to the Eifel Tower. There are also lots of nice cafes and markets around. the room was nothing spectacular but they were very clean, and the staff was nice. there are 2 rooms on the top floor with little porches you could enjoy at night. I think you pay extra for a room with a view of the eifel tower but in my opinion you should save your money NICE AREA AND SHORT WALKS OR CAB RIDES TO ANYWHERE YOU WANT TO GO.

Reviews.Title: “recomended”
Reviews.Author: asdlkj
Reviews.Content: A great 3 star hotel. Our room was spacious and nicely kept. The bathroom was recently remodeled. The hotel is in a quiet area, but there are plenty of bistros nearby. The staff was helpful (in both English and my poor French). Make sure you dine at the Vin 7 around the corner, an excellent bistro.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: hemant11
Reviews.Content: The hotel is really close to the Eiffle Tower. Clean and aircondition rooms. Staff are very good and they helped us many times. Housekeeping was very good. Me and my wife had a pleasant stay. The F/O staff helped us in booking our tour and also gave us a wakeup call. I should thank expedia for giving us a nice hotel. Since we always book through expedia we never had problem anytime. regards, H mendon Mississauga, Canada

Reviews.Title: “it wasnt perfect”
Reviews.Author: parisfrance_regular
Reviews.Content: it was not very nice at all the hotel was not worth booking i paid around £678 for a family room which had two double beds which took up most of the room it was not really suitable for the two of us with out three little ones and of corse the photos showpicture of the famous tower however that is from the vey top you cant see much and the street if is the wrong place there were beggers sleeping outside the doors the staff were not bothered about any compaints made to them it was if it went through one ear and out the other. however if you like that kind of hotel go for it.!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel, Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: Miketvp
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for my wife's birthday, and was not at all disappointed. The hotel firstly is in an amazing location, about 2 blocks from the Eiffel Tower (about 5-10mins walk). You could even see the tower from our bedroom window. The hotel itself was quiet, really homely, and only a few minutes from a main underground station. The staff were really friendly, and our room was ready in time for when we arrived, even though we were slighly early. Our room was a good size, extremely clean, and very comfortable. I have stayed at a number of other Paris hotels, and this was by far the cleanest and most comfortable I have stayed at yet. For a three star hotel, it really was value for money. We did not pay for breakfast in advance, but the hotel threw in both are breakfasts for free, and we were able to buy sight seeing tickets from the main desk, which was a seriously good move, as it allowed us access to the tower without joining the massively long queues! For a couple of pound more, it was certainly worth it! Overall this was an extemely nice hotel and its location could not have been better, i can really recommend this to anyone thinking of taking a short break in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Charming European Hotel”
Reviews.Author: leighmilles
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Hotel Bourdonnais for three nights and loved it. We were in room 412 (I believe), on the top floor in the back of the building. We did not have a view of the tower, but we did have a large balcony complete with table and chairs! We could see Sacre Coeur up on the hill and walked to the nearby grocery for wine and snacks to enjoy on our balcony. The room was smallish (normal for Paris) but very clean and our bathroom was huge: everything in it was new. We found the staff to be very helpful and polite, despite the fact that I was the only one in our total party of five who spoke any French at all. (There were no giant, fake "welcoming" smiles that we are accustomed to here in the US, if you want those go to an American chain hotel). The Metro station was just a short walk away and there are many places to eat and shop in the area. I do recommend taking a shuttle to the airport or train station for the EuroStar. We came in on the train and left by plane and both metro rides were long and difficult with that many people and bags. For the price and the location I really don't think that you will find a better place to stay in Paris

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay at reasonnable rates”
Reviews.Author: Optimumprod
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were told about this hotel by a friend who had stayed there. As he was, we were also extremely pleased with the room from which we could see the Eiffel Tower but especially the friendly and curteous service we received from the personnel. As it turns out my wife forgot her sunglasses which had fallen under the bed. I e-mailed the hotel from the airport and they sent them to us in Canada at no extra cost. This hotel is close to the Eiffel Tower as well as the Ecole Militaire, Les Invalides and, the Metro is only steps away. The front desk personnel and the hotel Manager (I forget the lady's name) were very helpful whenever we needed help with a destination or reservations to a tour bus, an event or a show. I highly recommend this hotel. They speak English and French, of course, as well as some Spanish I believe.

Reviews.Title: “great rooms”
Reviews.Author: stef0916
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location in Paris-- only a few minutes away from the Eiffel Tower and Rue Cler and only a couple blocks from the nearest metro station. The room was up-to-date and very spacious and one of the best rooms during our trip through Europe. One of the only complaints would be that breakfast wasn't included like many of the other hotels we stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “what a charming place”
Reviews.Author: vivianleaf
Reviews.Content: I Loved this hotel. I was there with 3 teenagers and stayed in room 401. It had a lovely view of the eiffel tower and comfortable beds. And I'm picky!! The staff was very helpful and tolerent of 3 teens! Anytime we asked for extras, the staff was ready to help. They helped the girls get to Pizza Hut and took care of our Paris Shuttle to the airport. This place has an old european charm that we found lovely. It was large by european standards and with 4 girls in one room, the large bathroom was great.. No, they weren't overly friendly but they were polite and helpful.. I AM ALREADY GOING BACK AND STAYING A WEEK IN THIS LOVELY HOTEL. IF YOU WANT MODERN , GO TO THE HILTON OR ONE OF THE CHAIN HOTELS BY DISNEY. BUT IF YOU WANT CHARM AND A SENSE OF EUROPE, THIS IS THE PLACE.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location~~Use the Internet off Champs de Mars Street”
Reviews.Author: beverly66
Reviews.Content: Hotel La Bourdonnais is in a great location in Paris. We just got back from spending 6 nights at Hotel Bourdonnais. We stayed in Room 008, right off the lobby, so never had to negotiate stairs, and it was very quiet. It was a king room, with a seating area, very large for Paris standards. The bathroom was also very large, with a bathtub/shower combination. Because our room was on the main floor, and the breakfast area was on the other side of our windows, we didn't get much circulating air. The bed was very firm but we were usually so tired, we slept well. THE COMPUTER IN THE HOTEL IS ULTRA EXPENSIVE! There is a great little internet place just down the street and around the corner on Champs de Mars named "Com Avenue" with Arsalan Samet as the proprietor. He, and the other workers, were very friendly and helpful. I think it was 4 euro for 15 minutes at the hotel and it was about that same price for an hour at "Com Avenue." The hotel water is very hot which we enjoyed very much. The L' Open Tour bus comes right past the hotel. The great street Rue Clare is just a few blocks from the hotel, Eco Militaire (metro stop) is also right around the corner and, the Eiffel Tower seen twinkling at night from Cafe LaDome, just down the street from Hotel Bourdonnais, made our trip to Paris memorable. There are lots of great cafes and brasseries right around Hotel Bourdonnais. If you use a washcloith, take a few you can toss when you finish with them because most European hotels do not furnish a washcloth. We found Hotel Bourdonnais to be a great value for the money we spent.

Reviews.Title: “comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Maryjennifer
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed for 3 nights at the beginning of May. We had beautiful weather. The hotel is very comfortable and the staff are friendly and helpful; it helps that they speak english although I was able to use my french. Good breakfast at 13 euros. Within easy reach of the Champs de Mars gardens and the Eiffel Tower, and a metro station just round the corner. A supermarket next door. The hotel is on a quietish road. Our only complaint was that there was very little cold water and the hot water was VERY hot (I dont often complain about HOT water!). This made a shower impossible. I would go there again.

Reviews.Title: “I would not recommend this hotel to anyone !!”
Reviews.Author: travelrfun
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 5 nights stay at this hotel. We cannot checked into our room until 2PM on the first day as we were told the staff was still cleaning the room, so that my kids ended up sleeping on the couch in the reception area since they got too tired after the long flight. The facilities definitely need some repairs. The bathroom door lock in our room is broken and the heater is rusted. The stairs are squeaky and carpets wore out. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely!”
Reviews.Author: pygar2007
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 10 fabulous days in Paris. Highly recommend the Hotel Bourdannais! Great location and a great room! A little gem of a neighborhood--had a very Upper West Side of NYC feel to it. Very active and busy by day and lovely and quiet at night. Terrific at the end of busy days to know we could just head home and wander around at night and find a great place to eat. We were in room 313 which was on the inner courtyard. The room was recently redone and quite charming. we even had our own little vestibule/foyer with an antique dresser in it. The bed was new and very comfy. The bathroom was HUGE and brand spanking new. The room was all done up in pale yellow, gray and blue. A good sized real closet with shelves, desk, 2 chairs, large windows and spotless! The walls are thin and the floors above are squeeky, but that's life. So if you are a light sleeper take earplugs. We did have some rowdy teens next door one night but simply banging on the wall shut them up! Loved the Rue Cler, reminded me very much of the Pike Place Market here in Seattle. Great people watching and the food shops are wonderful as is the florist. The best (and cheapest) cafe creme to be had is at the Cafe du Marche. For a more upscale coffee experience, go to La Tournville on the corner of Bousquet. Dinner at La Terrasse was very good, eat upstairs in the dining room, quieter, chicer, better service. if you go on Sunday night, order the nightly special of stuffed vegetables--lovely! They looked like a cover of Gourmet magazine. We also had lovely dinners at Le P'tit Troquet and L'Auberge on Rue de L'Exposition (both little family run places) and La Fontaine du Mars. We also highly recommend Paris Shuttle to and from the airport. They are terrific. Sit up front with the driver and hope you are dropped off last as it is a great intro to Paris. The driver is amazing! We didn't crash! Traffic is insane!!!! Everything except wine and pastries are expensive so just indulge and enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “loved the hotel and everything is on your doorstep.....”
Reviews.Author: bandeylegs
Reviews.Content: My friend and i spent just one night at the hotel but wished we could have stayed longer, it is in a fantastic position just around the corner from the eiffel tower and literaly 2 mins from metro. The stafff, from very helpful young lady on reception to very helpful consierge (may be spelt wrong)!! the room was very clean and we even had a view of the eiffel tower. there was a supermarket right next door, and nice cafes etc on the doorstep. Overall we have nothing bad at all to write about it and if i get the opportunity i will be booking another trip there are soon as possible.

Reviews.Title: “solid,dependable,3 star choice”
Reviews.Author: memereTewksbury_ma
Reviews.Content: location is great,not too much noise...we slept great .the very best part was the very clean room...house keeping was top notch...i am an RN ,and i expect and appreciate clean...they are supperb...the staff was pleasant and helpful...breakfast was included in our rate..and it was more than adequate...our room appeared to carpets that were fairly new and were comfy to walk on...the bathroom and commode all appeared new ..and were kept nice and tidy...what more could you want ?....the halls had older carpet that showed their wear ....some furnishings were older ,but for 3 stars...it was perfect for us...i would surely return

Reviews.Title: “Will not return”
Reviews.Author: FogCanada
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Bourdonnais many times before and have always found the accomodation acceptable, although it has never been luxurious. The location and that it has quad rooms have always been its great selling points for us. We are accustomed to European standards (small rooms, small elevators, many stairs) and these do not bother us. This last visit, however, we had an unpleasant experience at this hotel. We stayed in room 208 (quad room) and both beds were extremely uncomfortable; they sagged and were lumpy - I moved to every bed and the couch that night in a vain search for comfort. When we complained the morning after our first night, the staff at the front desk were not helpful. They said we could not change our room as they had no other quad rooms available. When I told them that we had stayed there many times, but would not stay there again, the woman at the desk simply shrugged her shoulders. The man at the desk said that he would ask the maid to see what she could do. (???!) Our teenaged daughters went up to the room and my husband and I went out. In our absence, the maid came to the room and was angry about our complaint; she took this out on our daughters, telling them, among other things, that this was just the style of bed that sunk in the middle, because it had legs (which she showed them). (???!) Our daughters are fluent in French, and did their best to ameliorate the situation with her. When my husband and I came back, we saw the maid outside our door, but she did not have the guts to discuss the issue with us - she did not even mention that she had been in the room. She should not have been handed this problem, as what could she do about it? But that was no excuse for how she treated our daughters. For us, having a comfortable bed is one of the most important things about our hotel room, because it affects how you sleep and how you feel the next day. Not only was the staff unresponsive at best (and rude at worst) about our complaint, but my sense was that nothing would be done which would improve the stay of the next people to book that room. Since we were only in Paris for 2 nights, we did not move to another hotel. But we will never stay there again. Aside from the bed issue, we had a room right next to one of the staircases, and we could hear everyone coming and going untli late into the night. Do yourself a favour, and try another hotel in this wonderful neighbourhood.

Reviews.Title: “Stay next-door but not at this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: myeyegal
Reviews.Content: I sought out a reasonable priced room for one night and ended up choosing the Hotel La Bourdonnais based on the reviews and photos. We reserved 2 rooms, a double and a triple. My first clue to what my room was going to be like was the torn open ceilings and walls on the corridor of the floor we were on and the plastic sheeting taped over the carpet. Wires, piping and construction materials were everywhere and no workers in sight. I believe it was room 312 we had and it was a disgusting, filthy room that needed a complete overhaul. My husband and I and our 12 year old stayed in the triple and we discovered an old/moldy salami in the mini-fridge and hair on the 'clean/new' bed linens. When you entered there was a small door immediately to the right and after investigation, it contained a toilet. The rest of the bathroom was on the other side of the room, very strange. The decor was something someone would have gotten from a thrift store 20 years ago. The other room for a couple traveling with us (the double), believe it was room 308, looked much newer but REAKED of smoke. I would NEVER recommend this hotel to anyone but I would recommend the hotel next door, it was the Hotel Eber which also has reviews on this site and they proudly displayed that they were a Rick Steves recommended hotel.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic weekend”
Reviews.Author: xbansheex
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a weekend at this hotel. Booked through the Eurostar and although its a fair taxi ride from Gard du Nord, this hotel and this area is worth it. 4 of us stayed in quad room 503. View of Eiffel Tower from our balcony. Comfy beds. The kids, aged 12 and 13, loved being so close to the tower, and we adventured all over the place, walking and guided by our maps. Paris is a city that can easily be explored on foot. The queus to go up the Eiffel Tower can be amazingly long during the day, so we went up late at night. The last lift to the top is 11pm and the lights are on and flicker for 10 minutes on the hour. The views are fantastic. There is NO kettle in the room, so take a travel kettle. But there IS a hairdryer. We found the staff polite and helpful. Checked in at 12 noon friday and checked out at 12 noon monday. Our eurostar departed at 18.13, so the Hotel put our luggage away safe and we spent the afternoon relaxing in the nearby cafes, before returning to collect bags and have a taxi ordered for us. I would recommend this hotel and this city.

Reviews.Title: “great little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: CharlyYork
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 4 night stay at the Hotel La Bourdonnais. The first thing to mention is the great location - just a nice stroll away from the Eiffel Tower and Les Invelides, and the hotel is close to many good restaurants. We had a room on the top floor (605) with a good view of the tower. The rooms are plenty large enough for a short stay and are kept spotlessly clean by the housekeeping staff. The bathrooms are recently refurbised and everything works as it should. The reception staff are courteous, helpful and friendly. The hotel corridors were undergoing some refurbishment during our stay, but this did not affect us at all.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, only standard facilities”
Reviews.Author: Carebear79
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for Christmas. Pictures appear nicer than the room I stayed in. The hotel concierge was responsive enough but she had a slight air of condescenion. The room appeared fairly old and basic [if I had high standards I would say shabby] with the bed a little saggy. There was no minibar in my room. The bathroom was clean and adequate with normal shower. Very good location, easily walkable to Eifel Tower. Overall I have seen higher standards of rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel near Ecole Militaire”
Reviews.Author: travelingprof
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for four nights. On arrival, I had to wait until nearly 2 in the afternoon for my room to be ready even though the check-in time was given as 12. The room although rather small was clean and liveable. Presumably because a bigger bed wouldn't fit in the room, it was short. Even though my height of six feet is not tall by North American standards, I found the bed was not quite long enough. The room was also too small to have a fridge or minibar which I found a problem since I had brought food for friends in France that I didn't see until the last night. The staff told me only the biggest rooms for four had a fridge. I liked the bathroom. It was large by European standards, clean and with a glass partition about half the length of the tub to prevent shower water from spraying onto the floor. My room was one of the farthest from centre of the hotel and I had to wait a few minutes for hot water to get there but it did eventually. The public areas of the hotel were better than average and there was a very pretty bird in the nice large salon off the lobby. It also had a porter which is rare these days in hotels of that size. I didn't take breakfast there at 12 euros and bought breakfast pastries to eat in my room with coffee from my portable coffee/tea maker. If you prefer, local cafes offer continental breakfasts at 6 to 7 euros and a full one with scrambled eggs and bacon for 10-12 euros. The staff was polite and fluent in English. Generally it was fine for the price of 130 euros per night.

Reviews.Title: “Good deal, location great”
Reviews.Author: CRDUSA
Reviews.Content: Two adults, two children (ages 8 and 5) stayed here Feb. 16-22. Hotel was great for our needs. Room was okay (two hard double beds with a small, outdated bathroom). However, we had a balcony with a view of the Eiffel Tower (which made the room more pleasant, though we did not spend much time in the room). Room, even though on Ave. de la Bourdonnais, was quiet. Hotel staff was rather useless and gave incorrect information. We did not try the seemingly overpriced and undervalued breakfast. Location was great. Ecole Militaire Metro stop is a short walk away (left out of hotel, left at corner, cross over Ave. Bosquet, bear to right). Metro was awesome. Take advantage of buses, also. We did not take one cab our entire stay. Buses 69 and 87 are outstanding ways to get around and are convenient to hotel. Get bus, Metro, RER map from Metro clerk. Cheaper way to get to hotel from CDG (taxi cost approx. 68 Euros): Take Roissy-Bus to Opera Metro stop. Hop on Metro and take direct line to Ecole Militaire (total is 10 Euros per adult). Take advantage of nearby Rue Cler area with outdoor markets and pastry shops (good for morning meal). Make right out of hotel, walk two blocks to Rue de Grenelle, make right on Grenelle (walk two blocks to Rue Cler). Convenient post office on Rue Cler, near Ecole Militaire Metro station. Paris was wonderful. Please contact me if you have questions. I'll be happy to help.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic stay”
Reviews.Author: ArchieNorthEast
Reviews.Content: my girlfriend and i stayed here for a short break of 3days/2 nights earlier this week and couldn't have been happier with this hotel. Booked mainly for the location (which is also brilliant) we were so happy with how we were welcomed and how helpful and friendly everyone was, both when we arrived and the 24 hour reception staff. Hotel was clean, tidy and the room size was brilliant. Had a view of the Eifel Tower from our balcony, would definately stay here again + recommend it. Thankyou for a fantastic stay.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Location for Eiffel Tower and Metro”
Reviews.Author: plipper
Reviews.Content: Just arrived home after a three night stay at this establishment. We booked a quad room which consisted of two double beds - ideal for us and our two sons 8 and 6. The one thing i would recommend you take is a travel kettle, as there are no tea - coffee making facilities in the room, although there is a fridge, so you can stock up with bits and keep them cool. We booked through the Eurostar website. I also pre-booked the travel passes - which are well worth it, especially if you have a child who is into trains and undergrounds as much as ours are. The only thing to be aware of is once we arrived we still had to buy our first journeys fare - as you have to go and collect the passes from an outlet a few stops away from Gare du Nord. We also bought via the hotel a days pass for Disney Land. well worth it, not sure if you can get it slightly cheaper online before leaving uk. We only did the one park and couldn't get around that in one day - also worth looking into getting the fast-track passes for the rides as we ended up queing for upto 45 mins - there were plently of people bypassing the queue much faster with these tickets. Didn't bother with the continental breakfast offered at hotel after reading some of the reviews and did our own thing - calling into a bakery shop and getting freshly made choc chip french sticks and wolfing them down on route to wherever we decided to go. Kids loved them. Eiffel Tower we visited twice once the first evening we were there and unfortunatley the top wa s closed due to the wind and rain!! we returned the following day and went up again - right to the top. fab views. There are lots of guys trying to flog you flashing models etc of the tower, just haggle or say I can get it cheaper over there, you can knock them down in price. over all a great city, would love to go back and see more of it. hope you enjoy your stay as much as we did. au revoir!

Reviews.Title: “Okay Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TravelCakes
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here from 12/26/07 through 1/1/08. The staff spoke English and were very curteous and helpful. The rooms were just okay. Our two twin beds (pushed together) took up most of the room so there wasn't much space outside of that. The bathroom was very nice, fairly new and clean, however, there was a plexiglass type shield that was supposed to act as a shower curtain. The problem is it was only half the length of the tub. Everytime we showered, #1, it was COLD because there was no curtain around the tub and #2 water would get all over the floor. It was not an enjoyable experience to shower there. The hotel's location so convenient to the Eifel Tower but the rest of the neighborhood is mainly residential. There are not many stores or restaurants in close walking distance. A few but not too much. Breakfast was okay. Croissants, cheeses, cereal, yogurt and great coffee.

Reviews.Title: “Some things to note!!”
Reviews.Author: ritagriff
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a brilliant weekend in Paris. This hotel is very central to everything, we could just about see the Eiffel Tower from our bedroom. We found the receptionists unfriendly (one actually stood there picking her nose while we tried to get some information !!!) Do not waste your money on the breakfast, orange juice is an extra four euro. The room was clean with the bathroom above average. Read previous review about the size of toilet and they are right, if you are any way on the big size you will have difficulty using the toilets, as they are TINY. Overall the hotel is lovely, however the night before we were leaving we asked to book a taxi to the Bus Station for the airport. The male receptionist advised us it would be much quicker and cheaper to go via the metro and get off at Concorde for the bus station (he marked it on a map). When we arrived there the next morning at 6.30am ! we realised he has given us the wrong directions we ended up having to get a taxi to the airport at a cost of €140.00!! as we had missed the bus trying to get there. There is no excuse for poor directions, it nearly ruined our weekend, never mind the extra money we had to pay. Overall nice hotel, breakfast should be missed, but location excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel La Bourdonnais Perfect, easy, Warm!”
Reviews.Author: Elliot&Kirsty
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is Wicked! Just got back from a short stay in Pairs before christmas and love every moment of it.. The Hotel is located just THREE!!.. blocks from the effel tower! if your super lucky there are a few rooms over looking it. The staff we're very friendly helped us do (book) so much.. e.g Disyney Land, moulin roge and places of all the attractions! You couldn't really fault this place for the money we payed! The Weather in December was very cold..very..very clod! so it was nice after and long day taking in all the sights of Paris to just relax in your room... the rooms were very warm!! Lovely... Overall the Hotel was great no faults! French taxi drivers get a 1* from me they are t*ts / ripoffs! use the metro....! they hate the english tourists! PARIS IS A GREAT PLACE A MUST SEE!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: shaychenko
Reviews.Content: This hotel had come highly recommended by another couple and I'm very happy that they were right! This hotel is full of the Paris charm and the location was fantastic! Metro was very handy and very close to the Eiffel Tower. I plan to go back and stay at this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel but Screwed up by Lack of Common Sense Manager!!”
Reviews.Author: AlexWongKL
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in this hotel during our honeymoon in November 2007. The hotel's decoration, room space and location are above average. However our honeymoon holiday was spoilt by an inconsiderate and lack of common sense manager on the last day of our stay. We had to leave the hotel very early in the morning to catch a train to Zurich, so we enquired for alternative breakfast that is part of our package. The manager on the previous night has provided us options of omelettes. We took that option, and while we were rushing to check out the following day, the manager charged us 9 Euro dollars for two omelettes whichs looks like plain eggs to me. We told the manager that it is unfair to charge us as he never indicated it is chargable. He simply said I am sorry but you have to pay. This discussion went on for 15 mins and we had no choice but to pay because we were late for our train. This resulted us to miss our train to Zurich and I had to top up another 30 Euro dollar for another train ticket. This whole incident really Marred our Honeymoon trip and I intend to complain to the tourism board for the hotel's lack of common sense, courtesy and unfair conduct.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel with a good location”
Reviews.Author: ADKtraveller
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a few days in 2006. We had requested a room that would comfortably sleep 4. We had a large comfortable room, albeit a room that was strangely oriented. The room had comfortable beds for all of us but the other furniture in the room was a bit old. We really liked the location - few minutes to the Eiffel Tower and a short walk to the metro as well. There are plenty of good restaurants right around the corner as well. Overall we would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lauraparsons
Reviews.Content: Myself, my partner and my sister went to Hotel La Bourdonnais for my birthday and we loved it!! The hotel is lovely, clean and bright.
