The staff are friendly and helpful and the location is fantastic! There is nothing I can fault this hotel for, I've even booked the same room we had for my Mum and Dad as a Christmas treat. Definately worth going to... we had a lovely our weekend in Paris and will definately be going back!

Reviews.Title: “Interesting hotel”
Reviews.Author: OzTravellerBrisbane
Reviews.Content: Okay, great location, large room and friendly staff who don't get angry if you talk to them in English. The room was large with a sizable bathroom. There is one interesting fact to the room that might turn people off. The toilet is near the entrance and the bathroom is not right next to it. The toilet was a bit smaller than I would have liked and I found it hard to get my pants back on as the toilet door was like so close to me. Now I am only 5 foot 6 inches, not very big by most countries in the world, so be warned if you are taller or suffer from enclosed spaces. Apart from that, my airconditioning unit was stuck on 19 degress celcius (maybe to discourage its use) and the beds a bit small for even me (my toes were so close to the end of the bed!!!). Had an amazing location not only to the main Paris attraction but to also quaint little streets a couple of blocks away. Was my first stay in Paris and would go back there despite the problem with the small toilet.

Reviews.Title: “Best location in Paris”
Reviews.Author: zaydeboy
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Paris for 3 nights after a cruise. Getting to the hotel from the airport wasnt that easy but managed to get there by the rossy bus and then a cab ride. The hotel in located 3 block from Rue Cler district and 4 blocks from the Eiffel Tower. We read the Rick Steves book on Paris and did pretty much what he recommended. The hotel was clean and location amazing. Quiet neighborhood at night, safe to walk around and many restaurants opened all day. Bus #69 for 1.40 euro can take you around the city all day. just like hop on hop off for alot less money. If you go, say hello to Alan, night desk staff who was really friendly., cant say the same about morning staff.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Paris”
Reviews.Author: getawaygang4
Reviews.Content: Bonjour. We arrived in Paris from Disneyland in a private taxi. First impression of the hotel frontage was that it looked smart. Went to the reception desk and were friendly. So far so good. The elevator was very small but there was assistance from the cleaner/concierge to get our items to our room. We were told that we probably wont have a great view of anything. Opened our windows to get fresh air and there she was, the best view in the world, the Eiffel Tower. We jumped around the room in excitement. There were two comfortable double/queen beds and a large bathroom with a bath and shower. It appeared to be undergoing some renovations. We were very happy and content. We didnt have breakfast at the hotel as we discovered small cafes, supermarkets and pizza delivery. The hotel is only 2/3 blocks from the Eiffel Tower and very close to transport. It does also have a bar which you can have a drink any time you want and there was internet usage in the lobby which you need to purchase a card to use. Highly Recommend. Will go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, Great location”
Reviews.Author: Jammedherbs
Reviews.Content: Myself, the wife and our 2 kids just got back from 4 nights at this hotel. We booked a quad-room via hotels.com, and were delighted with what we received. We were on the 5th floor in a spacious room (Room 501) with 2 x double beds and a large bathroom. The room had a balcony (albeit very narrow) with views of the Eiffel tower (see photo). It also had a flat-screen LCD TV and a/c. There was no mini-bar or fridge, but a quick call to reception and within 10 minutes we had a small fridge delivered to the room - perfect for keeping the beers and wine cool :-). Note that the hotel does not have a bar. Overall the cleanliness of the room was second-to-none, matched by the wonderful location of this hotel (2 mins walk to Ecole Militaire metro, 10 mins walk to Eiffel Tower). Would definitely recommend this hotel to others, and would certainly stay here again if we returned to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel, Reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: goldielocks2
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at this hotel for 5 days. My criterea when I was looking for a place included: room to accomidate 4 people, reasonable price, ac, non smoking , decent area. Hotel Bourdonnais met and exceeded my expectations. We had a standard room that had 2 queen beds. We paided 169 US dollars a night plus tax. Booked through our travel agent. The rate did not include breakfast. which was 12 Euros per person extra. Since 48 Euros for a family of 4 to have a continental breakfast seemed unreasonable, we did not try the breakfast. The breakfast/solarium room did look very pretty. Instead we walked next door to the grocery store and bought milk, yougart, and fruit everyday. for about 10 euros total. The bathroom in room 201 was large and modern. The carpetting and bedding looked worn but clean. The beds were comfortable and we slept well. We asked for a non smoking room. 201 did have an ashtray on the table but nothing in the room smelled like smoke, so I didn't see the need to complain. Front desk staff very friendly and spoke english well( except for 1 female clerk who was consistantly rude in multiple languages). We had an early arrival flight and checked in at 11am, no problem. The area around the hotel was lovely and we felt very safe walking late at night. It is a very short walk to the Eiffel Tower, the Metro, and Rue Cler. We would defineltly stay at this place again

Reviews.Title: “great view”
Reviews.Author: criddymonkey
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for 3 days last summer. The location is fantastic. It's only a 5 minute walk to the Eiffel Tower. Our room had a balcony with an amazing view of the tower. It was beautiful. There are plenty of restaurants nearby, and the Metro stop is right down the street. The rooms were average, but I would definitely stay here again just for the view. It's very romantic.

Reviews.Title: “Impressed!”
Reviews.Author: LRLR
Reviews.Content: After our stay in Rome prior to arriving in Paris, we were a little scared about the accomodations we would be receiving in Paris. Our concerns were unnecessary - Hotel La Bourdonnais was excellent. The staff were friendly enough - if you want to book a tour, make dinner reservations, book your departure to the airport, they do it for you. The rooms were clean and very spacious. Breakfast was very good (make sure you get it included when you book). It consisted of yogurt, 2 types of cereal, milk, juice, baguettes, croissants, cheese, coffee/hot chocolate/tea. Eggs are available, but for an extra fee. The location was excellent! Very close to the metro, within walking distance to the Eiffel Tower, and Rue Cler and St. Dominique are super close. Rue Cler has excellent restaurants, fruit markets, and specialty stores (cheese, chocolate, etc). There is also a supermarket right beside the hotel. I would definitely stay here again! You will have a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Solid 3 Star Paris Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BostonExec
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel in late April 07 with our 2 year old son. Room was large for Paris and bathroon was relatively new. Overall the experience was positive. Obviously this is only a 3 star, so it needs to be taken with a grain of salt. That said, good location, good service. We parked our car in lot very near to the hotel (24 euro/day). We also took advantage of baby sitting provided by hotel on two nights (10 euro/hr). Overall all went well.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, choose your room carefully”
Reviews.Author: molchies
Reviews.Content: We are a family of two adults and two children aged 8 and 6 and stayed here at the height of the heatwave in Europe in July 2006. We had looked especially for an airconditioned room so we had a cool haven to return to after sight seeing. The location of the hotel was fantastic - we could easily walk to the Eiffel Tower, Ecole Militaire station was just around the corner and there were two supermarkets very close. I would agree with other reviews that the staff were not overly friendly, but our room away from the street on the first floor was large, clean and cool unlike my sister's family's room which overlooked the street, smelt of cigarettes and had no air conditioning! Make sure you ask for a non smoking room - it makes a big difference if they have one available. We would definitely stay here again in the future

Reviews.Title: “fab location and large room for Paris!”
Reviews.Author: cheerybella
Reviews.Content: The room was much bigger than we were used to in Paris - especially as it was fairly cheap and booked last minute! The bathroom was huge. Fab location - v. near a metro and the eiffel tower. Staff not overly friendly, but as we know our way around Paris this was fine - if you were first time visitors who maybe wanted info you might be a little hard pushed. Breakfast seemed a little expensive so we didn't bother - especially as the cafe on Rue Jean Millet which has its own chocolate factory is just around the corner!!! Would stay here again for a long weekend and would definitely recommend it to people

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel less than 1 minute from the Metro - a Gem!”
Reviews.Author: miscellanity
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel as part of a deal on Eurostar. This hotel is a gem - it is less than 1 - 3 minute stroll away from the Ecole Millitaire Station, and you can see the Military Accademy and top of the Tour Eiffel from outside. It took us about 1/2 hr to travel there on the metro at 11pm at night from the Gare du Nord - perfect and no troubles at all! We had a triple bed suite which came with new carpets, a flat screen plasma tv, double wardrobe, a desk and new carpets and a HUGE new bathroom/toilet which had both a separate bathtub and separate shower. The water was hot. This suite was 100% clean, towels were changed regularly and we were very happy. The service downstairs by the staff was impeccable and they agreed to hold our bags in a safe place after we checked out as we wanted to shop at the Champs Elysees before our trip back to London. Breakfast costs 10 euro at the hotel and was not included, but we went to the Rue Cler (street 5 mins away - recommended by another reviewer - thanks!) where there were many cafes to buy cheap pastries and good coffee/hot chocolate for 2-6 euro combined. You could even buy a croissant from the street stalls for <1 euro if you want to take away. Extremely satisfied - after hearing the horror stories about European hotels and their small rooms, I can say this was a bargain in an ideal location. However after reading the reviews, it appears that it is more ideal if you have more than 2 people staying in one suite because then you will get the larger refurbished suites. Any bad reviews seem to come from couple suite visitors - I did not have a chance to check out these smaller rooms. Always bring a spare pair of ear plugs to any european hotel - there will always be a certain amount of noise.

Reviews.Title: “Definately want to return”
Reviews.Author: Jameos
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 nights here for our 13th anniversary back in 2003. A quaint hotel, nice rooms, very traditional style. Excellent position for exploring the city. We dined at the hotel next door (was actually part of the hotel, not sure if still is) and had a truly magnificent meal, exceptional service and great wine. Couldn't believe when we got the bill and it was only HALF of what we expected to pay!

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced fire trap, in the states we call them "Rat holes"”
Reviews.Author: WearyOUTraveler
Reviews.Content: I booked the hotel based on the reviews written on the website. That was a mistake. For the price, I was expecting it to be a legitamate hotel with water and decent space but those reviews lied. There was no water for several hours after we check'd in. They didn't bother telling us the water was off. The bath was newly remodeled and large but no good without water! The room was so tiny we stacked our suit cases to get around the bed. We'd stayed several days in Paris at a cheaper hotel with a lot more space, and all the water we could use! Seems a rebate for the price of the room would have been in order for not having water. The creaking in the hall from the old hotel was so bad we were afraid we might step through the floor. What kind of fire hazard is it with no water available? I think they need to bulldoze this place and put in something legitamate. We traveled through 4 countries in Europe and this was the only place we felt like we didn't get our money's worth. Too bad to end our Euro trip on such a sour note.

Reviews.Title: “The top end of a 3 star Parisien hotel with charm”
Reviews.Author: ZLC
Reviews.Content: I would highly recommend this hotel for business or pleasure. I was lucky enough to spend 2 days in Paris on business and found the hotel through expedia.com.au. The room I stayed in had recently been refurbished with a very large & modern bathroom, huge bed (as promised in the web site blurb), plenty of storage place. It also felt very roomy and would be more than comfortable for two people over a period of days. The lady on reception was most helpful and assisted with maps, detailed directions and making my trip most pleasant. Location wise I think it is great, take a step out of the front door turn right, then first left and this takes you to the base of the gardens that lead to the base of the Eiffel Tower probably a max 10 mins if you stroll. A left out of the door at you are at the metro stop (Ecole militaire) in a few hundred metres. I would also recommend the bar at the entrance to the metro. Also to note is a supermarket Franprix next door which will come in handy for snacks and drinks, the only downside I could find was the lack of mini bar and tea/coffee making facilites. The hotel had parisien charm with a lovely lounge and great breakfast area. To end I think this hotel would be perfect for to all from honeymooning couples, business guests and families.

Reviews.Title: “We'll be back - Hotel De La Bourdonnais”
Reviews.Author: S00Z
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for New Year in 2005/2006. The hotel staff are extremely friendly, and spoke to us in English without any problems at all. The hotel was currently undergoing re-furbishment, but this only affected us once, fairly early in the morning. The rest of our stay was perfect, we weren't disturbed again by building / construction work. The hotel room that we stayed in was sufficient for our needs, however, it wasn't the best room that we had stayed in before [I think by now the room will have been re-furbished / re-decorated, in line with their modernisation program]...that been said, it was very clean, and tidy, and had everything that we needed. The decor just needed to be updated a little. The breakfast's that we had were very nice, and the waiting staff were extremely helpful - nothing was ever too much trouble for them. The food is of excellent quality, and had been prepared in a very hygenic environment. Located within easy walking distance to the Eiffel Tower, and yet close enough to appreciate the local cultures that Paris has to offer. We are planning on going back to the hotel very soon, and I'm sure we won't be disappointed. A thumb's up from us!! SM - England

Reviews.Title: “Great value - great location”
Reviews.Author: shydiatl
Reviews.Content: I had a very nice experience staying here. The place is very centalized, which means it is not far from the Eiffel Tower. The neighborhood was great esp if you are just getting off the Metro after midnight. You are not scared to walk to the hotel. The rooms were very clean. The maid service was impeccable. The staff was very friendly. I had a double bed in my room. I did see a few of the smaller rooms which were nice. I also noticed that even though I was facing the street, which is what I preferred it was very quiet. The one thing that I think they could improve upon was the breakfast selection. There was no fresh fruit. This is really unacceptable as they are only a few blocks away from Rue Cler where all the markets are. The coffee was TERRIBLE! I think they must have boiled it at least 12 times. I switched to tea. This is not even French coffee. I loved the sitting room which was nice and comfortable and had internet access. I would recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Not that bad!”
Reviews.Author: bennybex
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for my daughters birthday and managed to get a room with a view of the eiffel tower. True, you have to hang out of the window to see it, but my children were suitably impressed! We actually had a great time, the lift is small and accomadates 4 max, and is fairly slow, but it wasnt a problem for us as the kids wanted to beat the lift using stairs anyway. Agree it would be tough if you have all the ensemble a baby needs, or indeed a wheel chair. Depending on the waiter you got, service for us was excellent. One guy made the children feel really special, the other begruged giving us coffee! The location is ideal, the rooms dated but quite french. We had 2 double beds, which meant the kids climbing across us, but there was plenty of wardrobe space. Its not 5 star, but at the right price..we booked direct, it was just fine. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Acceptable but nothing special”
Reviews.Author: Huck1
Reviews.Content: My room is ckean and warm and a reasonable size for 1 or 2, The beds are comfortable. The bathroom is fine and looks as if it has recently been updated. But the room is just slightly faded and has that slight musty smell when you first go in. And the public areas are also a bit below par even for a hotel which does not pretend to be 5 star.

Reviews.Title: “Very small rooms”
Reviews.Author: Leah01
Reviews.Content: We selected this hotel because of a friend. Location is great for the metro and Eiffel Tower, if you are traveling with a child DO NOT STAY!! At this hotel, I had such a hard time getting an average size stroller in the elevator or in the room. We booked a shuttle thru the hotel by e-mail when we got the airport (CDG) at 5am in the morning we had to fined out the hard way about shuttle company not operating not before 7:00am and the hotel knew about our arrival time and we were told the reservation was guarantied with our cc we ended up taking a taxi and paid 50 Euros. On the way back to the airport we asked for a cab they said no problem as soon as the cab arrived they would call us. We got the call and came down right away when we got in the cab there was a charge of 21 Euros already because the cab was waiting for us for at least 30 minutes before they called. Talk about rudeness they all speak English but it means absolutely nothing when you are traveling with a 4 months old infant you expect little bit more courtesy it seemed like they couldn’t care less. They are not as friendly or helpful as many stated and I would never ever stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “OK Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Squibbit
Reviews.Content: We selected this hotel based on reviews here at Trip Advisor. As far as location, admittedly it was good for the Eiffle Tower. The picture you see on the website is misleading if you expect your room to be as nice. Our room was basic, and clean and for the price we paid, we didn't expect much more so we weren't disappointed in that. We were however disappointed in the attitude of the staff which people here said over and over how helpful and friendly they were. Yes they all speak English very well, but they were not as friendly as many stated, I would say they were typical Parisians, they didn't go out of their way to offer assistance and barley gave the minimum when you did ask for help. The breakfast each morning was typical French Continental, but the Hot Chocolate was yummy! All in all for the price I'd stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: haloftermtravel
Reviews.Content: Little gem of a hotel, conveniently situated with views of Eiffel Tower. Close to Metro (Ecole Millitaire). Hotel staff very friendly and helpful. Rooms very clean but a little on small side, but OK for short break. Stayed here for 3 nights end of October 2006. Close to restaurants and bars. Lovely breakfast room but breakfast expensive (10 euros per person) and limited choice. Comfortable sitting area, lift to rooms. Would recommend you try this hotel, particularly for its close proximity to Eiffel Tower and River Seine.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location for family trip”
Reviews.Author: Keithquine
Reviews.Content: We (2 adults, 2 children aged 11 & 8) stayed at Hotel de La Bourdonnais from 6th October for 5 nights having selected it from the reviews on Trip Advisor. It is certainly a great location and we were able to walk to most of the main attractions. The metro is very close too. It was perfect having the E. Tower close at hand as we saw it do its 'sparkly thing' every night at close range. We chose to go up the tower at 10pm to avoid the queues. We went straight to to the top and the view was breathtaking and very memorable. We had already been up the Montparnesse Tower, the Arc, Notre Dame and the Sacre Coer so we had seen Paris during the day. It was a short walk back to the hotel through the Champs de Mars. The room size was fine with 2 comfy double beds, a separate wardrobe area and a recently updated very nice bathroom. It was all very clean. Avenue de la Bourdonnais is 3 lane traffic but with double glazing and shutters the noise was no problem. Rue Cler (a lovely bustling market street) is close by with great cafes and shops. We ate breakfast most days and can recommend the Cafe du Marche (we did what many locals do & buy at the patiserie across the road and then go there for coffee). Take your own travel kettle for use in the room. We can recommend the Fat Tyre Bike Tour - it was great fun. We would definately use this hotel again and would recommend it to anyone. Go and enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location for seeing Paris”
Reviews.Author: Peripatetics
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely room on the top (sixth) floor with a small balcony and stunning view of the Eiffel Tower. Because we were there in March we slept with the French doors open and enjoyed the lights of the city. Located in the elegant 7th arrondisement (district), the hotel is just two blocks from the Eiffel Tower, Champs de Mars and Les Invalides. Within a two-block radius there are banks, a dry cleaner, market, post office and metro stop. As for our accomodations, the large bathroom had been recently remodeled. The elevator and rooms may seem small and quaint to some Americans but we found them charming and authentic. The neighborhood is ideal for walking, by day or by night. We would certainly stay at the Bourdonnais again.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: bikerben
Reviews.Content: We found the staff very helpful and spoke enouph English to help us. The rooms are average size the bathrooms were clean and nice. The AC worked as we had hot July weather. The elevator is quite small. Walk to Metro, Eiffel Tower, or Ave Rue Clair. Paris is wonderful for walking. Enjoyed our stay at this hotel-Bob-Sacramento

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location and very clean hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Rome904
Reviews.Content: I read some very good reviews on trip advisor and thought we would try out the De La Bourdonnais. The location was what really made me want to stay here. My husband and I came for a visit for 4 days and 3 nights. I am orginally a New Yorker and my husband is Swedish but we currently live in London. First of all, would recommend booking through Expedia as they show you where all the hotels are on the map and that really helps. We took the train from the airport into the city using the RER and the metro station (Ecole Militaire stop) was around the corner. We had an extremely early flight and were exhausted when we arrived at the hotel. Unfortunately they didnt have a room ready for us but we explained the situation and they said they would try and get one cleaned up for us so we were able to leave our bags and go for lunch. About 3 blocks away is a street full of restaurants and cafes. It was very Parisian and lovely. The food was great although expensive. After we ate we went back to the hotel and she thankfully had a room ready for us 2 hours before we are supposed to check in which was nice. It was a nice hotel room, very clean and the bed was HUGE. Two double beds put together. We didnt have the greatest view as the bathroom faced the courtyard but preferred it as it was really quiet. The hallway is under repair and a mess but the room itself was very clean and we were happy with it. There was a little refridgerator and a nice market next door where you could cheaply buy groceries. All in all would really recommend the hotel if you are there mainly to see the city and not stay in the hotel. The TV was really old and only in French (to be expected!) but we werent there to stay indoors. Location was just fabulous as we walked in the evening to have dessert in cafes down the street and then to the Eiffel Tower. Just really lovely.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value and Good Location”
Reviews.Author: LisaTUk
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location for exploring central Paris just a 10-15 minute walk from the Tour Eiffel and only a few minutes from the Ecole Militaire. (It is a reasonable walking distance from both metro stops although the Ecole Militaire is a good few minutes closer if the weather is bad or shopping bags are heavy!) It is fairly simple, but well kept and clean and our double room was large by Parisian standards - with two double beds / wardrobe / dresser / TV and still room to walk around. The en-suite bathroom was also large and had recently been refurbished to a good quality standard. The staff were polite, but much more friendly if you try and speak even a little French to them. It does not have any real ammenities for those wanting to spend a lot of time in the hotel iteself, but is perfect as a base to explore the retaurants / sites and shops of Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the negative reviews of this hotel, I have to wonder if these people stayed in the same Hotel La Bourdonnais that we just returned from a few days ago. We couldn't have been happier! We had a lovely room on the 3rd floor that had been renovated recently. Our room had two double beds, and a large credenza with built-in refrigerator. Two big floor-to-ceiling windows (very French) overlooked Avenue de la Bourdonnais. With two pre-teen girls, my wife and I appreciated the spacious bathroom counter space (nothing like this in Scotland or England at these prices). Tile was all new and shower was strong and hot. The toilet was brand new and housed in it's own little room. Our A/C unit worked great and had a modern digital thermostat. I also can't say enough good about the helpful staff. Not speaking French was no problem for us, and each time I asked for help, I got service with a smile. In fact, most of the people staying here were American, so they are used to English for sure. The location is awesome! Two blocks away, Rue Cler is quintessential Paris with cafes, fromagerie, green grocers, butchers, and boulangeries. Couldn't get enough of the Rue Cler! Never used the Metro but we did use the city bus - mostly walked and used the open top tour buses (La Car Rouges gives you 2 consecutive days of hop on- hop off tour bus travel). We spent 4 nights here after seven nights in similarly-priced family hotels in the UK and we felt we got a lot more for our money here. But keep in mind, it's still Europe, and if your're expecting just another Marriott Courtyard, then you'll be disappointed with this and lots of other things in Europe!

Reviews.Title: “Deceptive Web Page, Overpriced and overrated”
Reviews.Author: tmynatt
Reviews.Content: The 1 good point about this hotel is the location...period. Otherwise the rooms are small as are the bathrooms. I made a special effort to book a hotel with air-conditioning and this one claims to offer AC. I even emailed them to verify that they would not turn OFF the AC at night as some hotels do. The assured me that the AC would be available 24 hours a day. Of course when I checked in there was NO AC available. Yes, there were units in the rooms, but they were "broken" and were being worked on. I had no AC for the entire length of my stay. Luckily it was cool in the mornings and evenings in Paris while we were there. But of course there was still lots of street noise to endure since we had to keep the windows open and during the day it did become rather warm. There were ceiling panels missing from the hallways with wires and cables hanging down. Not once did I ever see anybody working on these things even though I was assured that the AC was being worked on as quickly as possible. The rooms were tiny. The bathroom that was shown on the hotel's website certainly wasn't in our room nor in our friend's room. Our bathroom was tiny and even for 2 people would have been small. Unfortunately our room was a quad. The breakfast was OK, but not NEARLY worth the 10 Euro per person. We walked around the corner to one of the many patisseries and bought more than enough food for 4 people for breakfast at a total cost of 8 Euro. The extremely decorated room featured on the website is on the ground floor. It's a sitting area where nobody sits and it contains the hugely overpriced internet pc. Caution: Your room will look nothing at all like this room - not even close. This hotel has a good location, but other hotels located on the same street have the same great location. The difference is they tell you up front that they don't have AC and therefore they are about half price of this place. Try other hotels such as the Hotel Kensington (a few steps closer to the Eiffel Tower) or the Hotel Eber Mars (a few steps the other way). They are all located on the same street...the same great location. But they do not seem to have the same problem with misrepresentation as the Hotel La Bourdonnais. As for the final kicker...this hotel has the old style safes in the rooms with a key that you have to carry around with you. There is an 80Euro deposit required for this key and seperate paperwork is required in order to get the key. On this paper you must list name, address, and credit card details including card type, number, and expiration date. When I went to checkout and return the safe key, the guy at the front desk took the paper, wadded it up, and threw it into the trash can. Have the people of Paris ever heard of IDENTITY THEFT or CREDIT CARD FRAUD??? I'm sure it's not a secret in Paris. I had to tell the guy to dig my paper out of the trashcan and give it to me. He acted like I was making a big deal over nothing. Final word on this place - you've been warned.

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms but serve the purpose”
Reviews.Author: Traveler_ATL
Reviews.Content: We (two famillies) stayed at Bourdonnais for 6 nights in June. After reading all the reviews about this place, we were prepared for any "surprises" but still made the reservation because of the location. All the other similar hotels in that area were booked up several months ago. we don't speak French and have a baby traveling with us. So we'd prefer to stay at the place where everything is within walking distance. Hotel Bourdonnais wasn't as bad as we first thought. The renovation was done. There are still wires on the 6th floor ceilings in the hallway. But the rooms were finished. By the time we made the reservation, there were only single or double rooms left. Therefore we had to "squeeze" 3 or 4 people in each room and had hard time to move around in those tiny spaces. But, the bathrooms were spacious (double sinks and a small table) and very clean. I read a review before the trip about some family contracted skin problems at there but figured that this could happen anywhere. I brought my own sheets though and we didn't use their towels at all. The location could not be better. We could see Eiffel tower from our window (only 5th floor rooms had balconies but we stayed on the 6th). A good sized grocery store right next door (close on Sunday) that provided everything you need at great price. I went there every morning to get fresh milk for the baby. Someone talked about having small fridge in their rooms but we didn't have it. If you turn right from the hotel entrance and turn right again at Champs Du Mars, Rue Cler will be on the right side (only 5 min walk from the hotel). We had the best duck legs (less than 6 euro per piece, delicious!!!!), crepes, pastries, and fresh bread from Rue Cler everyday. The invalides is only 15 min walk. I am not sure if we'll stay at this hotel again but definitely will stay in that area. Try to search around that location as early as possible and if everywhere else is booked up, then this hotel is acceptable anyways.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Janie01
Reviews.Content: Hotel de la Bourdannis is a lovely hotel in a nice neighborhood. It is a pleasant walk to the Eiffel Tower, good restaurants and shops. A grocery store is conveniently located next to the hotel and the Metro Station is only 2 blocks away. The front desk staff was very pleasant and helpful (they speak English as well). We had 2 rooms and both were large, comfortable and reasonably priced. The bathroom was big and modern. There was no street noise. We did not try the breakfast buffett -- we opted for fresh french croissants from a Patisserie located only one block from the hotel. Helpful maps and brochures are available in the hotel lobby. The rooms were neat & clean. Overall, we were very pleased with our stay at Hotel de la Bourdannis and would highly recommend it to all.

Reviews.Title: “Interesting”
Reviews.Author: spenquejr
Reviews.Content: This hotel was as I put it compared to a motel 6 in the states. If it wasn't for the view of the eiffel tower from our room with a balcony, (only on the 5th floor facing the street) I would have complained. The room was very small and old. The bed was hard and the accomodations in general were just mediocre. The staff was nice, and it served it's purpose. We booked this hotel through expedia and a package and found that the package just wasn't worth it in the end. For the price I guess we should have expected the quality that we got. There is however a wonderful bakery down towards the seine on the right a couple of blocks we ate there every morning for breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice!”
Reviews.Author: loopykd
Reviews.Content: Me, my husband, and my 5 year old daughter stayed here for two nights. There is some work going on at the hotel. These issues are cosmetic only. Our stay was nice and we enjoyed everything. There is a lot of street noise here but if you close the shutters and windows it is just fine. We happened to be there on trash day, this woke up my husband. View of the Eiffel tower was nice from our room if you hang out the window. We bought a sandwich around the corner and ate lunch in the park in front of the Eiffel Tower. Very nice lunch for not a lot of money. There are a few grocery places within walking distance and some fruit stands. Plenty of options for the frugal traveler. This is what brings my rating up to above average for the many options for eating and entertainment.

Reviews.Title: “It was ok!”
Reviews.Author: traveler201036
Reviews.Content: We are a family of four and we stayed for a week in April. The staff is average, some are more corteous than others. It is a small hotel under renovation. Our room was fine and we had a partial view of the Eiffel Tower.We left early morning every day and when we came back late evening the room was perfectly cleaned. We did not eat breakfast there because there were so many places to go around. Hotel also have internet, came handy to keep in touch with the family in the US. There is a convenient market next door, very useful to buy daily water and fruit. The location is great, the area is really safe to walk day or night.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible hotel”
Reviews.Author: psydocnr
Reviews.Content: When we arrived at this hotel there was no wallpaper on the walls, the radiator near the front door was in plastic, the man at the front desk was unfriendly. We were taken up in a tiny, beaten up elevator to the floor where our room was. wires were coming out of the ceiling all over the place and the ceiling tiles were mostly out. the place felt dirty. my kids said they felt like they needed a shower after being there for five minites. needless to say we did not stay and they pretended not to understand our reasons for our disappointment. the place looked nothing like the internet photos. we left and went to the marriott on the champs elysee which was much more expensive and we had only a small room. that hotel was gorgeous and we were happy to spend the money after seeing the bourdonnais. The final slap was that when we got home we saw that the hotel acutally tried to bill us for a night. luckily our card company did not allow the charge to go through. A truly bad experience. spend the extra money and do not try the this hotel at least until they finish doing whatever it is they are doing there.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: MDMORG
Reviews.Content: Great Location! Staff was friendly. Paper thin walls, but overall a very good experience. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable for family”
Reviews.Author: mlf212
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a quad room which was quite spacious with a clean, newly renovated bathroom. The hallway and lift are a bit scruffy but lobby and room much better. The breakfast was good and I didn't think badly priced in comparison to many of the cafes. Very convenient location and very comfortable for a family of 4.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Location & Reasonably Priced”
Reviews.Author: TennesseeTravelQueen
Reviews.Content: My family of 3 stayed here during New Year's. It has a wonderful location. You can either walk to most sights or take the metro to those out of walking range. You will find a metro station about a block away. Also, check out the grocery store next door for goodies to stock your small in-room refrigerator. It's also a good place to pick up some French wine. Rooms were average, but clean with recently remodeled bathrooms. The lift is a little slow and small. We could barely fit in 3 people with only carry-on luggage! Take the stairs, it saves time. I thought the continental breakfast was a little expensive, but the coffee was wonderful. If you are looking for something clean, convenient and reasonably priced then this is your hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Neerdowell
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel de la Bourdannais last year while on an extended vacation in Paris. We found it to be nice, and very conveniently located. Our package allowed us to stay at several moderately-priced hotels while in Paris, so we got the opportunity to see several rooms on our trip. The room itself was clean and the bed was comfortable, but it was pretty cramped. The bed took up 90% of the space in the room, and you had to turn sideways to squeeze between it and the chest of drawers to get to the window. That also meant that the lower drawers couldn't open very far. The bathroom was good-sized for Paris, but had an unusual layout that wasn't very efficient. (The sink was in a corner and had no flat surfaces where you could put your toiletries.) The staff of the hotel was nice and helpful with directions to locations or ordering taxis. The real draw of this hotel though, was its very convenient location. It was right across from the Champs du Marr, the park in which the Eiffel Tower is located. In fact, we had a view of the Eiffel Tower from our room - if you stood close enough to the window! The Metro stop is maybe a half-block away from the hotel's entrance, so everything was well within reach. There were several shops, restaurants, and cafes nearby for a convenient nosh. Though we preferred another hotel (Hotel Union Elysees) to this one, the Hotel de la Bourdannais was nice and a good value for the money spent.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: ryntyntyn
Reviews.Content: Our family of 3 stayed here for 9 days around the Christmas holidays.We had a triple room (411) overlooking the courtyard. It was very quiet.The bathroom was recently remodeled and had a nice shower,seperate tub and plenty of counter space. The toilet is located in it's own little room. There were 3 twin beds which were very comfortable, crisp clean sheets and daily maid service. Xavier at the front desk was very helpful in making dinner reservations and answering questions in general. The hotel is located close to restaurants,walking distance to the Rue Cler with its wonderful shops and there's a taxi stand close by. Also, you can catch the 69 bus down the street and basically sightsee for a while. . The continental breakfast was good (10 euro) croissants, pan au chocolat, plus yogurts,cereal, juices and coffee,tea or hot chocolate. I would not hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: MJVeale
Reviews.Content: Perfect spot for all the tourist stuff in Paris. One minute from the Ecole Militaire metro stop (#8 line) which connects with the rest of the metro system & train lines very easily. CDG airport to the hotel is 8 euro via the local rail (RER) & 2 metro lines. Takes about 45 minutes or so. We booked a package (via Hotel Club) which included breakfast. It was very nice continental - croissants & pain au chocolate & the strongest coffee in the world. Rooms not spacious but perfectly servicable. Ask for a high floor so that you can see the Eiffel Tower from your window!

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: sammy dog67
Reviews.Content: Celebrating our silver anniversary, we decided to come to Paris for 2 days. Only stayed here for one night, but found it a great location for visiting the Eiffel Tower which was our primary objective. Lovely room, very French in decor, the air conditioning wasn`t working on arrival, but was sorted out within the hour, by friendly staff. Metro and great bars/restaurants close by. We would recommend this hotel for any quick stop.

Reviews.Title: “A very enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our family of four stayed in one room for four nights. Now if two adults and two teenage girls can survive all that time together in one room, that says a lot. We rearranged a few chairs and tables and had plenty of room to move around in, although more closet space would have been nice. Loved the spacious clean bathroom. It had something not many hotels think about: a table large enough to put out our toiletries so that the sink and tub area stayed uncluttered. That was a real plus. Always plenty of towels. Good hair dryer. My in-laws from England flew down and stayed in another room (smaller but nice). Our room was exactly what I thought a Parisian room/flat would be, from the color palette to the shabby chic decor down to the balcony and the windows that opened to the street. There was never a lot of traffic, but this was August. It was air-contitioned, which was a plus, as it was very warm. Nice library to relax in between touring. Lovely neighborhood. We never felt unsafe, even if we were out walking at midnight. Loved being around the corner (literally) from the Eiffel Tower. We frequented the local bakeries for fresh croissants each morning and the hotel did a really great pot of coffee (the best we had while in Europe)...that was all we needed to get going. Loved several of the local cafes around the corner near the Metro for lunch...great to have several groceries nearby. Found a good laundromat a few blocks away. There were some homeless folks who frequented the area near the train station entrance, but it was good to show the girls that all is not perfect in this or any large city. Still, we loved the hotel and the neighborhood. The staff wasn't overly-friendly, but that's how I like it. If we ever needed anything they were ready to help. They were very helpful giving directions to us. There were plenty of families staying at the same time we were there. I would definitely stay there again. And my British in-laws enjoyed their stay as well.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable and lovely location”
Reviews.Author: Helers
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel from the moment I walked through the door and smelt the wonderful lillies on every side table. We were 3 women and stayed in a triple room. No view unfortunatly but then we didn't ask for one when we booked. The bathroom was wonderful and bright with a bath and separate shower and very very clean. We had 3 single beds, A/C amd mini fridge. Quiet neighbourhood with easy acces to the metro, supermarket, ATM, restraurants and within easy walking distance of the Eiffel Tower. Nice breakfast 3 different breads, juice, cereal, yogurt, jams and lovely coffee. Highly recommended

Reviews.Title: “Great room and what a view!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We had four women in a quad room. We had two double beds, two wash basins in the bathroom, tub and shower and a private toilet room. As soon as we walked into the room, we all said how much we loved it. The windows opened into the room and the view (if you put your head out) was wonderful. There was the Eiffel Tower in all its beauty. We were close to the metro, shopping and great restruants. The people at the front desk were helpful and friendly. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Charming and lovely”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: A business trip landed me in Paris for the weekend (lucky me!) and this was a delightful place to spend it. I know my room was larger than some others, with a nice double bed, a desk, and a large, newly remodeled bathroom. The bathroom was far nicer and larger than I expected - tub with shower, everything spotlessly clean. The large windows opened onto a little courtyard with pigeons cooing. I did not eat here - the hotel is a very short walk to several lovely cafes and the Saturday morning market in Rue Cler. Location was convenient to the Metro station and the neighborhood was safe enough that as a woman traveling alone I did not feel uncomfortable walking out to dinner at 11:00 pm. The desk clerks spoke English, and overall, it was very pleasant and comfortable. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Room not worth the price, but location a winner!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is not a hotel for those looking for style and luxury. Based on the room I got and some of the reviews I read before booking, it is a real mixed bag. The clean, well-lit bathroom was a plus and a true bright spot, but overall the room and its furnishings had a worn appearance. I suggest you bring your own soap or be prepared to buy some if you come with more than two people. Also, no wash cloths are provided. Although clean, the tiny w/c enclosure took some getting used to; my petite 10 year old said it made her claustrophobic! Hotel staff was always helpful when approached, but general customer service (smiles and greetings) as we went in and out was not enthusiastic. The best amenity of the hotel is definitely its location. It allowed access to an ATM, transport, attractions, restaurants and shopping. Terrific sights to see just walking in the neighborhood. During our visit, my three kids and I especially enjoyed walking to the lit up Eiffel Tower after dinner. It felt very safe to walk around. Although it might not be my first choice, I would be willing to spend another short stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: JaneA
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 3 nights. Our room which had 2 double beds, was a good size, clean and comfortable. We felt we got good value for our money for a hotel in a large city. We like to walk and the location was close to the Eiffel tower and the Seine river. A metro stop, Ecole Militaire, is just 5 minutes away. It is also a short walk away from Rue Cler, a pedestrian shopping street with lots of food shops and cafes. There were lots of good restaurants in the neighbourhood.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Enough”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed four nights with family of four. The hotel is in a nice residential area, not at all "touristy," but quite close to the Eiffel Tower. The room had two queens and a pull out sofa - ample for the four of us, but a little cramped with the sofa pulled out. The renovated bath, with double sinks and separate w/c was quite large and very clean, but the water pressure in the shower was poor, and the water ran hot and cold which made showering a little unpleasant. As far as the room itself is concerned, the furnishings and bedding were nice, the closet was great, but the brass light fixtures were in bad need of a polishing. The elevator was small, but nearly always available. The Rue-Cler shopping and restaurant district is wonderful - plenty of choices for dining. Although the Ecole Militaire metro stop is close by, this stop is on the very limited number 8 line which means you'll have to transfer once or twice to get almost anywhere. The desk staff was helpful enough, but certainly not overly friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, great location”
Reviews.Author: Greg00
Reviews.Content: Our family of four stayed in the quad. It was comfortable, and the bathroom was good sized. The halls are a little worn, but, the rooms are clean. The offered a breakfast for 10 euros, ok, but not a huge value. They should raise the hotel price 5 euros and offer it as included since paying 40 euros each day when our kids didn't eat half of their food didn't seem like a good value. We really liked the location, since it is a residential, tree-lined street, with very few people or noise walking around. The metro is just around the corner, and its a 5 minute walk to the Eiffel tower! Lots of restaurants in the area, plus a small grocery next door. The kids enjoyed buying snacks before they went to bed. The staff was OK, but didn't go out of their way to make you feel welcomed. It would be nice if they said "hello" when you walk in, or, nod if they are on the phone. Instead they were always messing with a printer or something behind the desk. It's a great value and we'd stay there again though.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Staff was very friendly. There were three of us and we had requested a room that would accommodate that number. The hotel gave us a room on the first floor which initially was worrisome but it was very quiet and spacious. The bathroom was great and newly renovated. I would definitely return to the hotel. The breakfast area is also pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in a great location in the 7th”
Reviews.Author: Mebrothers
Reviews.Content: In June 2005 our family of four stayed at Hotel la Bourdonnais in the 7th, and liked it very much. Nice-sized quad room for our family, with A/C and a lift. GREAT view of the Eiffel Tower from our little balcony (room 503). Friendly front desk, too. Offered a simple breakfast buffet, but we chose to go around the corner and visit Rue Cler in the mornings, for coffee, croissants, crepes and fresh fruit. A nice market next door to the hotel was handy, too. Metro stop on the corner, Batobus stop close by, too, at the Eiffel Tower. Even an ATM machine at the corner bank. Loved the location and the quiet, upscale neighborhood. An easy walk through the Champs de Mars to the Eiffel Tower.
